loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina I., Zakia M., Rehema M., and Helleni K. make up the Saana group. For the past 10 years, Amina I., the group leader, has run a shop selling traditional medicine. She travels in different parts of the country selling her products, and getting the medicine, as most of it is made from herbs. She and her group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase herbal medicine and sell products

loans.name: William

texts.en: William E. is a trader who sells clothing materials, ladies' dresses, creams and other things. His wife is also a trader and has 3 children. He wants to increase his sales to meet the increase in demand but lacks adequate funds. He is asking for $725 to buy more stock for his business to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41119

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Beata L.. She is married, and has three children, ages 6, 11 and 14. In 2005, Beata established her used clothing business. Beata has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the ocean from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything Western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah A. is married and has 8 children.  Elijah is a distiller and mechanic.  He buys sugar cane, processes it through the machine, then distills it.  Elijah is a very hard worker and also has several employees.  He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy sugar cane in bulk from the farmers so he can get a reduced rate.  Elijah was also kind enough to let us have a free sample of his fine product! Elijah is the treasurer of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane in bulk from the farmers so he can get a reduced rate.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41121

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Salima L.. She is married, and has six children with ages between 13 and 28. In 2002, Salima established her traditional African cloth business. Salima requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of traditional cloth. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasin

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina I., Zakia M., Rehema M., Mariam O. and Helleni K. make up the Saana group. For ten years, Amina I., the group leader, has run a shop selling traditional medicine. She travels in different parts of the country selling her products, and getting the medicine, as most of it is made from herbs. She and her group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase medicine to sell

loans.name: Magloria

texts.es:
Magloria sold clothes for a long time. From a very early age she worked in markets and streets as a traveling vendor. She worked in this manner, until she opened a stall in market "Central No. 3" in Huaycán. However, in recent years this work has not been very profitable. Therefore, two years ago, she decided to change from selling clothes to selling CD's.

Today, she sells movies, music videos and music discs of all kinds. When she began this business and with the idea of moving forward and progressing, in order to see her children in a good school, she thought it would be a good idea to open an additional stall, and did so.

So now she manages not only the CD's post, but also a vegetable store in the front. Fortunately with the help of her husband, that business has no problems. Now, with the idea of completing construction of her house and hopefully being able to rent rooms in the future, both are working harder than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Magloria vendió ropa por mucho tiempo. Desde muy joven ella trabajaba en mercados y calles como vendedora ambulante. Hasta que abrió un puesto en el mercado “Central Nº 3”de Huaycán. No obstante, en los últimos años este trabajo no le era muy rentable, pues no le iba bien. Por ello, hace dos años, decidió cambiar la venta de ropa por la de CD’s en el mismo puesto. Hoy en día vende películas, videos musicales y discos de música de toda clase. Al mismo tiempo de empezar con este negocio, con la idea de salir adelante, progresar y ver a sus hijos en un buen colegio, pensó que seria buena idea abrir un puesto más, y así lo hizo. Es así que ahora maneja no solo su puesto de CD’s, si no también una tienda de verduras al frente. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, por ese lado no tiene problemas. Con la idea de terminar de construir su casa y en un futuro poder alquilar cuartos, ambos trabajan más fuerte que nunca.

loans.use: Loan will be used to complete constuction of additional rooms in her house in order to rent them. (Terminar de construir cuartos para alquilarlos)

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Pendo M.. She is single, and has one child, age 3. In 2003, Pendo established her meat and beans business. Pendo requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of meat and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of meat and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Y. is a trader who sells provisions and soft drinks. Her husband sells fish. The couple has 5 children. Business is doing very well and she wishes to increase sales and expand her business. She is asking for a loan of $625 to buy more sacks of rice, oil, milk, Milo, soft drinks and other products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, milk, Milo, soft drinks and other products for her store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. has been selling new women’s clothing for the past 21 years.  She is married to an integrated officer who is currently stationed in Sierra Leone, and she has 2 children.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing. Beatrice is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41127

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Hadija R., Cecilia D., Upendo E., Edward M., and Hamisi R. make up the Hekima group. They are all residents of the Tabata area, a suburb of Dar Es Salaam.

Cecilia, the group leader, runs a shop selling food and other household items in the Tabata area. The group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Purchase food and household items to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
For the past 11 years, Angélica starts work early in the morning at her fish stand. She tells us that when the market opened she, like many others, decided to open a business. At the beginning she did not know what to sell, but her father, realizing that hardly anyone else was selling fish, recommended that she do that as she would not have any competition. And that is how she decided to sell fish.

Angélica is the mother of three children ages 28, 24 and 16 . They have always been her inspiration. Now that most of her children are adults, her hope is to see her son finish his studies and later on, open a business selling groceries. For this she counts on the support of her husband, who works as a laborer and who helps her at her stand on his days off.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace once años Angélica trabaja desde muy temprano en su puesto de pescado. Nos cuenta que cuando el mercado abrió ella, como tanta otras socias, decidió abrir un negocio. Al inicio no sabía muy bien qué vender, pero su papá al darse cuenta que no había casi nadie que vendiera pescado le recomendó que ella lo hiciera pues no tendría competencia. Fue así que se decidió por la venta de pescados. Angélica es madre de tres hijos de veintiocho, veinticuatro y dieciséis años. Ellos siempre fueron su inspiración. Ahora, como la mayoría ya son mayores de edad su deseo es ver a su hijo terminar sus estudios y mas adelante abrir un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero y que la ayuda en la atención de su puesto cuando tiene días libres.

loans.use: Make improvements to her fish-selling stand and purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Queen Silawe. She is married, and has six children with ages from 21 to 28. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her niece and nephew. In 1990, Queen established her fabric business. She earns about US $40 every month from this business. Queen requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah S. runs a popular general store in Elmina.  She is married to an electrician and has 5 children.  She has been running a successful business for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more provisions for her shop. Sarah is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41131

loans.name: Tobadina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Tobadina M.. She is married, and has four children with ages from 11 to 17. In 1998, Tobadina established her clothing and grains business. Tobadina has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing, rice, maize and beans. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing, rice, beans and maize.

loans.name: Teresia's Group

texts.en:
Teresia N., Amina S., and Zainabu S. are all residents of Tabata. They all run shops selling cosmetics in the Tabata municipal market. They have had their businesses for six years.

Teresia, the group leader, also sells soft drinks alongside the cosmetics business. They are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is an enterprising woman and the mother of a family of 11 children, who are 27, 26, 25, 24, 22, 21, 19, 17, 16, 16, and 14. Her husband is a mechanic, but since their family is extensive, his salary doesn't cover all of their expenses. To take good care of their children, Francisca started to sell products by catalog. Thanks to her effort, she has now become a promoter of this line of products, and two of her children help her with her work.

Due to low sales, she needs a credit of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to remodel her presentation area that she uses with her promoters. Let's support Francisca and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Francisca es una mujer emprendedora y madre de familia de 11 hijos 27, 26, 25, 24, 22, 21,19, 17 2 de 16 y 14años, su esposo es mecánico, debido a que su familia es extensa con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para los gastos familiares y sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que ella empezó a vender productos por catalogo. Gracias a su esfuerzo ahora se ha convertido en promotora de esta línea, y 2 de sus hijos la ayudan en estas labores.

Debido a las bajas ventas ella requiere un crédito de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el área de presentación que utiliza con sus promotoras. Apoyemos a francisca y su familia.

loans.use: To remodel her location.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca B. is single and has 3 children.  She has developed a very wide customer base for her general store.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy flour, rice, spices and eggs.  Demands from her clients have made it hard for her to keep her shelves stocked, so she hopes this loan can provide enough capital to accomplish this. Rebecca is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, spices and eggs

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41135

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Malia L.. She is married, and has two children, ages 3 and 5. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her niece and nephew. In 2007, Malia established her milling business. Malia requires a loan in order to purchase spare parts and oil for her milling machine. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and oil for her milling machine.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
At first, Isabel brought frogs from Huancayo to sell in Lima, until she finally decided to set herself up in Huancayo. Twelve years ago she stopped selling frogs and opened a stand for natural medicine in the Central Number 3 market. For the past twelve years she has been selling not only natural medicines but also extracts of frogs and other medicinal drinks at her stand in the market.

Part of her earnings go to her home and children (she has four adult children and one newborn baby) and the other part she reinvests. What she would most like to do now is increase her supply of products and in the future, to be able to move to another place to work, since she does not feel very safe where she currently is and a short time ago was the victim of a robbery.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

En un inicio, Isabel traía ranas desde Huancayo para venderlas en Lima hasta que se animó a establecerse en Huaycán. Hace doce años dejo su venta de ranas; sin embargo abrió un puesto de medicina natural en el mercado “Central nº3”. Actualmente, ya tiene doce años vendiendo no solo medicina natural sino también extracto de rana y otras bebidas medicinales en su puesto del mercado.

Una parte de sus ganancias lo destina para su casa e hijos (tiene cuatro hijos mayores y un bebe recién nacido) y otra parte la vuelve a invertir. Lo que ella más quisiera por el momento es aumentar su mercadería y en un futuro poder mudarse a otro lugar de trabajo, puesto que en el actual no se siente muy segura, hace poco tiempo fue victima de un robo.

loans.use: Increase her merchandise stock.

loans.name: Sabina's Group

texts.en:
Sabina M., Charles R., Ashura M., and Esther R. are members of the Waridi group, in the Tabata area. For the past six years, Sabina M. has run a charcoal store in Tabata area.

The group members are requesting a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Expand the charcoal business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Catherine M.. She is married, and has three children. Between 29 and 39 people depend on her for support. In 2004, Catherine established her cereals business. Catherine requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of maize, rice and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, maize and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Enala

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Enala M.. She is married, and has two children, ages 2 and 6. In 2000, Enala established her shoe business. Enala has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of shoes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her selection of shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Barnabas' Group

texts.en:
Barnabas L., Maria S., Repson R., Reya M., and Adam K. M. call themselves the Bees. They have been working together as a group for the past two years.

Barnabas L., the group leader, runs a shop selling food products and soft drinks. He has run this business for four years. The group is requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Expand the food shop

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana M. is an exemplary, hard-working young woman from the city of Saltillo, Coahuila. Owing to the precarious economic situation in which she was living, she and her sister had to start working when they were small, and as time went on they were successful. She now has a restaurant business, where 2 members of her families help her attend customers and do other chores.

Because of her efforts, Diana had some savings which she was going to use to remodel her commercial space, but her mother became ill and since there was not enough money for the hospitalization and medicines, Diana had to use her savings to take care of her mother.

Now she needs a loan of $1,125, which will be repaid in 6 month, to again take up her remodeling plans. With your contributions, Diana will be able to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Diana M. una joven ejemplar y trabajadora de la ciudad de Saltillo, Coahuila debido a la precaria situación económica en la que vivía fue que ella y sus hermana estuvieron que empezar a trabajar desde muy pequeñas, con el paso del tiempo han prosperado y ella ahora tiene un negocio de venta de comida, donde 2 de miembros de su familia la ayudan en la atención y labores de este.

A base de esfuerzo Diana tenía algunos ahorros que destinaria a la remodelación de su local, pero su madre enfermo y al no contar con dinero suficiente para la hospitalización y medicamentos que necesitaba tuvo que emplear ese dinero en la atención de su madre.

Ahora requiere un crédito de US $1125 que pagara en 6 meses para retomar los planes de remodelación. Con tus contribuciones Diana podrá realizar sus metas.

loans.use: Remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sala M.. She is married, and has three children, ages 3, 8 and 12. In 2006, Sala established her general retail business. Sala requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of small items, such as phone credit vouchers, peanuts and candy, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German lives with his wife and children, and rents their home near the end of the Buenos Aires San Martin area, in the city of La Paz. A year ago, German bought a car, which he is now using to run his taxi business. He works as a taxi driver every day. With the income derived from this business he manages the expenses of his family. He would like this loan to be able to make the necessary mechanical adjustments to his car and switch it from gasoline to diesel, and thus improve their income, since the price of gasoline is very expensive and the cost of diesel is much cheaper. This approach is being adopted by many taxi and bus owners, since the price of gasoline goes up every day.

German and was fortunate to get a prior loan through Kiva and payment of that debt has been fully met. His credit history qualifies him for this new loan since he is considered a good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

German vive en alquiler con su esposa e hijos en la final Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; hace un año atrás se compro un auto con el cual German trabaja como taxista todos los días. Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad mantiene a su familia y el crédito que solicita es para efectuar los ajustes necesarios al auto para cambiar de gasolina a gas y así mejorar sus ingresos ya que la gasolina es muy cara y el costo del Gas es mucho más barato. Esta modalidad está siendo adoptada por muchos dueños de taxis y micros en vista de que el precio de la gasolina sube cada día. German ya tuvo la suerte de obtener un crédito anterior a través de Kiva y el pago de dicha deuda ha sido efectuado en forma excelente. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.

loans.use: To convert his car/taxi from gasoline to diesel.

loans.name: Aifuwa

texts.en: Aifuwa M. lives in Benin City. He is 36 years old, married and has 3 children.  Aifuwa uses his motorcycle to carry people from place to place in his locality, He has been in this business for 2 years now. He now needs a loan of $625 to enable him to replace his worn out motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia M. runs a shop selling maize flour, both wholesale and retail. She buys her flour directly from the Azam, Tanzania’s biggest milling company. She also serves as a dealer for the company for other products, such as ice cream, bread, and wheat. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell and expand the business.

loans.use: Purchase more flour and items to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Mrs. Celestina lives on Alcides Arguedas Street, in the Alto Mariscal Santa Cruz area in La Paz. Her husband works as a chauffeur and she sells sportswear. She does not have a permanent sales post though, and sells while walking down the Tumusla Streeet every day, where they have street markets/ fairs daily.

The loan she's requesting is to increase her capital in order to buy more goods and improve her income, because although it's hard to believe, Celestina sells at least three or four "track suits" and jackets daily.

She has a good credit history and is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase more sportswear in order to sell through her business. (Compra de mas ropa deportiva para su negocio de ventas.)

loans.name: Dorisi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Dorisi N.. She is married, and has three children, ages 1 month, 3 and 5. In 2005, Dorisi established her liquor store and cereals business. Dorisi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Tepeyac 5 Group

texts.es:
Josefa de Jesus fell in love when she was 16 years old and had twin girls. Up until now her focus has been to take care of their daughters, but because her husband's income is very low, she has seen the need to undertake the business of selling shoes. She will use this loan to purchase additional shoes of various sizes, colors and styles and hopefully grow her business and bring in additional profits to contribute to her household expenses.

Mrs. Fatima de La Paz B. Yanez (who sells "toppers"), and Irene del Rosario M. C. (who sells blankets, bedspreads and bedding) are also part of the group known as TEPEYAC 5.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

JOSEFA DE JESUS SE ENAMORO A LOS 16 AÑOS Y TUVO GEMELITAS, HASTA EL MOMENTO SE HA DEDICADO AL CUIDADO DE SUS PEQUEÑAS HIJAS, SU ESPOSO TIENE UN INGRESO MUY POCO Y SE HA VISTO EN LA NECESIDAD DE EMPRENDER EL NEGOCIO DE LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS A PEDIDO, Y POSTERIORMENTE CONFORME EL NEGOCIO VAYA CRECIENDO ADQUIRIR ZAPATOS EN DISTINTOS MODELOS, NUMEROS Y COLORES Y DE ESTA MANERA ELLA PODRA CRECER COMO NEGOCIANTE Y OBTENDRA GANACIAS PARA CONTRIBUIR AL GASTO FAMILIAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO TEPEYAC 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA FATIMA DE LA PAZ B. Y. (VENTA DE TOPPERS) E IRENE DEL ROSARIO M. C. (VENTA DE COLCHAS, COBIJAS, SOBRECAMAS, EDREDONES).

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes. (COMPRA DE CALZADO)

loans.name: Baenka Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists in the purchase and warehousing of livestock feed which is then sold to livestock breeders in the towns and various neighborhoods of Dakar. We intend to set up sales points in the various neighborhoods where people raise sheep, goats, and chickens. In general, it is very productive to set up such a project since breeders have to find feed daily for their livestock or their poultry. This project will allow us to create work for all the members of the group, since each of us will be responsible for managing one of the sales points in our eco-village. Thus, thanks to Kiva, we will be able to create jobs for young people who will then no longer have to consider taking off by sea to immigrate illegally, incurring who knows what consequences.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Notre projet consiste à l'achat et au stockage d'aliments pour animaux d'élevage et ensuite les revendre aux élèveurs qui sont dans les villes et les différents quartiers de Dakar. Nous allons constituer des points de vente dans les différents quartiers de la ville où les populations s'adonnent à l'élevage de moutons, chèvres et poulets. En général, il est très intéressant de monter un projet pareil car tous les jours, les populations vont à la recherche d'aliment pour leur bétails ou pour leur poulailler domestique. Ce projet permettra de créer des emplois pour tous les membres du GIE, car chacun d'entre nous aura à gérer un point de vente d ans un quartier de notre écovillage. Ainsi, gr^ce à Kiva, nous allons créer des emplois pour des jeunes qui ne penseront plus à prendre le mer pour une immigration clandestine dont on ignore les conséquences.

loans.use:
Purchase of livestock feed

Achat d'aliments pour bétail

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad is living in her own house at Buenos Aires Avenue, in the area of Lomas de La Paz. Her shop is in her home, and she makes and sells food with the help of her sons and daughter in laws. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase products such as rice, noodles, quinoa, oats, etc., since food staple prices are rising daily due to the inflation phenomenon that the country is experiencing. She wishes not to raise the cost of lunch she sells because she's afraid she'd lose her customers.

Felicidad was first approved as a Kiva client in July of 2006, and has already paid off her first loan. She has good credit history and is described as a good customer, so she is approved for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Felicidad vive en casa propia en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; en su misma casa tiene una tienda, lugar donde realiza la venta de comida con la ayuda de sus hijos y yernas. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos como ser arroz, fideo, quinua, avena, etc., ya que los productos de primera necesidad están subiendo diariamente de precio debido al fenómeno inflacionario que el País está sufriendo y ella no quiere subir el costo del almuerzo que vende, pues perdería clientela. Felicidad ya fue aceptada como cliente de Kiva y recibió un préstamo el año pasado, el cual está cancelado en su totalidad. Su antecedente histórico la califica como buena cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es nuestro cliente desde julio de 2006.

loans.use: To purchase products to supplement her inventory (rice, noodles, quinoa, etc.) for her small restaurant. (Compra de insumos, arroz, fideo, quinua, etc., para su pequeño restaurant.)

loans.name: Evarida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Evarida T.. She is single, and has no children. In 2006, Evarida established her call center business. Evarida requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone credit vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Jabiri

texts.en: Jabiri A. is a 30-year-old resident of Tabata in the Buguruni area. For six years, he has had a shop selling different food products. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products to sell so he can expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar lives on the Avenue of Buenos Aires in the district of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz with her husband and son. She sells clothing, saucepans, baby clothes, and other products that she sells to customers on credit. They pay her in two installments and in some cases, on a daily basis.

The loan she requests is to increase the amount of capital she has since she wants to sell rice, noodles, and sugar as well. Her customers pay her in two or three installments when they buy her products.

Her credit history approves her for a new loan. She is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Pilar vive en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijo; la actividad que tiene es la venta de ropa, ollas, mantillas, productos que ella vende a pedido acomodando a crédito para que le paguen en dos cuotas y en algunos casos diariamente.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que ella quiere vender tambien arroz, fideo, azúcar, a sus clientes bajo la modalidad de cobros en dos cuotas o tres cuotas, para que sus clientes puedan comprar sus productos.

Su antecedente histórico la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, ya que es buena cliente.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc to sell to her customers on credit

loans.name: Luz 2 Group

texts.es:
Clementina has a business located inside a preparatory school where she sells typical regional food (empanadas, tamales, tacos, tortas, etc.) and snack foods (pork rinds, popcorn, corn with mayonnaise, etc.), which the students love. With a loan, she will invest in the purchase of cookies, soft drinks and other snack foods so that her customers can buy what they are looking for. This is how she works to survive and to be independent, as her children are now adults and have their own lives. She is 63 years old and has 8 children. She belongs to the Solidarity Group called Luz 2, along with Corona de Jesus, Silvia del Rayo and Mercedes del Refugio, who sell clothing; Alma Janet (shoes sales by order), Violeta de Jesus and Maricela, who sell perfumes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA CLEMENTINA TIENE INSTALADO SU NEGOCIO EN UNA ESCUELA PREPARATORIA EN DONDE VENDE COMIDA TRADICIONAL DE LA REGION (EMPANADAS, TAMALES, TACOS, TORTAS, ETC) Y GOLOSINAS (CHICHARRONES, PALOMITAS, ELOTES CON MAYONESA, ETC) QUE LES FASCINAN A LOS ALUMNOS DE LA ESCUELA, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, GOLOSINAS PARA QUE SUS CLIENTES ENCUENTREN LO QUE BUSCAN. DE ESTA FORMA TRABAJA PARA SOBREVIVIR Y SER INDEPENDIENTE YA QUE SUS HIJOS ESTAN GRANDES Y TIENEN SU VIDA PROPIA. ELLA TIENE 63 AÑOS, TUVO OCHO HIJOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO LUZ 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA CORONA DE JESUS, SILVIA DEL RAYO, MERCEDES DEL REFUGIO QUE SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA, ALMA JANET (VENTA DE ZAPATOS A PEDIDO), VIOLETA DE JESUS Y MARICELA QUE VENDEN PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS.

loans.use: Purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío is a very young woman. Regardless, at 25 years old, she manages her business very well. As a result of her marriage, she realized that it was necessary to have an additional source of income apart from that of her husband's since it was not enough to have only one of them cover their living expenses. Once she knew that she was pregnant, she decided to open a business in the market. Currently, she has already had 8 months of business selling clothes at her stall. Despite the new born baby who is a few months old, she works daily at her job. She does not believe the baby is an inconvenience; rather, th baby gives her strength everyday to leave for work. Later on, Rocío would like to have a store in the commercial district.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Rocío es una mujer joven; no obstante, a sus veinticinco años, maneja muy bien su negocio. A raíz de que casó vio la necesidad de tener una fuente adicional a su hogar a parte de la que tenía su esposo, pues muchas veces no era suficiente con el trabajo de uno de los dos para cubrir los gastos de la casa. Una vez que supo que estaba embarazada decidió abrir un negocio en el mercado y actualmente ya tiene ocho meses atendiendo en su puesto de ropa. A pesar de tener un bebe de pocos meses de nacido ella asiste diariamente a sus labores de trabajo. Ella no cree esto un inconveniente pues es precisamente su bebe quien le da fuerzas todos los días para salir a trabajar. Mas adelante a Rocío le gustaría poner un local en un centro comercial.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sells men's and women's clothing and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sell male and female clothes and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sell male and female clothes and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M., 34, is a tailor and runs her business in the Tabata Kimanga area. She has four tailoring machines and has employed two people to help her. She specializes in ladies’ and children's clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase another machine, and more materials so she can make more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase another tailoring machine and materials to make more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly lives on Adrián Patiño Street in the Tembladerani Region in La Paz with her children and husband. She works hard to sell shoes of every kind and has a stall in the city of El Alto. Here, she alone sells them at the flea markets on Thursdays and Sundays. The loan she requests is to increase the amount of capital she has, so she can restock her inventory to meet her many customers' demands. Nelly already had a loan from Kiva, which has already been paid off completely. Due to her credit history, she is approved for a new loan and qualified as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Nelly vive en la calle Adrián Patiño de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con sus hijos y su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de todo tipo y tamaño y tiene un puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto lugar donde vende solo en ferias que son jueves y domingos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder surtir mas su producto ya que tiene muchos clientes. Nelly ya obtuvo un crédito de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, se califica como muy buena cliente.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
With the idea of helping out with household expenses and helping her husband with the education of their children (who at the time were all minors) Vilma decided to open a business 12 years ago, and since then Vilma has gone to work every day at the market in her district. At her stand she sells all types of seasonings for cooking and also cleaning products.

Her husband works as a mechanic and fortunately always supports Vilma in everything. She has no limitations and plans to keep working as long as she has the strength to do so. For the time being, what she would like most is to be able to expand her store so that she has more space to put more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Con la idea de ayudar en los gastos del hogar y a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos (en ese entonces menores todos) Vilma decidió abrir un negocio hace doce años y desde el primer día Vilma sale a trabajar a diario al mercado de su distrito. Ella vende en su puesto todo tipo de aderezos para la cocina y también productos de limpieza.

Su esposo trabaja como mecánico y felizmente siempre apoya a Vilma en todo. Ella no tiene límites y asegura seguir trabajando hasta cuando tenga las fuerzas suficientes. Por el momento lo que ella más quisiera es poder agrandar su tienda teniendo más espacio para poner más mercadería.

loans.use: Expand her store in the market.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 21-year-old Eva C.. She is married, and has one child, age 2. In 2007, Eva established her fabric business. Eva requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Luz 3 Group

texts.es:
Clara Guadalupe is 35-years-old, and she has sold clothing in a small location in her home for 3 years. She goes to La Mesilla in Guatemala to buy her merchandise. She uses her income to support her children. She wants to invest the credit in the purchase of merchandise to avoid the expenses that are generated from traveling to La Mesilla. The other members of the group are Olga E. G., who sells clothing and decorative items, and Lucia G. G., who sells perfume.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

CLARA GUADALUPE, TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER ROPA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL QUE TIENE EN CASA, LA MERCANCIA LA VA A COMPRAR A LA MESILLA EN GUATEMALA, CON LOS INGRESOS MANTIENE A SUS HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA Y EVITAR EL GASTO QUE GENERA VIAJAR A LA MESILLA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: OLGA E. G. VENDE ROPA Y ARTICULOS DE DECORACION Y LUCIA G. G. VENDE PERFUMES.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to avoid transporation costs.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Señora Pascuala lives in her own home with her husband and children on Buenos Aires Avenue in Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. In her home, she set up a grocery store, which includes the sale of fruit. This gave her a satisfactory result, so she decided to make trips inland to bring large quantities of fruit herself to sell to retail merchants. Currently this activity gives her good income.

The credit she is requesting is to increase her capital and to be able to buy more fruit to bring to the city for its sale.

Pascuala's previous credit history qualifies her to obtain a new credit; she is a very good client. She has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Pascuala vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la Av Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. En su casa instalo una tienda de abarrotes incluyendo la venta de fruta, lo cual le dio un resultado satisfactorio por lo cual decidió hacer viajes al interior del país y traer ella misma la fruta en cantidad y vender a las comerciantes minoristas; actualmente esta actividad le redita buenos ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas fruta y traer a la ciudad para su venta.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es muy buena cliente. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To purchase fruits from producers to sell in the city.

loans.name: Trust

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Trust S.. She is married, and has four children with ages between 10 and 21. She has one dependent. In 2001, Trust established her clothing business. Trust requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo lives on Buenos Aires Avenue, in the San Martin area, city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and children. He owns a taxi with which drives every day in order to generate his income. The loan he's requesting is to purchase tires and to help maintain the good working order of his taxi so he can continue to generate income and support his family. Ricardo has a good credit history and has fully paid his previous loan through Kiva. He's qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo vive en anticretico en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos. El tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja todos los días generando así sus ingresos para subsistir. El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y mantener su herramienta de trabajo en buenas condiciones y continuar generando ingresos para la familia. Ricardo es cliente que ya tuvo un préstamo anterior a través de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado en su totalidad. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his taxi. (Compra de llantas para su taxi)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Señora Ana lives with her husband and children in her inlaws' house on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. The work that she does is selling cell phones of different brands, which is how she generates income. The credit she is requesting is to increase her capital and to purchase more cell phones because her sales are very good right now.

Her previous credit history qualilfies her to obtain a new credit. She has been a good client of ours since last year.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana vive con su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la venta de celulares de distintas marcas con la cual genera sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más celulares pues tiene muy buenas ventas.

Su antecedente Histórico la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es buena cliente nuestra desde el año pasado.

loans.use: Purchase of more cell phones to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
At first glance, Bertha appears older than she really is because at her 38 years, she has spent the better part of her life working. Since she was a girl, she has sold fruits and vegetables in different places outside of Lima to help her family. Once she formed her own family, she decided to continue with her work because what her husband earned as a laborer wasn't enough. This is why she opened a vegetable stand in the Huaycán market.

Today Bertha has attended to her numerous clients for 17 years, with the help of one of her three children. She never lacks clients because of her kindness. She assures us that her business is going well, but she would like to make it larger.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A primera vista Bertha aparenta tener más edad de la que realmente tiene y es que a sus treinta y ocho años ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida trabajando. Desde niña ha vendido verduras y frutas en distintos lugares fuera de Lima ayudando a su familia. Una vez que formo su propio hogar decidió seguir con su trabajo pues lo que recibía su esposo trabajando como obrero no era suficiente. Es así que abrió un puesto de verduras en el mercado de Huaycán.

Hoy en día Bertha lleva diecisiete años atendiendo con la ayuda de uno de sus tres hijos a los numerosos clientes que gracias a su simpatía nunca le falta. Ella asegura que le va muy bien en su trabajo pero que le gustaría agrandarlo.

loans.use: To obtain a larger fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Rosario lives in her parents' house on Buenos Aires Avenue in the zone of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. Her occupation is selling cell phones. She has a store on Eloy Salmón Street, a very commercial area of La Paz.

The credit that she is requesting is to increase her capital to be able to buy more products and to increase her income since this job is her only means of subsistence.

Her previous credit history qualifies her as a good client so she can receive a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosario vive en casa de sus padres en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de celulares, tiene una tienda en la Calle Eloy Salmón, un barrio muy comercial de La Paz.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y así poder comprar más producto y mejorar sus ingresos ya que esta actividad es su único medio de subsistencia.

Su antecedente histórico la califica como buena cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of cell phones to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam rents a place on the Ave of Buenos Aires in the district of Cota in the city of La Paz. Previously, she used to sell peanut products but that did not go well. Then, she decided to sell something different. Now, she sells CDs, which has improved her income. The loan she seeks is to increase the amount of capital, which is to buy more CDs and stabilize her business. Her credit history is very good and qualifies her for a new loan. She has been a client since July 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Miriam vive en alquiler en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Cota de la ciudad de La Paz; anteriormente su actividad era la venta de maní pero no le fue muy bien entonces decidió cambiar de actividad ahora se dedica a la venta de CD negocio con el cual mejoro sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más CDS y estabilizar su negocio. Su antecedente histórico es muy bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente nuestra desde Julio de 2007.

loans.use: to buy CD's

loans.name: Ikporo

texts.en: Ikporo F. is  44 years old, married and has 6 children. He lives in Benin-City, Edo-State with his family.  F. sells paint and has been in this business for 5 years.  He needs a loan of US $875 to buy more paint for sale.

loans.use: To buy more paint for sale

loans.name: Luz 4 Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, as everyone in her neighborhood knows her, is 41-years-old. She learned how to cook when she was very young, and has worked in this business for 5 years. She has an inexpensive, very small kitchen in her home from which she obtains profits to support her two children and to purchase products for her business. With this credit, she expects to buy utensils and merchandise for her business. The other members of the group are: Margarita P. V., who sells food; Claudia Imelda R. P., who makes clothing; and Julia G. G. and Jazmin Candelaria R. P., who sell shoes by catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

DOÑA ROSA COMO TODOS LA CONOCEN EN SU BARRIO CUENTA CON 41 AÑOS, DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO A COCINAR Y TRABAJO EN ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS TIENE UNA COCINA ECONOMICA MUY PEQUEÑA EN SU CASA DE LA QUE OBTIENE GANANCIAS PARA MANTENER A SUS 2 HIJOS Y COMPRAR PRODUCTOS PARA SU NEGOCIO, CON EL CREDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR UTENSILIOS Y MERCANCIA PARA SU NEGOCIO LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. MARGARITA P. V. VENDE COMIDA, CLAUDIA IMELDA R. P., CONFECCIONA ROPA, JULIA G. R. Y JAZMIN CANDELARIA R. P. VENDEN ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Baenka Group

texts.fr:
Notre projet consiste à la mise en place de différents points de vente de fourrage animale et d'autres  types 

d'aliments pour élevage. Nous avons constaté que le ravitaillement en détail des aliments de bétail marche t

rès bien, car les populations ont tendance à élever leur propre animaux domestiques chez eux. Ainsi, nous 

avons pensé qu'il serait judicieux de pouvoir disposer d'un stock de fourrage à proximité des populations. Ce 

projet nous permettra de créer des emplois pour tous les membres du groupe qui pourront ainsi disposer 

d'un point de vente chacun. Ainsi tout le monde sera occupé et personne n'aura le temps de songer à 

l'immigration. Ainsi les jeunes restertons sur place et participeront au développement de notre pays. Nous 

croyons que grâce à Kiva, nous pourrons tous travailler et gagner honnêtement notre vie.

loans.use: Achat d'aliment de Bétail

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés is a strong and hard-working woman whose continued efforts, at sixty years of age, are impressive. She goes on seventeen years of tending a poultry stand. She had worked previously in a chicken farm but, upon separating from her husband who did not help with the support of their seven children, she decided to work in the market. In this manner, with the passage of nearly two decades, she has worked arduously at her business in order to feed and educate her children.

Currently, she continues to work to support herself and one seventeen year old daughter as all her other children are now grown and living independently.

Little by little, she would like to increase her merchandise as she has now started to also carry personal hygiene products and cleaning supplies. In the future, her plan is to build a location where she can open a store since the market where she is currently located is experiencing legal problems and she runs the risk of losing her place.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, a sus sesenta años su trabajo es admirable. Ella lleva diecisiete años atendiendo en su puesto D. pollos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una avícola pero a raíz D. que separó D. su esposo y en vista D. que él no la ayudaba con la manutención D. sus siete hijos decidió trabajar en el mercado. Es así que con el paso D. estas casi dos décadas ella ha venido trabajando arduamente en su puesto para poder tener que darles D. comer a sus hijos y también brindarles educación. Actualmente ella continúa trabajando para los gastos D. ella misma y D. su menor hija que tiene 17 años y que significa su compañía D. todos los días, pues los mayores ya se independizaron. Poco a poco ella quiere ir surtiendo su puesto D. otros productos, por ahora ya comenzó con algunos artículos D. higiene personal y artículos D. limpieza. En un futuro su plan es construir un local donD. abrir una bodega, ya que el mercado en el que trabaja tiene problemas legales y corre el riesgo D. un desalojo.

loans.use: Move business to another location.

loans.name: Lucía Del Pilar

texts.es:
After the birth of her first child, Lucia left her work in a shop in order to take care of the child as she had no one to help her. As a result of subsequent discussions and problems with the father of her children, she decided to open a stand at the market selling candies/sweets. She ran this business for a year and a half until separation from her husband forced her to seek out a means to earn more as she now had two children to support.

For these reasons, and with help of a loan from EDAPROSPO, she switched from selling candy to clothing. She now has one year in this endeavor, and she plans to continue growing the business day by day until she can see her children (ages three and ten months) with a good education. Luckily, her children’s father is helping by temporarily giving them money. Despite this, she still feels alone in their care and must take them to work with her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Una vez que tuvo a su primer hijo, Lucia abandono su trabajo en un taller de confección para poder en cargarse de su hijo ya que nadie la podía ayudar. Sin embargo, a raíz de que las discusiones y problemas con el papá de sus hijos empezaron decidió abrir un puesto en el mercado vendiendo golosinas. Durante año y medio se mantuvo en este negocio hasta que la separación con su esposo la obligo a buscar un trabajo que le generara mas ganancias, ya que ahora tenia dos hijos. Es así que con un préstamo que EDAPROSPO le brindó cambio su puesto de golosinas por uno de ropa. Actualmente ya lleva un año en este rubro y planea seguir creciendo día a día hasta ver a sus dos hijos de tres años y 10 meses mayores y con un buen estudio. Felizmente el papá de ellos la ayuda dándole temporalmente un monto de dinero, de todos modos ella siente la falta de un apoyo para criar a sus hijos pues debe ir a trabajar todos los días con ellos.

loans.use: To be able to increase her merchandise/inventory.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
It's been eight years since Socorro began selling food, however she doesn't have a steady place to run her business so she's constantly changing her location. She's a hard-working woman who gets up every morning and tries to find ways to bring in more income to manage her household expenses. Unfortunately, three years ago she separated from her husband and now has to work twice as hard to support her small children.

Apart from working in the market in the mornings, each afternoon she works at home by cooking and doing laundry for others and cleaning houses. That is how her business began because she said that she was inexperienced and had no other choice, however this work isn't stable or profitable. Her goal in the future is to rent a room that can serve as a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace ocho años que Socorro atiende en su pequeño puesto ambulante de comida. Constantemente ella cambia su lugar de venta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se levanta todas las mañanas viendo siempre la manera de poder conseguir ingresos suficientes para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Lamentablemente hace tres años que se separó de su esposo, es por esto que ella debe trabajar el doble; ya que aun tiene hijos menores. Aparte de trabajar en el mercado durante las mañanas, por las tardes, ella ofrece sus servicios a domicilio tanto en la cocina, en lavandería y también en la limpieza del hogar. Es así como comenzó ella, pues en su poca experiencia ella dice que no tenía otra opción; sin embargo, afirma que no le gustaría trabajar estable como empleada del hogar porque no le es rentable. En un tiempo, más adelante, ella quisiera alquilar un local para tener un restaurante.

loans.use: To find a set place/ post in the market, where she can sell food. (Conseguir un puesto estable en el mercado)

loans.name: Esthela Viridiana

texts.es:
Estela T. is a single mother and has 9-year-old daughter. Due to a lack of income and the need to cover the expenses for her small child, she began to save and with a little effort built a business on part of her mother's property, where she began to sell tacos, soups, cakes, etc. With the expenses she incurred, she went bankrupt and had to close. Then, she began to sell secondhand clothes using a mobile cart to the transport the merchandise, combining this with the sale of food: hamburgers, hot dogs, and soups.

Now, she wants to reestablish her business in order to restart the food sales in her mother's house, rent her cart and continue selling secondhand clothing. For this, she is seeking $750 that she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Estela will be able to raise her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Estela T. es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 9 años, debido a la falta de ingresos y verse en la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su pequeña empezó a ahorrar y con esfuerzo construyo un local en la parte del frente del predio de su mama donde empezó a vender tacos, sopes, tortas, etc., por el gasto que hizo se descapitalizo, y tuvo que cerrar entonces se dedico a vender ropa en tianguis apoyada con un carrito móvil, en el cual desplazaba la mercancía, combinándolo con la venta de comida: hamburguesas, hot dogs y sopes,

Ahora desea volver a habilitar su local, para reabrir la venta de comida en casa de su madre, rentar su carrito y continuar con la venta de ropa en tianguis, para esto requiere de US $750 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Estela podrá sacar adelante a su hija.

loans.use: To remodel business.

loans.name: Vilma María

texts.es:
Vilma María Q., while still single, worked in a woodworking shop in Huancayo which is located in an area in the mountains. Once married, she moved to Lima. It was here where, with the aim of helping her husband in supporting the home and to improve her own situation, she decided to work.

She has spent the past nine years selling vegetables. What she earns from her business, she re-invests and uses for food for the family. Her husband cares for their five children, ages 15, 13, 11, 2 and 9 months. Despite the fact that he works outside of Lima as a miner, he is always attending to them.

Vilma hopes to, in a few years, open a general store and later on a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma María Q. Cuando aún era soltera Vilma solía trabajar en un taller de madera en Huancayo, un departamento de la sierra. Una vez que contrajo matrimonio se mudó a Lima. Fue aquí que, con la idea de ayudar a su esposo en la manutención de su casa y de poder superarse ella misma, se animó a trabajar. Actualmente tiene ya nueve años que se dedica a la venta de verduras. Lo que gana de su trabajo lo vuelve a invertir y lo destina para la comida de su hogar. Su esposo es quien se encarga de sus cinco niños, quienes tienen las edades de 15,13, 11 y 2 años y el último de nueve meses. Él, a pesar de que trabaja fuera de Lima como minero, siempre esta pendiente de ellos. Vilma tiene el plan de abrir dentro de unos años un puesto de abarrotes y, más adelante, uno de ropa.

loans.use: Open another store in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue purchasing recyclable items and products.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla A. is 42 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. Like many women in this part of Togo, she makes a living by smoking fish and re-selling her smoked fish to the local population. Her shop is in the central market of Avenonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Mrs. A. hopes to buy 10 cartons of fish to increase her stock. Also, with this loan she would like to build another pit to smoke more fish. She hopes to be able to participate more in meeting the needs of her family with the profits she will earn from the sale of her merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Abla est âgée de 42 ans , mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Comme beaucoup de femmes dans cette localité, elle fume les poissons pour consommations et les vendre à la population. Son magasin de fumage se trouve dans le marché d’Avetonou , un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit ,madame A. espère acheter 10 cartons de poissons pour grandir son étalage. Aussi aimerait – elle avoir ce crédit pour construire un second four pour le fumage des poissons. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use:
purchase 10 cases of fish and construct a second pit for smoking fish

acheter 10 cartons de poissons et construire un second four

loans.name: Cesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Cesilia M.. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children (a 12-year-old, an 18-year-old, and a 28-year-old). In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because her parents live in a remote area. In 2000, Cesilia established her general store business. Working seven days a week, and 13 to 16 hours a day, she earns about $50 each month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Cesilia has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, flour, and sugar in bulk. In the future, Cesilia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, sugar, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia is a woman who only seems to know the word “work”. She has never complained about any problems she has faced and, at the contrary, she thinks these challenges have made her stronger. Some years ago, she was the victim of a robbery at a grocery stand she had in the local market. The culprits left her with nothing to sell. As a result, she decided to dedicate herself to selling food in the market during the evenings.

Since it went well, she decided to rent another location at the market to work her small restaurant. Today, with the passage of time and thanks to her hard work, Aurelia has managed to re-open her general store as well as continue to run her restaurant. This work fills her with satisfaction but, what gives her the most pride, is to see that the fruits of her labor provide a good education for her two children ages fifteen and thirteen. Her goal is to continue to work until she sees her children complete advanced professional studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia es una mujer que solo parece conocer la palabra ‘trabajo’. Ella nunca se ha lamentado por los problemas que se le han presentado, al contrario, ella piensa que la han fortalecido. Hace unos pocos años fue victima de un robo en el puesto de abarrotes que tenía en el mercado hace trece años. Los malhechores no dejaron nada que vender. Fue por esto que decidió dedicarse a vender comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado, tarea que solo hacia por las noches en las afueras de su casa. Como le iba bien en este negocio decidió alquilar otro puesto en el mercado para trabajar su mini restaurante. Hoy en día, con el paso del tiempo y gracias a su esfuerzo, Aurelia ha sido capaz de abrir nuevamente su tienda de abarrotes y continuar a la vez con su puesto de comida. Este trabajo la llena de satisfacción, no obstante, lo que la enorgullece incluso más es ver que uno de los frutos de su trabajo es la buena educación que les brinda a sus dos hijos, una de quince años y otro de trece. La meta de Aurelia es continuar trabajando hasta ver a sus hijos con estudios profesionales.

loans.use: Adequately furnish her restaurant.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Caroline K.. She is 37 years old, married, and has one 2-year-old child. In 2004, Caroline established her clothing business. Working seven days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $320 each month from this business. She is assisted by her husband, sister, and brother. Caroline has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of shoes and traditional African cloth. In the future, Caroline plans to employ additional staff and increase both the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of shoes and African cloth.

loans.name: Cirila Alejandrina

texts.es:
Over the past twenty years, Cirila and her husband have made great strides and put in much effort to advance their business in the clothing trade. At present, they run a shop making sportswear and a large clothing store in Huaycán.

It was not easy for them to achieve this. Previously, she spent a good amount of time selling clothing as a street vendor in Ayacucho (located in the Peruvian mountains). Upon moving to Lima with her husband, they decided to continue with this endeavor. They sold their wares in various locations and always from the street, until they realized the risks in this type of informal activity and decided to more formally establish themselves by renting a location for their business. Little by little they increased their inventory and, five years ago, they opened their own shop for sportswear. This gave their business a good boost, although they assure it was not easy, and they have worked very hard to get to what they have today.

Despite this, Cirila dreams of more. She would like to sell clothing at wholesale in one of the largest commercial centers in Lima called “Gamarra”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirila y su esposo en los últimos veinte años han hecho crecer a grandes pasos y con mucho esfuerzo su negocio de venta y confección de ropa. Hoy por hoy, ellos manejan un taller de confección de ropa deportiva y a la vez, una tienda grande de ropa en Huaycán. No les fue fácil llegara esto. Anteriormente ella estuvo un buen tiempo vendiendo ropa como ambulante en Ayacucho (ubicado en la sierra peruana). Al mudarse a Lima con su esposo, decidieron seguir con este negocio. Estuvieron vendiendo en diversos lados y siempre como ambulante. Hasta que se dieron cuenta del riesgo que corrían como informales y decidieron establecerse alquilando un local para su negocio. Poco a poco fueron aumentando su mercadería. Hasta que hace cinco años abrieron su taller de confección de ropa deportiva. Esto ultimo les dio un buen impulso a su trabajo aunque aseguran que no les fue fácil, trabajaron arduamente para llegare a lo que hoy tienen. Aún así Cirila sueña aun con más. Ella quiere vender ropa al por mayor en uno de los centros comerciales mas grandes de Lima: “Gamarra”.

loans.use: Improve clothing shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Pura

texts.es:
Mrs. Pura T. C. has always had a keen sense of good business, and when she saw the lack of brick fabrication in her region, she decided along with her husband to begin such a business. Her efforts have made it possible for the business to grow. The bricks they produce are for different uses in house construction and are in great demand in the area due to their good quality.

Pura is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged sons. Her credit—$725 to be paid in six months—will be used to buy more molding machinery, gas to run the machines and firewood to heat the ovens. Pura feels happy and peaceful with the goals she has thus reached.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Pura T. C., socia del Banco Comunal “ Virgen del Rosario” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos, ubicada en la carretera a Carhuapoma barrio El Porvenir, producen ladrillos para distintos usos en la construcción de viviendas, considerados de muy buena calidad por los que tiene gran demanda en la zona Siempre tuvo una buena visión para los negocios, es así que viendo la falta que hacia una fabrica de ladrillos en la provincia decide junto a su esposo iniciar este negocio, que a la fecha a crecido bastante. El crédito recibido es de S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la compra de amoldadores para los distintos tipos de ladrillos que fabrica, y otros insumos para la fabricación como: petróleo para la maquina mezcladora, leña en grandes cantidades para el calentamiento de los hornos. Tiene 34 años, vive junto a su esposo y tiene 2 hijos varones que aun están estudiando, ella se siente tranquila y contenta con los logros alcanzados hasta hoy y con el esfuerzo ha podido crecer y aumentar su negocio

loans.use: To buy machinery and inputs for her brick manufacturing business

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo A., 33 years old, is married and the father of 5 children. To earn money and to send his children to school, he became a motorcycle-taxi driver. He picks up passengers on his motorcycle, drops them off at their destination, and charges for the trip. He runs his moto-taxi service in the area of Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his loan, Yawo would like to buy a new motorcycle to improve the quality of his services. This will allow him to respond to the demands of his clients and thus, earn more money to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A. Yawo, âgé de 33 ans, est marié et père de 5 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent et envoyer ses enfants à l’école il est devenu conducteur de taxi – moto. Il fait monter les passagers sur sa moto et les dépose à leur destination et prend les frais de déplacement. Il fait le taxi – moto dans la localité d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit , il veut acheter une nouvelle moto pour améliorer la qualité du transport. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase a new motorcycle

acheter une nouvelle moto

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja V. S., member of the Community Bank “The Virgen of the Rosary, sells "salchipollo" (a traditional roasted chicken dish), soft drinks and snacks. She operates her business out of her house on one of the main streets of Bellavista, where a great amount of customers come daily to enjoy her type of food. She started her business after receiving encouragement and borrowed materials from a family member. Using her first loan from the Community Bank, she bought a mobile stand and thus began growing her business.
