She now has steady daily sales, and with a six month $1,075 loan plans to buy more chairs and tables to expand her business. She also plans to stock more food with daily grocery items such as rice, sugar, bagged vegetables, canned food, and cleaning supplies, among other goods with high demand.

Maruja is an enthusiastic woman of 43 years, with one of her six children still living with her at home. She is happy to be reaching her personal goals. La señora Maruja V. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a ala venta de Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo , bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa ubicada en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maruja V. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a ala venta de Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo , bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa ubicada en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas. Se inicio en este negocio motivada por un familiar, quien le presto los materiales necesarios, luego al recibir el primer préstamo en el Banco Comunal compro su carrito salchipapero, iniciando así su crecimiento económico, hay en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 3000.00 que devolverá en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, comprará mas sillas y mesas para ampliar su negocio, y los insumos para la preparación de los productos que vende, además incrementara su venta de golosinas, con abarrotes de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar y menestras en bolsas, conservas en latas, productos de limpieza para el hogar y personal, y otros de mayor demanda entre sus clientes. Maruja es una mujer entusiasta de 43años, tiene 6 hijos, uno de los cuales vive con ella, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables to accomodate more customers; to buy more food goods to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Invertir en viveres para su negocio con la meta de poder empezar a construir un restaurante en su domicilio
Invest in supplies for her business with the aim of being able to begin to construct a restaurant in her house.

loans.name: Deny

texts.es:
Mrs Deny C. D. Rodríguez is a member of the Banco Comunal “ Mariscalense”. She lives in San Martín, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. Her business is located within her home on Jirón Progreso Nº 546. She runs a grocery store which sells general supplies, cleaning products, basic medecines, sweets and other products we all need on a daily basis. Thanks to the initiative of her oldest son she began selling eggs wholesale and retail. From this she moved onto more products, until she finally developed the business she has today. The loan of S/ 2000.00, which she will repay in 6 installments, will enable her to buy different types and brands of noodles, preserves, rice, bags of sugar, oil in litre bottles. These food products are in high demand where she lives, as well as beauty products, school equipment such as pens, pencils, erasers, books, as well as lingerie and fizzy drinks and sweets. She is 50 years old with three children, 1 girl and 2 boys. She is a very responsible woman. Her hopes are to develop her business and support her husband with the education of their children – this is her motivation to succeed in her business. She has a perservering nature and is confident in her abilities, which is why she hopes to build an ecological restaurant where she can sell traditional food from the area.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Deny C. D. Rodríguez,es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mariscalense” vive en la Región San Martín ,Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres , distrito D. Juanjui su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirón Progreso Nº 546, tiene una Bodega donD. venD. abarrotes en general, útiles y productos D. limpieza del hogar, medicinas básicas, golosinas y otros productos comestibles D. consumo diario. Por iniciativa D. su hijo mayor se inicio vendiendo huevos al por mayor y unidad a este producto fue incrementándose otros, hasta convertirse en el negocio que hoy tiene. El préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 el cualserá pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos D. distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y ,azúcar en sacos , aceite en botellas D. litros ; debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en el sector en el que vive, además D. surtir con productos D. belleza, útiles escolares como, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, cuadernos, vinifan, además D. lencería (ropa interior para damas) y bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, 03 hijos, 01 mujer y 02 varones, es una mujer muy responsable, sus deseos D. salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la educación D. sus hijos la impulsó a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Es perseverante y segura D. sí misma por lo que sueña con construir un restaurante ecológico en la que se venda comida típica D. la región.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia P. C. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Mariscalence”. She lives in San Martín ,Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. Her business is located in her home which she rents on Jr: La merced Nº 501, modified epsecially for this type of activity. And so, together with a group of women she manufactures drinks, mani and preserved sacha inchi. She started up her food business whilst in the police canteen, where she had to idea to continue selling, which then thanks to her perserverance and desire to succeed she was able to set up on her own premises. With the loan of S/ 2000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the development of her business with new cooking utensils, such as different size pots, crockery and cutlery. She will buy a glass display cabinet to show off her products, and she will also purchase non-perishable supplies, in order to increase the variety of food which she can offer her customers. At 53 years old, she is a very charismatic woman, happy to integrate in groups with other women who are partaking in any type of productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Rogelia P. C., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mariscalence”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en la misma casa que alquila, en el Jr: La merced Nº 501, especialmente acondicionado para este tipo de actividad. Así mismo junto a un grupo de mujeres se dedica a la fabricación de frugos, mani y sacha inchi confitados. Ella se inicio en el negocio de la comida dando pensión en el comedor de la policía, a partir de ello tubo la idea de seguir vendiendo, que luego gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante logra instalar su propio establecimiento de venta de comida diario Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio con utensilios nuevos de cocina, como ollas de diferentes tamaño, vajilla y cubiertos, comprará una vitrina de vidrio par exhibir sus productos, también comprará los insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela. A sus 53 años, es una mujer muy carismática, esta contenta de integrar grupos de mujeres que desarrollen algún tipo de actividad productiva,

loans.use: To purchase utensils for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Veronica K.. She is a 39-year-old widow who has two children (a 16-year-old and a 20-year-old). In 2005, Veronica established her beauty salon business. According to Veronica, her salon is the place where people go to buy any kind of hair (long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, etc.) and then to have it attached to their head, woven, and cut in order to make it look like their own hair.

She works extremely hard to earn about $360 each month from this business. Veronica has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase approximately $450 worth of haircare products and $150 of cosmetics. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase approximately $450 worth of haircare products and $150 worth of cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Martha Coyle

texts.es:
Martha Coyle R. G. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Picota”. She lives in San Martín, Picota province, Picota district. Her main activity is selling food, as well as fizzy drinks and offering a photocopying service, all of which takes place in her home located on Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 660. She is actually a teacher, she has reported that the people who visit the area cannot find somewhere to have their food, and so she decided to share her time between teaching and preparing and selling food. Now that she is retired, she dedicares all her time to the latter. With the loan of S/ 1200.00, which she will repay within 6 months, she will invest in buying supplies to make a variety of different dishes to sell and fizzy drinks in different flavours and sizes. Martha, 57 years old, only achieved what she has thanks to her charisma, and sense of happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Martha Coyle R. G., es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia del Picota y distrito de Picota, su actividad principal es la venta de comida diaria tipo menu, además vende bebidas gaseosas, y brinda servicio de fotocopiados, todos estos instalados en su misma casa ubicada domiciliada en el Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 660. Ella tiene la profesión de profesora ,se dio cuenta que las personas que visitaban la localidad no encontraban un establecimiento donde tomar sus alimentos, decidido compartir sus tareas de maestra con la preparación y venta de comida , hoy siendo ya jubilada se dedica por completo a este negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los variados platos de comida que ofrece y bebidas gaseosas en variados sabores y tamaños Martha, con 57 años, sola supo lograr lo que se propuso, con el carisma que siempre la caracteriza se siente feliz

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene is the mother of three children, whose ages are 15, 11, and 8. She has worked for 15 years selling articles for the home such as pots, utensils, plastic containers, etc. Nevertheless, she has worked for 6 years in the Arenera market in Huaycán due to the removal of street vendors.

Previously, she attended to a store where she sold candies and ice cream in the summer. She decided to leave this business because her first son didn't have anyone to care for him, and her store was very far from her house. This is why she started to work selling what little she had.

Currently, she has three children and has the help of her husband, who works in security, to maintain their home. She puts what she earns towards the construction of their home. In the future, she would like to open a store to sell jeans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yene es una madre de tres niños cuyas edades son de 15, 11 y ocho años. Hace quince años que vende artículos para el hogar como ollas, cubiertos, recipientes de plásticos, etc. Sin embargo, recién lleva seis años trabajando en el mercado “Arenera” de Huaycán debido a un desalojo de ambulantes.

Anteriormente, ella atendía una tienda vendiendo golosinas y helados, cuando era temporada de verano. Decidió dejar este negocio a causa de su primer hijo pues no tenia quien lo cuidara y su tienda quedaba muy lejos de su casa. Fue de este modo que empezó a trabajar vendiendo lo poco que tenía.

Actualmente ella tiene tres hijos y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como seguridad, para el mantenimiento del hogar. Lo que ella gana con su trabajo lo destina a la construcción de su casa. Más adelante ella quisiera abrir una tienda para vender ropa de jean.

loans.use: To obtain a stand in the market and to increase her merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new wagon.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Señora Gladis Pérez Munayar is a member of the Picota communal bank. She lives in the region of San Martín in the province and district of Picota. She has a business where she sells food in the La Marginal market, which is located on the Fernando Belaunde Terry highway.

The need to give a better education to her children is what motivated her to start her business of preparing food. Thanks to her perserverance and desire to get ahead, she achieved what she had set out to do.

With this loan of 800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of supplies to prepare the various dishes that she offers to her clientele.

She is 45-years-old, and her dream is to see her children become professionals. She also hopes to start selling chicken out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Gladis Pérez Munayari, es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio de venta de comidas se encuentra ubicado en el mercado “La marginal” que esta ubicado en la carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry .

La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida, que luego gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante logro lo que se propuso.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela.

Tiene 45 años, su sueño es hacer que sus hijos se conviertan en profesiones, y también desea instalar una pollería en su casa.

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi S. is the man sitting on the far left. The others in the photo are his apprentices who are learning the trade of tailoring. Mr. S. is 45 years old and the father of 6 children. His tailor shop is located in Avenonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, he would like to buy 3 sewing machines as well as fabrics suitable for men, to make clothes to sell to his clients. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to expand his business and with the profits he will gain from making and selling more clothes, he will be better able to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

S. Koffi est celui assis à l’extrême gauche. Les autres sont ses apprentis qui sont en train d’apprendre le métier de couture. Monsieur S. est âgé de 45 ans et père de 6 enfants. Son entreprise de couture est située à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, il désire acheter 3 machines à coudre et des tissus pour hommes pour revendre aux clients. Il souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son entreprise et par là participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la confection des vêtements.

loans.use:
purchase three sewing machines and some cloth

acheter 3 machines à coudre et des tissus

loans.name: Griselda's Group

texts.en:
Griselda is thirty-two years old and a proud mother of one boy and one girl who both attend school.  She leads a group of five women who operate various businesses in the Invicea community of San Cristobal.  Griselda sells an assortment of trendy silver jewelry.  She started her business about seven months agp with a loan her group took from FSMA.  The entrepreneur wishes to add new styles of jewelry to her stock.  This will help her  attract more people to her business, because she will offer more variety.  
The other members of the group are:
Jeniffer Pamela O. S., who will use her loan to buy shirts and pants for her clothing store.
Claudia R. M. will buy materials for her manicure and pedicure center.
Leticia N. will buy products to keep producing food for her customers.
Gabriela S. will spend her loan to buy chickens to resell.

loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry and other goods for various businesses

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Stela K.. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 12 and 23 years old. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because her parents live in a remote area. Stela owns a traditional African clothing business. She works extremely hard to earn about $240 each month from this business. She is assisted by her one employee. Stela seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of African cloth. In the future, Stela plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional African cloth.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs Rosario M. A. is a memer of the Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”. She lives in San Martín, Picota province, Picota district, address Jr: Comercio Nº 537. Her stall sells products to take away (fruits, bananas, herbs, yucca) wholesale, and is located in the entrance of the Abastos Market in the same area where she lives. Her daughters prompted her to sell these products which there is never a lack of in household, but due to the good quality of her products she has no problem selling them using her charisma and good customer service. With the loan of S/ 1200.00, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy bananas in bunches, yuccas in sacks, herbs by the kilo, and fruits from the area by the hundred. Also, making use of the maize harvest fields, she will buy maize to then sell at a higher price. Rosario is 43 years old with 5 children, 4 of whom have left the family home and 1 who works with her and for whom she is trying vey hard to develop a better future. She plans to open a grocery business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosario M. A., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, domiciliada en el Jr: Comercio Nº 537 ,su puesto de venta de productos de pan llevar (frutas, plátanos, culantros, yuca) al por mayor se ubica en la entrada del Mercado de Abastos de la misma localidad, Sus hijas la motivaron a vender estos productos alimenticios que ha diario no faltan en todos los hogares, por la buena calidad de sus productos vende sin problemas con su carisma y buen trato que da al cliente. Con el préstamo de S/.1200.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará plátanos en racimos, yucas en sacos, culantro en kilos y frutas de la región en cientos, también aprovechando la campaña de cosecha de maíz comprará este producto para luego venderlo a un mejor precio. La señora Rosario tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, 4 ya son independientes y 1 esta a su cargo con quien trabaja y por quien se esmera en salir adelante para brindarle un futuro mejor, dentro de sus planes esta en poner un negocio de abarrotes en su casa.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy yuccas, bananas, herbs etc.

loans.name: Waagmi Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists of producing food from seaweed. Recently, our research institutions have discovered additives to enrich common foods. We would like to produce these foods and enrich them with seaweed. We would like to make bread, pies, cakes, cookies and fruit juices with a seaweed component in order to improve the local community’s diet. This project will employ several people and allow us to provide opportunities for the young boys and girls in our village, who in turn will take over the business to distribute our products throughout Senegal. We are sure that, thanks to Kiva, our project will be a success.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Notre projet consiste  à la production d'aliments à base d'algue marine. Ces temps-ci, nos instituts de recherche  ont trouvé des additifs pour enrichir les aliments de consommations courantes. Et c'est avec ces produits là que nous voulons produire des aliments enrichis à base d'algue marine. Nous voulons produire du pain, des galettes, gâteux, biscuits et jus de fruits avec une composante en algue pour amélorer l'alimentation des populations locales. Ce travail va employer plusieurs personnes et nous permettra de trouver un débouché pour les jeunes garçons et filles du village, qui à leur tour prendrons la relève pour vulgariser tout ce travail partout au Sénégal. Nous sommes sûr que grâce à Kiva nous allons parvenir à réaliser ce projet.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in material such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Amadith

texts.es:
Mrs Amadith F. V. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Picota”. She lives in San Martín, Picota province, Picota district. She says spare car parts from her own home which is in Avendia La Pz, a good place to sell this type of product. She started up in business 11 years ago with an ironmongers business, which was not a great success which is why she decided to move on to selling accessories and parts for motor vehicles. With the loan of S/2 500.00, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy accessories and car parts such as batteries, side skirts, mudflaps, headlights, spotlights, clutch cables, brakepads. She is 46 years old, with 2 children. Her family has been her motivation.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Amadith F. V. es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”,vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, en su propia que se ubica la Av.La Paz, lugar propicio para la venta de este tipo de productos. Se inicio hace 11 años con un negocio de ferretería, que no tuvo los logros esperados por lo que optaron por la venta de accesorios y repuestos los propietarios de vehículos motorizados. Con el préstamo de S/.2,500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará accesorios y repuestos para motos y motocarros como: baterías, tapas laterales, tapabarros, faros, focos intermitentes, cables para embrague, zapatas para frenos, Tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, es su familia quien la impulsa a desarrollarse como mujer,

loans.use: With the loan she will buy accessories for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in furniture.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
When her children were still small, Dina sold ceramic decorations outside her house because she still had to be home to care for them. Some time later, fifteen years ago, she decided to start selling clothing as a street vendor. After she had to vacate her post, she acquired a location at the market in Huaycán. She does not utilize her space, however, and says that she doesn’t generate enough sales at the market and would prefer to sell in another market.

Despite the fact that her husband works as a construction worker, she says she must continue to work to help with household expenses given that her husband’s earnings are not sufficient to support the family. She would like to augment her merchandise and in the future obtain a post at the market where she actually works.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando sus hijos estaban aún pequeños Dina estuvo vendiendo adornos de cerámica afuera de su casa, pues debía cuidar también a sus niños. Poco tiempo después, hace quince años, decidió empezar a vender ropa como ambulante. Una vez que la desalojaron de aquel puesto adquirió un o en un mercado de Huaycán Puesto que actualmente no utiliza porque dice que no obtiene ventas ahí y prefiere seguir vendiendo como ambulante en otro mercado. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción, ella dice seguir trabajando para ayudar con los ingresos a su hogar, pues con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente. A ella le gustaría aumentar su mercadería y en un futuro conseguir puesto en el mercado en el que actualmente trabaja.

loans.use: Increase her merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr:
Mr. Mensah V. is 29 years old and the married father of 2 children. He is a sculptor and is one of a number of sculptors in this region. He sculpts domestic and wild animals in wood. His shop is located in Aventonou, well placed on the side of a road frequented by tourists. With this loan, he would like to buy 50 blocks of wood to expand his merchandise and vary the types of his sculptures. This will allow him to increase his sales, earn more money, and respond to the needs of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur V. Mensah est âgé de 29 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est sculpteur et fait partie de la gamme de sculpteurs dans la région. Il sculpte les animaux domestiques et sauvages en bois. Son magasin de sculpture est localisé à Avetonou, bien situé au bord de la route faisant face au passage des touristes. Avec ce crédit, il veut acheter 50 grumes de bois pour étendre et varier les types de sculpture. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use:
purchasing 50 blocks for wood for sculpting

acheter 50 grumes de bois

loans.name: Diocelina

texts.es:
Mrs Diocelina González García is a member of the Banco Comunal Picota. She lives in San Martín, in Picota province, Picota district, in the area Las Almendras Manzana H, Lot 12. She sells maize wholesale and retail, banana flour, business which she carries out in her own home. In order to produce the banana flour she uses a small electric machine. She also has a business selling dry maize which is profitable, with a high demand both within and outside Picota. With the requested loan of S/ 1500.00 which she would pay back within 6 months, she will buy dry maize by the tonne to be marketed in nutritionally-balanced food factories. She is 49 years old, with 5 children, 3 of whom still live with her. She feels well in herself and happy to be achieving what she has always wanted, a developing business, seeing her children grow up to be professionals. In the future she wants to have premises to be able to store the maize she has bought large quantities of.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Diocelina González García es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, domiciliada en la urbanización Las Almendras Manzana H, Lote 12, se dedica a la venta de maíz al por mayor y menor , harina de plátano negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Para producir la harina de plátano utiliza una pequeña maquina eléctrica, también tiene el negocio de la venta de maíz seco que es rentable, con mucha demanda tanto dentro y fuera de Picota, Con el préstamo solicitado S/ 1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara maíz seco en toneladas para ser comercializado en las fabricas de alimentos balanceados Tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven con ella, se siente bien y contenta de estar logrando lo que siempre quiso, que su negocio salga adelante y ver a sus hijos profesionales, en el futuro piensa poner un local para ir almacenando el maíz comprado en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy dry maize

loans.name: Johanny Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Johanny Felicia is twenty-nine years old and the coordinator of a group of five active women that carry on businesses in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  Johanny and her husband (a blacksmith) have four children, ranging from four to thirteen years old, all of whom attend school.  She has a butcher shop which she started about thirteen months ago.  The entrepreneur says that her shop is well established in the community and she’s not afraid of the competition.  Johanny doesn’t raise livestock, so she has to constantly purchase animals in order to keep operating her business.  She hopes her business will allow her and her husband to improve their family’s lifestyle.
The other members of the group are:
Violeta J. La Fler, who spend her loan to buy various products to prepare natural juices and other goods.
Ana Josefa C. will buy livestock for her butcher shop. 
María Nelly M. K. and Cristina Caleises S. will buy metals and aluminum sheets to resell.

loans.use: To purchase animals for a butcher's shop.  Also to buy various products for the other members of the group.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice at wholesale price.

loans.name: Edither

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Edither K.. She is 29 years old, married, and has one 3-year-old child. Edither owns a clothing and cosmetics business, and she works extremely hard to support her family. Edither seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of shoes, cosmetics, bags, and clothing. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of shoes, clothes, bags, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a member of "The Carnations" communal bank and lives in Picota in the San Martín region of Peru. She's dedicated to making popular regional dishes as well as accompaniments like grilled plantains, which she does out of her home until customers line up for the food every afternoon. She's been doing this for 19 years because she likes the work and wants to make headway with her only daughter by her side. With hard work and perseverance she learned to balance her time well between running her business and her home.

With the $375 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase chicken, pig intestines, plantains, yucca and firewood so she can keep up her work.

Delia is a very enthusiastic and happy 55-year-old. She is happy and comfortable with what she has accomplished and is still doing. In the future she wants to incorporate cold products into her business, which her daughter will run when she is older.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Delia Chistama S. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Los Claveles”, vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la preparación al carbón de vísceras de cerdo, asimismo a la venta de anticuados que los acompaña con plátanos verdes asados, todo esto en su propia casa que esta ubicada en el Jr. Grau 1ra cuadra, de la localidad de Picota, hasta donde llega cada tarde gran cantidad de clientes. Hace 19 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo hace por que le gusta y quiere sacar adelante a su única hija que esta a su lado, con la constancia y perseverancia supo manejar bien su tiempo tanto para administrar su negocio como su hogar. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará pollos en jabas, vísceras de cerdo por kilos, plátano en racimos, yuca en kilos, leña en tercios para que así no le falte a la hora de preparar, Delia es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 56 años, se siente tranquila, cómoda, feliz de lo que ha logrado y lo sigue haciendo, en el futuro quiere poner un negocio de venta de refrigerios para que su hija cuando sea mayor lo administre

loans.use: Purcahse ingredients like plantains, yucca, etc. to make her dishes / Con el prestamo comprara platanos, yucas ,etc para la elaboracion de sus productos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more rice.

loans.name: Nila

texts.es:
Nila is a member of "The Angels" communal bank and lives in Picota in the San Martín region of Peru. She is dedicated to selling groceries (fruit, vegetables, etc.) at her post in the city's wholesale food market and also sells hens at her home. She started her business with the support of her daughters, selling a few products, and little by little she was able to get to where she is thanks to a lot of hard work and perseverance.

With the $375 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, beans, regional fruits and vegetables, and also hens.

Nila is 51 years old and lives with her husband and one of her three daughters, whom she worked so hard for to provide a better future. She feels good about her plans to better supply her business to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nila García M., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de, abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, en su puesto del mercado de abastos de la ciudad, asimismo en su casa vende gallinas de chacra. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de sus hijas, vendiendo algunos productos, que poco a poco fue aumentando hasta lograr lo que ahora tiene con mucha constancia y perseverancia. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de: arroz, azúcar, frijoles en sacos, frutas y verduras de la región como: sapotes en cientos, plátanos verdes en racimos, papaya en cajas y también comprará gallinas. Tiene 51 años vive con su esposo y una de sus 3 hijas por quien se esmera en salir adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor, ella se siente bien, tranquila, dentro de sus planes es surtir mas su negocio de acuerdo a la exigencia del cliente

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, regional fruits and vegetables, etc. / Con el prestamo comprara frijoles,azúcar,etc para su venta

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Gisela M.. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children (a 6-year-old and an 8-year-old). In 2006, Gisela established her stationery business. She works extremely hard to earn about $90 each month from this business. Gisela seeks a loan in order to purchase toners, USB sticks, and CD writers. She thanks you for your support.

Gisela is constantly amazed by the foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management. She feels fortunate to own and operate a stationary sales business where she is exposed to the wisdom of various business people because they have their shops, stalls, tables, or bodies strategically located near her business and near post offices, banks, schools, and universities.

loans.use: To purchase printing toners, USB sticks, and a CD writer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase capital to invest in rice stock

loans.name: Niurka María's Group

texts.en:
Niurka María is an influential woman in her community and the leader of a group of five businesswomen in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  To support her unique son, she sells homemaD. sweets and candies.  The entrepreneur has been running this activity for two years.  Niurka explains that she has good experience running her business and a well established clientele.  So, she iwishes renting a small local (place from which to sell) to run the business.  That will allow her to offer a more comfortable service to her clientele and attract more people.  With her loan, Niurka will buy more materials to prepare her delicious sweets and candies.
The group is composed as well by:
Augustina D. L. C. M. and Augustina D. L. C. M., twin sisters (with the same name), who sell men’s and women’s clothing.
GracieL. S., an owner and operator of a small cafeteria.
Cecilia D. L. C. S. who retails sewing cloth in the same community.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a pastry shop.  Also to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more sale stock

loans.name: Masan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Masan T. is 39 years old and is the married mother of 5 children. She operates a restaurant in the central market of Avenonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, she hopes to buy 5 bags of rice, 2 tins of cooking oil, and 5 cartons of canned tomatoes for the preparation of traditional dishes. She hopes to sell these dishes to vendors at the market. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase the capacity of her restaurant so that she can better respond to the needs of her family using the profits made by selling these traditional dishes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Masan est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle opère en restaurant au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 5 cartons de tomates en boîtes pour la préparation des plats traditionnels. Elle espère revendre ces plats aux commerçants et revendeurs du marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en restauration et par là participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses plats.

loans.use:
purchasing 5 bags of rice, 2 tins of cooking oil, and 5 cartons of tomatoes

acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 5 cartons de tomates

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dany is a member of the "Winning Women" communal bank and lives in San Martín in the Bellavista region of Peru. She's dedicated to selling items for primary need at a store run out of in her home, which she has been doing for the past eight years.

With the $900 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she hopes to purchase different kinds of products to add more variety to her store, like rice, sugar, oil, condensed milk and other brand-name items. She also has a photocopier in her store and wants to buy paper for it because it is a good part of her business since she is located in front of a school.

Dany is 29 years old and has two children — one boy and one girl — both of whom are still minors. Her husband helps her with her work and with the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dany G. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Triunfadoras” , vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Bellavista, distrito de Bellavista se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un local propio ubicado en su casa en la esquina de los Jirones Loreto y Moquegua sector del 3er Piso en la localidad de Bellavista, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.el cual pagara en 6 meses desea comprar diferentes tipos de productos para surtir su negocio como arroz en ( 3 sacos ), azúcar ( 3 sacos ) 3 cajas de aceite en frascos, leche evaporada ( 3 cajas ) y de diferentes marcas, para que haya variedad de productos en su negocio, ella también en su mismo local tiene una maquina de sacar fotocopias, así que desea comprar también papel bond (3 millares ) ya que es un muy buen negocio ya que su local esta ubicado frente a una escuela. Ella tiene 29 años y tiene 2 hijos 1 varón y 1 mujer los cuales todavía son menores, es su esposo el que la ayuda en la atención y en las tareas domesticas del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.) for her store / Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para surtir su tienda

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Fatuma A.. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. In 2005, Fatuma established her general store business. Working seven days a week, and 9 to12 hours a day, she earns about $430 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband, children, and one employee. Fatuma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soap, rice, sugar, biscuits, and cloth. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $175. In the future, Fatuma plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks (e.g., soap, rice, sugar, biscuits, and cloth) in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabric and thread

loans.name: Hilda Marina

texts.es:
Hilda is a member of the "Winning Women" communal bank. She lives in San Martin in the Bellavista region of Peru. She is dedicated to hair cutting and personal care in a small shop she owns. She has been in the business for nine years, gaining the confidence of her clients thanks to her good service and availability. She also tends to customers at home.

With the $1,075 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she hopes to buy supplies for her business like chemicals for perms, hair dye, curlers, new clippers, nail polish and other beauty products such as lotions, facial creams, makeup and a mirror.

Hilda is 51 years old, has one child who is studying at a university and is her pride and joy. She feels very good about all she has achieved — she has been a widow for the last nine years — and she has done it all on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hilda Marina F. F. , es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Triunfadoras” , vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Bellavista, distrito de Bellavista , ella se dedica al corte de cabello y arreglo personal en un pequeño centro de cosmetología que tiene en un local propio ubicado en su casa Prolongación carretera a San Pablo 2do Piso la localidad de Bellavista, ella ya se dedica a este negocio desde hace 9 años, ganándose la confianza de sus clientes gracias a su buena atención y a la disponibilidad que ella tiene, también atiende a sus clientes a domicilio. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que pagara en 6 meses, desea comprar los materiales que usa para su negocio como son ácidos para poder hacer los permanentes, tintes para cabello, rizadores de cabello, nuevas tijeras, esmaltes y otros productos de belleza como lociones, cremas de cara, productos de maquillaje, y 1 espejo mas para su local. Ella tiene 51 años, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando en la universidad y quien es su orgullo, se siente muy feliz por todo lo logrado ya que ella es una mujer viuda desde hace 9años, y todo lo que ha logrado lo ha hecho con su propio esfuerzo

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies / Con el prestamo comprara materiales para su negocio

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her store's stock

loans.name: Saak Guiss Group

texts.fr:
We are group of women who live in the ecovillage of Palmarin. We would like to begin producing and selling processed food products (peanut butter, couscous, beans and salt). We are available to work and would like to be able to supply the entire village with food products. The fishermen who go out to sea need to be nourished with food that can sustain them for days in a humid climate. That is why we would like to be their supplier. To do so, we would like to build a storage house, upgrade our salt extraction equipment and have capital to be able to purchase raw materials. 

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui habite l'écovillage de Palmarin. Nous  voulons nous activer sur la production et la vente de denrée alimentaire transformée( pâte d'arachide, couscous, haricot, et sel.) Nous sommes très disponible et souhaitons que nous puissions fournir tout le village en denrée alimentaire. Les pêcheurs qui vont en mer ont besoins d'être ravitaillé en nourriture qui puisse tenir des jour en milieu humide. C'est pour cela que nous souhaitons être leur fournisseur. C'est ainsi que nous voulons construire un magasin de stockage, renouveler notre matériel d'extraction de sel et avoir un fond qui nous permet d'acheter de la matière première.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food production: peanuts, black-eyed peas and millet

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is a member of the "Winning Women" communal bank. She lives in San Martin in the Bellavista region of Peru. She has run an occupational center dedicated to teaching hair dressing and personal care in a property she owns for the past two years.

With the $725 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she hopes to purchase all the items her pupils need in her various courses, since the classes in her center started in March. They need items such as combs, clippers, curlers, chemicals, hair dyes and makeup, which they can purchase at the center.

Mariela is 46 years old and has five children — four girls, one boy — who are her priD. and joy. She is very happy with this part of her life and hopes to be able to enlarge her business as well, for which she is taking a course to validate the training she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mariela S. M. D. Paredes es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Triunfadoras” , vive en el departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. Bellavista, distrito D. Bellavista ella es dueña D. un centro ocupacional , donD. se dedica a la enseñanza D. cortes D. cabello y arreglo personal en un local D. su propiedad ubicado en la Prolongación carretera a San Pablo 2do Piso al frente D. la I.E. 180 en la localidad D. Bellavista, ella ya se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 2 años, Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, desea comprar todos los artículos que necesitaran sus alumnos en las diversas clases que realizaran ya que las clases en su centro D. enseñanza iniciaran en el mes D. marzo, como son estuches D. peines, estuches D. tijeras, rizadores, ácidos, tintes para cabello, y productos D. maquillaje, ya que los alumnos adquieren estos productos en el mismo centro D. enseñanza Ella tiene 46 años, tiene 5 hijos 1 varón y 4 mujeres, los cuales son su orgullo, ella se siente muy feliz con esta meta lograda en su vida y espera poder ampliar mas su negocio, ya que para ello ella esta tomando un curso en un centro D. estudios para poder convalidar los estudios realizados que hasta el momento tiene.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies for her occupational center / Con el prestamo comprara materiales para su negocio

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Asha P.. She is 37 years old, single, and has three children (between the ages of 10 and 14 years old) as well as one other dependent. In 2000, Asha established her general store business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $170 each month from this business. She is assisted by her children. Asha has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. In the future, Asha plans to incrase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve and accomodate her business premises

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Gabriela F. Q. is a responsible women: one can note the growth she has had as a businesswoman: she has worked in commerce since her girlhood; she moved to Xenacoj municipality, her husband’s home-town; she opened a shop selling various products but her neighbours began to compete with her and as a result she decided to move her business to her son’s wife and with the help of her daughter-in-law serving in the store they found a good location in the suburb where her son and daughter-in-law live: a little removed from the village and there are no other stores. It is already stocked but there has been demand for other products, for which investment is needed in order to have a good quantity and variety of the items her customers are asking for.

Currently, she sells snacks in the park in the afternoons in the village of Sumpango, her home town, in order to obtain extra money which she can invest in the store.

She is mother to six children which help her with her sales, what she wishes to do is to be of supprt to other people in her community.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Gabriela F. Q., es una mujer responsable puede notarse en el crecimiento que ha tenido como empresaria, ha trabajado en comercio hace años desde su juventud; se traslado al municipio Xenacoj; de donde su esposo es originario; ella abrió una tienda de productos varios pero sus vecinos empezaron a hacerle competencia por lo que decidió trasladar el negocio a la casa de su hijo y con la ayuda de su nuera atenderían la tienda encontraron una buena ubicación en la colonia donde vive su hijo y su nuera es un lugar retirado del pueblo no hay mas tiendas ya esta surtida pero hay demanda de otros productos por lo que necesita invertir para tener cantidad y variedad de artículos lo que la clientela pide.

Actualmente atiende una venta de refacciones en las tardes en el parque del pueblo de Sumpango de donde ella es originaria, para obtener un dinero extra y pueda invertir en la tienda.

Es madre de seis hijos quienes le apoyan a las ventas que ella tiene, lo que desea es ser de apoyo a otras personas en su comunidad.

loans.use: Business capital, purchase of essential products

loans.name: Tatu

Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Tatu C.. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 22 years old. In 2005, Tatu established her general store business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours per day, she earns about $170 each month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Tatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. In the future, Tatu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mariamu K.. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because she is in school and her parents live in a remote area. In 2004, Mariamu established her general store business. She is assisted by her children. Mariamu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase a machine to process traditional herbs. In the future, Mariamu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in school products for start-of-school demand

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth belongs to the Progress Communal Bank. She has a business making cleaning products, located in Ancash in the Huaraz region of Peru. She is 39 years old, married and has three children; her husband helps her with the work and the children's education.

With the $225 loan, which she plans to repay in four months, she will purchase 20 liters of pine oil, 20 kilograms of fragrances and 6 of dyes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margoth, pertenece al Banco Comunal el progreso, tiene su negocio de elaboración de productos de limpieza, su negocio esta ubicado en el Pasaje alva Jurado 1091,ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 20 litros de Aceite de Pino, 20 kilos de Esencias, 6 sobres de colorantes. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, ambos comparten el trabajo, y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cleaning supplies / Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para su negocio

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Sophia H.. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children (a 3-year-old and a 9-year-old). In 2007, Sophia established her tailoring and clothing business. She works very hard to earn about $30 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband. Sophia seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing. In the future, Sophia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes.

loans.name: Bocc Jeff Group

texts.fr:
We would like to purchase dying products to dye and then sew, embroider and knit clothing in order to make high-quality products that we will sell to tourists, as we live in a seaside region that welcomes many visitors every day. With this loan, we would like to train young village girls in order to keep them from being seduced by the big city and to provide them with training they can use for the rest of their lives. Our goal is to rent a location to use as a training and production workshop. This is a contribution that we will make to the development of our town and also to the fight against poverty, rural exodus and illegal immigration, a problem that has plagued our seaside region. 

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous voulons acheter des produits de teinturerie pour teindre les habits. ensuite les coudre, les broder, les tricoter pour avoir un produit de bonne qualité que nous allons vendre aux touristes puisque que nous habitons une zone balnéaire qui reçoit beaucoup de visiteurs tous les jours. Nous souhaitons grâce à ce prêt, former des jeunes filles du village afin d'éviter qu'elles ne tombent dans les mirages des grandes villes et leur donner une formation qui pourra leur servir pour toute leur vie. Ce qui fait que nous allons louer un site pour en faire un atelier de formation et de production. Ceci consiste à une contribution que nous allons apporter au développement de notre localité et aussi participer à la lutte contre la pauvreté, l'exode rural vers les grandes villes et lutter contre l'émigration clandestine car notre zone étant maritime, a été souvent victime de ce fléau.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread and dyes

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.ru:
Señora Yesenia belongs to the San Martín de Porras communal bank. She sells clothing, and she delivers her merchandise to her clients' homes in the district and province of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 dozen women's polo shirts, 1 dozen sweaters, 1 dozen pairs of pants, and 1 dozen purses.

She is 20-years-old, is married, and is 4 months pregnant. For now, she lives with her inlaws. Her husband does temporary jobs as a painter and locksmith. They work together to pay for the costs of her pregnancy and the home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Yesenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta ropa, ella entrega su mercaderia a domicilio, en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 1 docena de polos para damas, 1 docena de chompa , 1 docena de pantalones y 1 docena de carteras.

Ella tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente, esta embarazada de 4 meses, por ahora vive con sus suegros, su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales como pintor, cerrajero, ellos trabajan juntos para poder solventar los gastos de su embarazo y gastos del hogar.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María belongs to the San Martín de Porras Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of food, clothes and orange juice in Bethlehem Plaza of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen pants, 2 dozen coats, 1 dozen polos and ½ dozen blouses.

She is 42 years old of age, married with 6 children. Her husband does not contribute to the expenses of the home. She alone is the one who pays for the expenses of the home and education of her children. She also changes her business according to the season. For example, she is now selling orange juice.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de comida, ropa y jugo de naranja, en la Plaza de Belén del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 2 docenas de pantalones, 2 docenas de casacas, 1 docena de polos, ½ docena de blusas.

Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, su esposo no colabora con los gastos del hogar, ella sola es quien mantiene a su hogar y educación de sus hijos, ella también cambia de negocio de acuerdo a la temporada, por ahora esta vendiendo jugo de naranja.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store, such as pants, coats, polos and blouses.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Nuru K.. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because he is in school and his parents live in a remote area. In 2007, Nuru established her market stall business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $160 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband and two employees.

Nuru has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase beans, nuts, and onions in bulk for her market stall. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $45.

In the future, Nuru plans to diversify her business. For example, she would like to start a charcoal-selling business: these small, black, dirty pieces of dry earth are important to the people of Tanzania because they rely on charcoal to cook meals. Indeed, many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. Nuru acknowledges that this may not be the easiest or most environmentally-friendly way to cook, but it is the only option many people can afford in Tanzania. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans, nuts, and onions in bulk

loans.name: Mautino

texts.es:
Señora B. is a member of the San Martín de Porras Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes in the market of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen pants, 3 dozen jerseys, 2 dozen coats, 1 dozen dress pants, 2 dozen shirts and 1 ½ dozen polos for children.

She is 33 years old and has 2 children. Her husband works as a locksmith. Together they cover the expenses of the house and the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora B., pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 2 docenas de pantalones, 3 docenas de chompas, 2 docenas de casacas,1 docena pantalones de vestir, 2 docenas de camisas, 1 ½ polos para niños.

Ella tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería, juntos cubren los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy pants, jerseys, shirts, polos and coats for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is a member of the Progress Communal Bank. She has a restaurant on Raymondi Avenue in the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 2300 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 3 bags of rice, 5 bags of sugar, 100 liters of oil, 10 large packages of noodles and 5 bags of salt.

She is 65 years old and has 4 children. She has educated her children by herself because her husband passed away when her children were small. She has remarried and her new husband supports her in the business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal El Progreso, tiene su restaurante en la Av. Raymondi del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 3 sacos d arroz, 5 sacos de azúcar, 100 litros de aceite, 10 paquetes grandes de fideos, 5 sacos de sal.

Ella tiene 65 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, ella ha educado a sus hijos sola porque su esposo falleció cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, se ha vuelto a casar y su esposo le apoya en el negocio.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles and salt for her restaurant.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Señora Asunción belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" (Women of Grand Challenges). She makes a living by selling food at the entrance of the central market of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash.

With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 6 bags of sugar, 3 bags of oatmeal, 40 kilograms of quinua, and 2 packages of eggs.

She is 53-years-old, is a window, and has 3 children. She works so she can educate her children, who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Asunción, pertenece al Banco Comunal de Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de alimentos , en la entrada del mercado central de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 6 sacos de azúcar, 3 bolsas de quaker, 40 kilos de quinua, 2 paquetes de huevo.

Ella tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, ella trabaja para educar a sus tres hijos que están estudiando

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase quinua, eggs, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Amina R.. She is a 38-year-old widow, and she has one 18-year-old child. In 1999, Amina established her egg business. Working six days a week, and 5 to 8 hours a day, she earns about $210 each month from this business. She is assisted by her child and two employees. Amina has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase 200 trays of eggs. In the future, Amina plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional (200 trays) eggs.

loans.name: Rosalina Elvira

texts.es:
Señora Rosalina belongs to the Women of Progress Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of food in the market of Yungay in the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy a stove, a canister of gas, a table, 2 bags of rice, 2 boxes of oil and 5 bags of sugar.

She is 47 years old of age, a widow with 2 children. Her husband passed away a year ago. She works alone to educate her children who are in secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de Alimentos en el mercado de Yungay en el distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, una cocina, un balón de gas, una mesa, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 cajas de aceite, 5 sacos de azúcar.

Ella tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda tiene 2 hijos, su esposo falleció hace un año, Ella sola trabaja para educar a sus hijos que están en educación superior.

loans.use: To buy a stove, a canister of gas, a table, rice, oil and sugar for her business selling food.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mary M.. She is a 58-year-old widow with five children who are between the ages of 28 and 37 years old. Mary owns a poultry business. She works seven days a week and 13 to 16 hours per day, and she is assisted by her sister. Mary has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase 300 chickens (layers). In the future, Mary plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you have probably heard the term "kuku" and you might be wondering who or what are "kuku"? In Swahili, "kuku" means chickens, and raising them for sale is a popular business in Tanzania for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital: you can start with just one or two kuku and either add more as your business expands or wait for them to (naturally) multiply! Second, kuku do not need a great deal of space or any special facilities so you can normally just let them run around your garden or compound. Third, kuku produce eggs while they grow, and the eggs can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Mary is sure that there are many other reasons why raising kuku is so popular--she speculates that they may be friendlier or prettier than other animals--but she hopes you now have a better understanding of the popularity of kuku in Tanzania.

loans.use: To purchase 300 additional kuku (chickens) to raise and sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Señora Soledad belongs to the Progress Communal Bank. She has her restaurant next to the hospital of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 2 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 3 gallons of oil, 3 packages of noodles, 2 bags of oats, 2 bags of salt, 5 boxes of carbonated water in small bottles, 15 boxes of carbonated water in large bottles, two boxes of carbonated water in medium bottles. Part of the money will be invested in buying meat, chicken, fish and vegetables daily.

She is 57 years old of age and married with 4 children, three of whom are independent. One of her daughters still lives with her. Her husband supports her in her work.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Soledad, pertenece al Banco Comunal el progreso, tiene su restaurante frente al hospital del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 galones de aceite, 3 paquetes de fideos, 2 bolsas de avena, 2 sacos de sal 5 cajas de gaseosas, chicas, 15 cajas de gaseosa grande dos cajas de gaseosa mediana y parte del dinero invertirá comprando carne, pollo, pescado y verduras diariamente.

Ella tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos tres de ellos son independientes, una de sus hijas aun esta con ella, su esposo le apoya en este trabajo .

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, noodles, oats, salt and carbonated water in bulk, as well as to purchase fresh meat, chicken, fish and vegetables daily.

loans.name: Nasma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Nasma N.. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 5 and 19 years old. In addition, she has two dependents living with her because their parents cannot afford to care for them. In 2006, Nasma established her clothing and cosmetics business. Working seven days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $100 each month from her business. She is assisted by her sister and one employee. Nasma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately $45. In the future, Nasma plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Anna L.. She is 22 years old, single, and has one six-month-old child. In 2003, Anna established her poultry business. She works seven days a week, and more than 16 hours a day. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional chickens. In the future, Anna plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Inocente Group

texts.en:
The women of the group ‘Inocentes’ gather early for their meeting in a fashion of familiarity, having conquered the unknown of their first loan cycle, and ready and waiting with confidence and hope for their second. Today they will get their requested loan amounts approved, and are eagerly chatting in their native language, Kaqchiquel, sharing family happenings and business ideas. All sixteen women know each other well, living as neighbors in the nearby community of San Jorge la Laguna, a town perfectly situated between the region’s capital of Sololá and its tourist capital, Panajachel. In addition to being neighbors, they are now confidants in a solidarity group, sixteen women who are learning to support each other in struggles and in triumphs. All sixteen women were successful with their first loan this past year, and are looking forward to taking on the challenge of slightly bigger loans this time around.

The women are artisans, born into a culture rich in beaded jewelry and weavings. All of the women have businesses related to these crafts. They will invest their loans in tiny translucent beads of every color, with which they will make intricate bracelets, necklaces, and other crafts, like eyeglass chains. Others will invest in thread for weaving. They are skilled in the art of weaving fine huipiles, the traditional Mayan blouse, which can take up to three months to make. They also weave skirts, scarves, and head wraps. All the women are ‘ambulantes’, meaning they carry their products with them, most often in a basket on their head, through the streets of Panajachel, bargaining with and selling to the hundreds of tourists that come through the town. Laura Teresa, a voice for the group, shares that for every 1000 quetzales of investment they will earn about 2000 quetzales.

All of the women have families, the younger women having two or three children each, and some of the older women having as many as nine children, many of whom are still under their care. They have all been working as ambulantes for about six years, and started their businesses to help support their families. The women of Inocentes are eager for their second loan, very pleased with the success they found after the first investment. They found they were able to not only increase their inventory, but also expand the variety, keeping them a step ahead of the competition. They are asking for a loan of 34,800 quetzales, $4550, ranging from $100 to $400 per person.

The three women who are not pictured were at the meeting but had to leave before the picture was taken to take care of their children.
