loans.use: To purchase beeds and thread

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en: Altagracia is the owner and operator of a small cafeteria in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  She has three daughters, ranging from twelve to fifteen, all of whom go to school.  Altagracia explains that satisfying the customer’s needs is sometimes challenging, for each day “thousands of people ‘invaD.’ the cafeteria in order to purchase the appetizing dishes I prepare” she adds, bursting out laughing.  With her loan, Altagracia will buy a large quantity of many goods to keep preparing her food and improving her service, which will proviD. a better lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Señora Epifanía is a member of the Divine Boy Jesus Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of grain (wheat, corn, beans, and vetches) wholesale in the city of Lima. She buys these products in the districts of Caraz, Yunay and Carhuaz.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy 5 bags of corn, 5 bags of beans, 6 bags of wheat and 2 bags of Kiwicha (a native grain of Peru).

She is 70 years old, a widow with 8 children. Her 20 year old son supports her in this business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Epifanía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de cereales (trigo, maíz, haba, arvejas) al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima. Ella compra estos productos en los distritos de Caraz, Yunay y Carhuaz.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, 5 sacos de maíz, 5 sacos de haba, 6 sacos de trigo, 2 sacos de Kiwicha.

Ella tiene 70 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 8 hijos, su hijo de 20 años la apoya en este negocio.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, wheat and Kiwicha ( a native grain of Peru) for resale in her wholesale grain business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is forty-nine years old and the mother of three sons and one daughter.  Esperanza explains that four children are hard to keep up, but she says that’s her responsibility and she’s proud that they all attend school.  To support her children, Esperanza operates a cafeteria she started three years ago.  Currently, she has a well established clientel and she has good income.
Esperanza plans on using her loan to increase the variety of food she offers to her customers.  She hopes that her business’s growth will allow her increase her revenue and maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of goods for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Rosalina Maria

texts.es:
Rosalina beongs to the Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús and sells sweets in front of the district's National Bank, in the province of Carhuaz, department of Ancash.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy 10 packets of chizitos (cheese puffs) 10 bags of candies, 4 boxes of cookies, and 8 packages of soft drinks.

She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children who support her in her business. Her husband sells ice cream in the Plaza de Carhuaz.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, frente al Banco de La nación del distrito, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 10 paquetes de chizitos, 10 bolsas de caramelos,04 cajas de galletas, 8 paquetes de gaseosa.

Ella tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, quienes la apoyan en este negocio, su esposo vende helados en la plaza de Carhuaz

loans.use: With this loan she will buy cookies, soft drinks, etc. for her sales

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Susan belongs to the Warac Community Bank. She sells pies and cakes for all types of social events. She runs her business from her house, which is located in the Independencia district, Huaraz province, in the city of Ancash. With this loan of $450, which she will repay in six months, she will buy three crates of eggs, 120 kilos of flour, 4 boxes of butter, and a bottle of vanilla. She is 35-years-old, married, and has three small children. Her husband is a mechanic and both of them work to raise their children.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Susan, pertenece al Banco Comunal Warac, se dedica a la elaboración de tortas y pasteles, atiende pedidos para toda clase de eventos sociales. Ella realiza su negocio en si casa que esta ubicada distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/.1200.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 3 jabas de Huevo, 120 kilos de harina preparada, 4 cajas de mantequilla, vainilla una botella. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, su esposo es mecánico ambos trabajan para educar a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy eggs, butter, etc. to make pastries.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Luisa Guillermina

texts.en: Luisa Guillermina was born and raised in her small community of Casabe, Santo Domingo.  She is twenty-five years old and lives with her father.  To supplement her family’s revenue and support her university studies (she studies Advertising), Luisa sells a collection of exclusive silver jewelry to teachers, companions at the university and to some friends in her community.  She says that she pays close attention to customer demand, and when the clients ask for a certain product, she adds it to her inventory.  Luisa will use her loan to buy customer recommended products to satisfy the clientele and increase her income.  She hopes that her business can grow and that she will become one of the most well-known suppliers of these goods in her area.

loans.use: To buy customer recommended jewelry.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a single mother of a thirteen-year-old unique son.  To make a living and support her son, Isabel sells cleaning materials such as brooms, mops, detergents and the like.  Isabel operates her business mainly from her house, but from time to time she visits her friends and people in the close-by neighborhood to sell her products.  With her loan, Isabel will increase her stock so that she can better satisfy her customers’ needs.  Having more items available will increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products to resell in her community.

loans.name: Saara

texts.es:
Mrs. Saara S. M. is a member of "Picota" Community Bank. She lives in the province and district of Picota in the Las Almendras development. She sells parts for motorcycles, motorcycle taxis, and other vehicles at her own location on Fernando Belaunde Terry Road near the main border of the community. Her sister encouraged her to open this type of business 20 years ago after seeing the large number of motorized vehicles circulating through the city. Today, it is one of the primary businesses for the sale of parts thanks to her perseverance and good customer service. With this loan of $375, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy more parts and accessories for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis to supply her business as well as oil. She is 44-years-old and married with 4 children, three are school-aged and one is attending university. She wants to see her children become professionals and to see her business always welcomed by the general public.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Saara S. M. socia del Banco Comunal.“Picota”vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, domiciliada en la urbanización Las Almendras MZ H L12, se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, motocarro y otros, en su propio local en la carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry cerca al principal terminal terrestre de la comunidad. Su hermana la motivo a aperturar este tipo de negocio hace 20 años, viendo la gran cantidad de vehículos motorizados que circulaban en la ciudad, hoy en día es uno de los principales negocios de venta de repuestos, gracias a su perseverancia, buen trato al cliente Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00. El cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará más repuestos y accesorios diversos para motos, motocarros, así mismo aceite para surtir su negocio Esta casada y tiene 44 años, tiene 4 hijos, 3 son menores de edad en etapa escolar y un universitario. Desea ver a sus hijos profesionales y que su negocio siempre tenga la acogida del publico en general.

loans.use: To purchase more parts and accessories for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Teolina P. Santillán is a partner in the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. She lives in the San Martín region of Mariscal Cáceres in the Juanjui district. She makes and sells chifles (fried banana chips), empanadas (fried pastries with meat filling), and regional fruit drinks which she prepares in her own home and sells in the city at the Alameda, where athletes meet daily to play. With a loan of $625, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy bunches of green bananas, liters of cooking oil, sacks of potatoes, hundreds of regional fruits, plastic bags, disposable plates, a variety of condiments like mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard to accompany her dishes, as well as firewood and a cooler to preserve her food and to provide sanitary conditions and a high quality product. She is 43 years old and, along with her husband and her daughter, she is happy and satisfied with the business she has developed. She longs for a kiosk where she can offer a variety of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teolinda P. Santillán es una socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chifles, empanadas y refrescos de frutas de la región, que los prepara en su propia casa y los comercializa en la Alameda de la ciudad donde diariamente se reúnen los deportistas a jugar. Con el crédito de S/.1,700.00, el cual sera pagado en 4 meses comprará plátanos verdes en racimos, aceite en litros, papas en sacos, frutas de la región en cientos, bolsas de plástico, platos descartables, diversas cremas como mayonesa, kepchu, mostaza para acompañar sus productos, también leña en tercios, y una caja térmica para conservar sus productos, para así ofrecer un producto higiénico y de buena calidad Tiene 43 años, junto a su esposo y su hija se siente feliz y satisfecha con el negocio que desarrolla y anhela tener un kiosco en el que pueda ofrecer refrigerios variados

loans.use: To purchase bananas, potatoes, fruits, etc. to make  and sell snacks.

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.en: Francisca Antonia sells fried vegetables, fried pork, chicken and natural juices in the Invicea community of San Cristobal.  She prepares the goods within her house, but for selling, she sets up a stall close to a public place and passers-by visit her to purchase her appetizing goods.  The entrepreneur wants to increase her stock so that she can augment her sales volume and her revenue.  This will improve her standard of life.

loans.use: To purchase materials to prepare fried foods.

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Patricia Esther Fernández Sánchez lives on Leoncio Prado Street in the Moche district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She is 25 years old, and she has completed high school. She has one child who still depends on her. Approximately two years ago, she sold lunches from her house, occasionally selling items like: polladas (chicken dinners), ceviche, patita en fiambre (a pickled pork salad), and pumpkin fitters during the afternoon. A year ago, she began her handicraft business. She makes earrings, bracelets, and necklaces with handmade materials. In addition, she knows how to make chompas (knitted sweaters), blouses and wool skits and needlepoint yarn. Her clients are her neighbors, both acquaintances and friends, who place orders with her and she makes them based on their preferences. Patricia is one of the founders of the Group Mientras Tanto "Luis Alberto Sánchez”, where she received her first loan, which she sued to buy cooking ingredients. With this loan of $200, which she will pay in four months, she will invest in costume jewels, nylon thread, and beads to make jewelry, and she will buy wool and yarn to make blouses, skirts, and tablecloths. Her biggest dream is to have a stall in the Moche market in where she can sell the products that she makes.

Translated by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Patricia Esther Fernández Sánchez vive en la calle Leoncio Prado en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú. Tiene 25 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Hace aproximadamente dos años vendía almuerzos en su casa, en algunas ocasiones realizaba actividades como: polladas, cebiche, patita en fiambre y picarones por la tarde. Hace un año que inició su negocio en manualidades. Elabora aretes, pulseras y collares con material artesanal, además, sabe tejer chompas, blusas y faldas de lana e hilo a punto croché. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, conocidos y amigos los cuales le hacen pedidos y ella elabora conforme su preferencia. La señora Patricia es una de las socias fundadoras del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez”, lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el que compro los ingredientes para cocinar. Con el préstamo de S/.500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses, lo invertirá en la compra de piedras de fantasía, hilo nailon y perlitas para elaborar joyitas.Y para la elaboración de blusas, faldas y tapetes comprara lanas e hilos. Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto en el mercado de Moche en el que pueda vender los productos que elabora.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candina, 41, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She only completed one year of school and she's never learned to read or write. She has 4 children, all of whom still live with her. She earns a living raising pigs and "cuyes" (a guineau pig-like animal that's a common food animal in Peru) and knitting bags, sweaters, etc., all of which she sells to customers in the Huamachuco region of Peru.

Candina joined the MMR after her neighbor, Peta, explained that she could borrow money there and she told us that the loan was a big help to her business. She then became a member of the San Borja community lending group. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy roofing materials and beams to build a house on a lot that she bought recently. She's planned it for many years, but for the mountains where she lived before, not for La Libertad where she came with her husband and children for reasons they still don't understand. Her greatest wish is to finish building a house on the lot she bought in February.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Candina tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad - Perú. Solo tiene un año de estudio no sabe leer ni escribir; tiene 4 hijos el cual aun dependen de ella. La señora Candina se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, cuyes y al tejido de chalinas, bolsas, chompas y los vende en la parte de la sierra en Huamachuco lo reparte a su clientela que a conseguido.

La señora Candina ingresa al MMR por medio de su vecina la señora Peta que le explico como podía sacar crédito en esta institución, ella nos expresa que el préstamo le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo prosperar en su negocio y de esa manera pudo ser parte del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja”. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará eternit y bigas para construir su terreno que lo compro hace poco. La señora Candina desde hace mucho que tejía pero en la sierra ya que vivía allí hace tiempo que se vino a la costa por motivo de que ya no se comprendían con su esposo y sus hijos decidieron traerla a vivir a La Libertad. Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir una casa en el lote que compró en el mes de febrero.

loans.use: Buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
Ángela Presciliana B. B. is 48 years old and lives in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo, which is in the region of La Libertad. She studied only until her second year of secondary school. She has 4 children but only three of them depend on her.

Ángela started to cook 7 years ago, and she became very well-known. Since then, she never lacked customers to cook elaborate dishes for on special occasions such as baptisms, birthdays, and weddings. Only a while ago, she made the decision to liven up a part of her home to prepare special stews and menu items, which was well received. And nearly always, everything on the menu is finished off . In addition, she raises chickens to cook in her daily menu.

She belongs to the Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez”, where she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 (~ $120). With this loan, she bought necessary cooking ingredients. With the new loan of $200 that will be paid off in 4 months, she will buy 25 kg of rice, a gallon of cooking oil, and meat on a weekly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Ángela Presciliana B. B. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad, estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene 4 hijos pero solo tres aun depende de ella.

Hace 7 años la señora Ángela se dedica a la cocina, por la sazón que tiene se ha hecho muy conocida y es por eso que nunca falta algún cliente que la contrata para elaborar un platillo en ocasiones especiales; bautizos, cumpleaños y en matrimonios. Hace poco tiempo tomó la decisión de ambientar una pequeña ramada en su casa en donde prepara potajes especiales y menú, a conseguido acogida y casi siempre se le termina el menú. Además cría gallinas y pollos el cual aprovecha en matar para prepararlos en el menú del día.

Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que los cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 25 kilos de arroz, un galón de aceite y semanalmente comprara carnes. Su mayor sueño es ampliar y modernizar su ramada y convertirlo en un gran restaurante.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara productos para la preparacion de sus alimentos

loans.name: Carmela Filomena

texts.es:
Carmela, 42, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished 5 years of high school. She has four children but only two still live with her. She earns a living selling Esika beauty products-- fragrances, jewelry, powders, deodorants, etc--which she buys at a discount (only available to saleswomen),and then sells. She's been selling this line of products for many years after switching from Avon products which aren't well known here.

She belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought various products. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy colognes, powders, shampoo and jewelry. Her greatest wish is to have a market stall in the city of Trujillo where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmela Filomena Olguín A. vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú, tiene 42 años de edad. Estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de productos “esika” el cual compra a precio de consejera (precio solo para vendedoras) fragancias, joyas, talcos, desodorantes, etc. para tener en stock. Hace muchos años que vende éstos productos, empezó con la línea de “avon” no tenia muchos pedidos debido a que no es muy conocido es por eso que se cambio a la línea que actualmente pertenece.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró varios productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprara colonias, talcos, champú y joyas. Su mayor sueño es tener un stand en la ciudad de Trujillo para vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
Cira, 61, finished high school. She has four children but only one still lives with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. In the room in her house that was converted to a shop 17 years ago, she sells everyday items such as colas, cookies, toiletries, clearning products, etc. When she began, she had very few products but, over time, she's increased the range of products she sells.

Cira belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought a variety of products such as cooking oil, eggs, pasta, toilet paper, etc. With this loan of S/.200, to be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen boxes of detergent, 10 cases of colas, soap and snacks. Her greatest wish is to improve her small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Cira Cecilia Sánchez Vda. D. Asmat tiene 61 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo uno aun depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Moche provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. En la bodega que acondicionó en su domicilio hace aproximadamente 17 años venD. productos D. primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas , mercería y productos D. limpieza. Cuando empezó tenia muy pocos productos, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando y teniendo mayor variedad.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este monto compró una variedad D. productos como aceite, huevos, fideos, papel higiénico y fideos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 200.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara una docena D. detergente, 10 cajas D. gaseosas, jabón y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es implementar mas su bodega.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Jeny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jeny, 37, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She is a certified midwife. She has 3 children, all of whom still live with her. Since marrying, she's operated a business selling regular meal services to "pensiones" (a kind of "room and board" arrangement common in Peru), starting with relatives who she helped with breakfast, lunch and dinner, calculating what they owe her at the end of each month based on what they eat.

She became a member of the Rey de Reyes ("King of Kings") community lending group after her sister-in-law introduced the idea. With her first loan of S/.300 from the group, she bought all the ingredients necessary to make her meals. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy wholesale supplies of the ingredients--rice, cooking oil, sugar, vegetables--from the La Hermelinda market in Trujillo. Her greatest wish is to see her children study for professional careers and be able someday to work at whatever careers they pursue.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jeny Elizabeth Sánchez A. vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad, tiene 37 años de edad. Con grado de instrucción superior completa especialidad Obstetriz. Tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Desde que se casó inicio su negocio de dar pensión, especialmente a sus familiares, les atiende con desayuno, almuerzo y cena el cual al cabo de un mes le cancelan lo que consumieron.

Por medio de su cuñada pudo integrarse al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey de Reyes” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró todos los ingredientes necesarios para preparar algunos platillos. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelara en cuatro meses, comprará al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” del distrito de Trujillo 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, 1 saco de azúcar y algunas verduras. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales y realizados así también anhela con algún día ejercer su carrera.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Luqueñas Group

texts.en:
The scent of freshly cut firewood fills the air of the courtyard at the home where the women of the communal bank ‘Luqueñas’ are gathered for their loan approval meeting. Half are seated on benches maD. from scrap lumber, the others perched on stumps yet to be cut to smaller pieces. All wait eagerly, with smiles of hope and confidence. This will be their second loan, and having just successfully paid back their first in full, they are expecting a slight increase in funds.

The women have various businesses. About half specialize in weaving and crocheting traditional clothing native to the region, primarily ‘huipiles’, a woven blouse that can take up to three months to produce. They will invest their loan in thread and yarn, which they purchase at a market in the town of Santiago D. Atitlán, about an hour bus riD. away. Others sell products from catalogues, such as shoes, clothing, jewelry, and perfume. They will use their loans to place purchases in bulk for items to have on hand that they know sell well. This way they can save money on shipping costs as well as the P. item cost. Those who don’t weave or sell products have businesses buying and selling corn and beans, two staple foods of the region. They travel to Santiago D. Atitlán once a week, purchase large amounts of corn and beans, and bring them back to their town of San Lucas to sell in the market or to regular customers.

All of the women have families that they are taking care of. Some have as many as nine children living at home, and they are working very hard to proviD. not only food and shelter but also a good education for all their kids. When asked if the loans help them accomplish this goal, there is a resounding ‘yes!’ from a previously timid crowd. They all start laughing and chattering away about their happiness to be part of their bank, and about the positive impact it has had on their lives so far. One woman looks up and says ‘we’re taking out another loan, aren’t we?!’ The seventeen women are asking for a loan of 38,115 quetzales (about $4975), ranging from $150 to $400 P. person.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving, corn and beans to sell, and to invest in home product sales

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria, 46, studied to be an accountant. She has three children who still live with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She started her business selling "shambar" (a traditional dish of the city of Trujillo), an idea that was born because there were a lot of people in the area from Trujillo, and beer which she also sold. Later, she started selling beauty products. She's now added earrings, necklaces and other handmaD. items to the products she sells.

Maria belongs to the Rey D. Reyes ("King of Kings") community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought supplies to make shambar along with beauty products for resale. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 10 cases of beer along with perlitas, ribbons, buttons and lace to make the products she makes by hand. Her greatest wish is to aircondition her house and set up a space for selling fruit, yogurt and the beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Esther Martínez S. D. García tiene 46 años D. edad, estudio la carrera D. contabilidad. Tiene en total tres hijos que aun dependen D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Moche en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Su negocio se inicia con la venta D. shambar (plato típico D. la ciudad D. Trujillo), la idea nace porque en la zona llegaron personas que realizaban trabajos urbanos, además tenia algunas cajas D. cerveza, el cual también ofrecía. Posteriormente ingreso a la línea D. productos D. belleza. Actualmente la señora Maria Esther se dedica también a la elaboración D. aretes y collares y otros productos manuales.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey D. Reyes” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo tipo D. menestras para la elaboración del shambar además algunos productos D. belleza para tener en stock. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 10 cajas D. cerveza así también perlitas, cintas, botones y blondas para elaborar algunas manualidades. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar e implementar su casa para vender ensalada D. fruta, yogurt y los productos D. belleza.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa, 55, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished one year of high school. She has five grown children, none of whom still live with her. Mornings, she sell green vegetables, potatoes, onions, etc. in a local market. She buys wholesale supplies of the produce in the La Hermelinda market. She used to work as a street vendor in the market many years ago and knows it well. She also makes money raising animals, sheep and pigs, that can be butchered when they reach the right size and sold to her neighbors and friends who anxiously wait to place their orders with her.

Maria Luisa belongs to the San Borja community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to buy a variety of green vegetables. With this loan of S/.700, to be repaid in four months, she will buy potatoes, onions, pickles and other produce. Her greatest wish is to buy a house closer to the city because where she lives now is very far away.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Luisa García D. O. tiene 55 años D. edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito D. Moche provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. Estudio solo hasta el primer año D. secundaria. Tiene cinco hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Ella venD. todo tipo D. verduras, papa, cebolla, etc. todas las mañanas en el mercado D. Moche. Compra su mercadería al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” en el distrito D. Trujillo. Hace muchos años venD. en condición D. ambulante en este mercado y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien. Se dedica también a la crianza D. animales como: carneros y chanchos el cual sacrifica cuando han adquirido el tamaño ideal, la carne lo distribuye a sus vecinos y amigos que le hacen pedidos anticipadamente.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con el cual compro una variedad D. verduras. Con el préstamo D. S/. 700.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 2 arrobas D. papa, 1 costal D. cebolla, escabeche y otras verduras. Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en el centro del distrito D. Moche porque el lugar donD. actualmente vive esta muy alejado D. la ciudad.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha, 38, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished high school and now has two children, both of whom still live at home. She earns a living making whatever clothes are appropriate for the season of year. For example, she's now making skirts and trousers appropriate for high school students at the beginning of their school year and smocks for kindergarten aged children. Furthermore, she makes blouses, dresses and skirts. When Martha started her business, she only made costumes, but as she's become known, her customers have ordered everyday articles of clothing from her.

Martha belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to make articles of clothing that had been ordered. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen school sweaters that the students of a local school always want and cloth to make 20 skirts and smocks. Her greates dream is to set up her a tailoring shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha Elizabeth H. L. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Estudio secundaria completa, tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Se dedica a la corte y confección de ropa, de acuerdo a la temporada, por ejemplo en esta época del año esta elaborando faldas y pantalones de colegio, además mandiles para niños que asisten al jardín así también blusas, vestidos y faldas para dama. Cuando la señora Martha inició su negocio confeccionando solo disfraces poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y le hacían pedido de prendas de vestir.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para confeccionar algunas prendas pedidas. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara, una docena de chompas de colegio que siempre le solicitan de algunos colegios particulares y tela para la elaboración de 20 faldas y mandiles para el jardín. Su mayor sueño es instalar en su casa un taller de costura

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
Nelly is a single woman who lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She's 41 years old and has a high school education. Three years ago she had a business selling sweets and snacks to neighbors and acquaintances but the earnings were poor and she decided to switch to cooking to earn a living. She rents a small stand where she operates the business on weekends. From Mondays to Fridays, she sells soft toys, decorative items and all kinds of gifts from her house. Her neighbors and friends seek her out to buy her products to give as gifts.

Nelly is a member of the Luis Alberto S. community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the loan to buy food and kitchen supplies for her business. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 2 turkeys, 1 sack of rice and other ingredients to make the traditional dishes of the region. She will also give part of the money to her brother, who travels to Lima every week, so that he can buy a few things such as soft toys and gifts that she will resell. Her greatest wish is to have her own restaurant or a place where she would no longer have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. es una mujer soltera, vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Tiene 41 años de dad, estudio secundaria completa. Hace tres años su negocio era la venta de chocotejas y gelatina, el cual ofrecía y vendía a sus vecinos y conocidos, pero este negocio no le daba muchas ganancias así que decide dedicarse a la cocina, consiguió alquilar una pequeña ramada en la campiña de Moche y desde entonces todos los fines de semana se dedica a este negocio. De lunes a viernes en su casa vende peluches, adornos y todo tipo de regalos. Algunos vecinos y amigos la buscan para adquirir alguno de sus productos como regalo para ocasiones especiales.

Es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez”, lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró leche, vasos, gelatina, cobertura y moldes. Con el préstamo de S/. S/.500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 2 pavos, 1 saco de arroz y demás ingredientes para preparar diferentes potajes tradicionales en la zona, además un poco de este dinero le dará a su hermano que viaja semanalmente a Lima para que le compré un poco de mercadería como: peluches y regalos. Su mayor sueño es tener su propio restaurante o un local propio en el que ya no tenga que pagar alquiler.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business and stock for gift business.

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es:
Santos, 28, finished three years of high school. She has two children, both of whom still depend on her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She makes a living selling beauty products along with all kinds of crafts such as embroidered cushions, pillows and other items that she makes by hand. Since she was very young, she's enjoyed this kind of work, making things as a child with a material called "cola de rata" ("rat's tail), and now with better quality threads.

Santos belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to buy beauty products for resale. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy materials, ribbons and thread to make craft products. Her greatest dream is to have a market stall in central Trujillo where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Santos Sabina P. P. tiene 28 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad. Ella se dedica la venta de productos de belleza así también todo tipo de manualidades tales como: bordado de cojines, almohadones, adornos y carteras tejidas a croché y macramé. Desde que era muy joven le gustó estos trabajos, elabora de acuerdo a como se ponga de moda, anteriormente hacia binchas, correas y carteras con un material llamado cola de rata, ahora elabora con otros hilos de mejor calidad.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró productos de belleza para tener en stock . Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara telas, cintas e hilos para elaborar algunas de sus manualidades. Su mayor sueño es tener un stand en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo en donde ofrecer todos sus productos de belleza y sus productos manuales.

loans.use: Buy supplies to make products for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Rosario

texts.es:
Vilma, 28, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She is a certified midwife. She has one son who lives with her. She earns a living making and selling vests, quilts, skirts, blouses, etc. and mending articles of clothing. She started with simple mending. Her neighbors then asked her to make articles of clothing for them but she was unable to do so because she didn't have a sewing machine. Her father surprised her with one, though, and she hasn't stopped working since. She was finally able to use the skills that she'd learned in school.

Vilma belons to the Luis Alberto S. community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the loan to but materials, threads and buttons. With this loan of S/.300, to be repaid in four months, she will buy wholesale supplies of cloth from a market in Trujillo so that can fill an order for 60 vests for drivers of the area's moto-taxis. The work will take about two weeks. Her greatest wish for the future is to have a tailoring shop and her immediate wish is to have an embroidering machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Vilma Rosario T. Sánchez tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad. Tiene grado de instrucción superior técnica se especializo en la carrera obstetriz. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Su negocio es la confección de chalecos, edredones, faldas, blusas, shorts y reparaciones de prendas. Su negocio se inicia haciendo algunos arreglos a mano, algunos vecinos de la zona le solicitaban algunas prendas que no podía realizarlas porque era necesario una maquina de cocer, su padre le dio la sorpresa y le regalo una, desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar en ella. Este oficio lo aprendió en el C.E.O. de su colegio por cinco años y siempre que tuvo la oportunidad lo ha puesto en practica.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro telas, hilos y cierres. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprará tela dril al por mayor en el mercado mayorista en la ciudad de Trujillo, para la elaboración de un pedido de 60 chalecos para los moto taxistas de la zona. Este trabajo lo realiza en un promedio de dos semanas. Su mayor sueño a futuro es tener un taller de costura y su sueño mas próximo es tener una maquina bordadora.

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.ru:
Zarnigor H. lives in Yavan. She is 36 years old, is divorced and raising three children. She is the sole breadwinner of her family, so 4 years ago Zarnigor decided to start her own business. She purchases potatoes, onions and carrots wholesale and then resells them in her local market. She has a stall in the “Mekhrgon” market. It is not easy to provide for three children, so Zarnigor needs additional funds to expand her business. Zarnigor wants to use her loan for business expansion. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хидирова Зарнигор жительница города Яван. Ей 36 лет, она разведена и имеет 3 дете. Так как она не замужем Она является единственным кормильцем семьи. Поэтому 4 года назад Зарнигор решила занятся бизнесом. Она скупает у оптовых реализаторов овощи (картофель, лук, морковь ) и продает на рынке. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Мехргон». Кормить тороих детей не так просто и по этой причине ей необходимо развивать свой бизнес, а для этого ей нужны дополнительные средства, поэтому обратившись в нашу организацию она надеется получить возможность получить кредит и зарабатывать. А погасить кредит Зарнигор планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase turnover

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Faysilla

texts.ru:
Faysilla H. lives in Yavan. He is 55 years old, is married and has seven children. He has a secondary education. He has his own business – he raises livestock. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40 to 45 days and then sells them in the same market. He has a shed where he keeps his calves. He has been in this business for 15 years. Raising livestock is a common business in rural areas. Currently, it is the season to buy calves and Faysilla wants to purchase additional calves, which will increase his turnover and bring additional income. Since he doesn’t have enough money to purchase additional calves, he applied for a loan. He plans to repay his loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хасанов Файзилла жтель города Яван. Клиенту 55 лет , он женат и имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Определенного места работы не имеет, но имеет свое дело. Он занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков и после откормки, которая длится около 40-45 дней продает на тех же рынках. Имеет коровник в котором держит бычков. Занимается клиент этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Эта деятельность одна из основных видов бизнеса в сельской местности. Сейчас сезон купле-продажи бычков , поэтому клиенту нужно купить дополнительных бычков. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот , что даст возможность получить дополнительный доход. Но для этого у него не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. А погасить кредит он планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Bibirikiya

texts.ru:
Bibirikiya O. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children. She finished high school. Bibirikiya obtains a stable income from breeding and taking care of farm animals. She has a small farm business with goats and young cows. Bibirikiya would like to purchase one milk cow in order to produce fresh milk. During spring and summer it is easy to sustain large farm animals, because there is no problem feeding the animals. However, the client does not have the money. This is why she plans to receive a loan, which will help her reach the goal. Besides, she would be able to sell this milk, thereby receiving additional income for her family. The client has 6 children and she needs to raise her income. Bibirikiya plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

. Одинаева Бибирикия Абдуллоевна проживает в городе Яван. Ей 47 лет , она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. Стабильный заработок имеет путем разведения крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Имеет клиентка небольшое хозяйство в котором имеет козочек и телят. Но Одинаева Бибирикия хочет купить одну дойную корову , для того чтобы получать свежее молоко. Весной и летом содержать крупно-рогатый скот просто , так как нет проблем с кормами. Но для этого у клиентки нет денег. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит , который поможет ей реализовать свои планы. Кроме того получаемое ею молоко она сможет продавать и получать дополнительный доход для своей семьи , так как у нее 6 детей и клиентке просто необходимо увеличивать свои доходы. А погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Hasan M. lives in the city of Yavan. The client is 45 years old. He is married and has 8 children. He finished high school. Hasan is a mechanic by training. But his main business and the source of income for the family is agriculture. Hasan has a plot of land where he plants wheat, linen and other seeds. After receiving crops, he leaves a part for his family and sells the other large part. Hasan has been in this business for 18 years. Now is time to plant, therefore the client needs additional resources to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer and pay for tractor rent. This is why he would like to receive a loan. This will help Hasan purchase quality seeds and get a quality crop, which will help expand his client base and to sell all crops. He plans to repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

. Муродов Хасан Гулович житель города Яван. Возраст клиента 45 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование средне-техническое. По специальности Механизатор.Но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода семьи является земледелие. Имеет дехканское хозяйство, которое засеивает пшеницей , льном и другими злаковыми культурами. После того как он получает урожай , часть его оноставляет своей семье, а остальную, большую часть продает. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 18 лет. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиенту необходимы дополнительные средства для того чтобы купить семена пшеницы , удобрения и оплатить аренду трактора.Поэтому он запланировала получить кредит. Это поможет ему закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and rent a tractor

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru:
Beknazar S. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has 1 child. Beknazar finished high school. Currently, he is unemployed, but he rears farm animals, which works out well for his rural community. Beknazar has a farm where he grows calves. The client plans to receive credit in order to increase the number of animals. This will help him increase the income from selling the calves and also to improve his family's financial situation, which is very needed. The client plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Сафаров Бекназар проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет 1 ребенка . Образование среднее. В данный момент нигде не работает , но занимается разведением животных, что актуально для сельской местности. Имеет хозяйство, где разводит бычков. Клиент планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему увеличить доход с продаваемых бычков, а так же поможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи, в котором он так нуждается. А погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Buhory

texts.ru:
Buhory K., 71, lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has seven children. Buhory has a secondary technical education; he was trained as a tractor operator. At present, he does not have a job. He raises goats, sheep, and cattle for a living on his small farmstead. Buhory is applying for a loan to increase the volume of livestock he has and to grow his business. This will help him increase the income he receives from selling calves, and will improve his family's financial situation. Buhory plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Кориев Бухори Проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 71 год , женат и имеет 7 детей. Образование средне- техническое , по специальности тракторист. В данный момент нигде не работает , но занимается разведением животных. Имеет хозяйство где разводит коз , овец и бычков. Клиент планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и развить свой бизнес. Это поможет ему увеличить доход с продаваемых бычков, а так же поможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. А погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kumriddin

texts.ru:
Kumriddin Minochovich S., 45, is a resident of Yavan district. He is married and has six children. He has a secondary school education and does not have a job. His family's only source of income is their private livestock business in the village. Kumriddin has a small cowshed, where he raises calves to sell. He buys young animals at the Yavan markets, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells the fattened animals back at the same markets. Now, the season for buying and selling animals has begun and Kumriddin needs to increase his turnover. To do this, he needs extra money, so he has applied to MLF HUMO for a loan. The additional money will not only help Kumriddin increase turnover; it will also give his family badly needed income and help them improve their lives. Kumriddin plans to repay the loan over ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Самадов Кумриддин Миночович житель Яванского района. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее, нигде не работает . Единственным источником дохода его семьи является занятие частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства, что актуально в сельской местности. Имеет небольшой коровник, в нем он разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых животных на рынке Явана , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , после того как они подрастут , клиент их продает там же , на тех же рынках. Сейчас начался сезон торговли животными , поэтому клиенту нужно как –то увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ему необходимы дополнительные деньги, а для этого он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. Дополнительные средства помогут ему не только увеличить товарооборот , но и получить доход в котором он так нуждается. Это поможет его семье немного улучшить свою жизнь. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Hafiza N., 37, lives in the city of Yavan. She is married, but she and her husband do not have any children. Hafiza does not have a formal education. She has a small business selling clothing at the "Tichorat" market, where she rents a trading stall. Hafiza brings goods to Yavan from Dushanbe (her country's capital). She buys clothes from wholesalers there and offers the residents of Yavan the goods they demand. This gives the local population the chance to go shopping without leaving Yavan. Hafiza's trading stall also helps develop the business sector in her town.

In addition, Hafiza lives with her husband's parents and other relatives, and she must support this large family. She would like to increase her earnings, and only additional financial support can help her achieve this goal. Hafiza is applying for a loan to increase her stall's turnover. She can repay her loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Ниезова Хафиза проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 37 лет. Замужем , но детей не имеет детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли .Торгует одеждой на рынке «Тичорат».Имеет торговую точку , которую берет в аренду. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов , привозит в Яван и предлагает населению тот товар , который пользуется спросом на их рынках. Это дает возможность населению делать покупки , не выезжая из Явана. Ее бизнес помогает так же развитию бизнеса в городе Яван. Кроме того клиентка живет с родителями мужа , в семье которых имеется много людей и обеспечивать их приходится ей . поэтому клиентка хочет получать больше дохода , а в этом ей поможет только дополнительная финансовая поддержка. Поэтому она хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 4 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Kabiroy

texts.ru:
Kabiroy Dzhuraevna B., 41, lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has five children. Since Kabiroy has finished only secondary school, she doesn't have a specialized education and does not work outside the home. However, she is engaged in livestock breeding at home, which brings badly needed income to her family. Kabiroy is applying for a loan to buy a cow, in order to increase the number of livestock she owns. This will serve as an investment for her family. Kabiroy can pay off the loan within 8 months, after which the cow will remain in her possession and bear calves.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Баратова Кабирой Джураевна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 41 год, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Закончила только среднюю школу, поэтому не имеет специального образования и нигде не работает. Но все-таки дома у нее имеется маленькое хозяйство, в котором она разводит домашних животных. Ее занятие дает ее семье доход, в котором она так нуждается. Сейчас клиентка хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить одну корову, для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это будет вложением денег для ее семьи, а погасить кредит она сможет частично в течении 8 месяцев, но зато у нее останется корова , которая сможет дать ей приплод.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Mr. Ran L. and his wife, Chea Sophal, have been married since 1991. They have two children; one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school. The family lives in Mekong River’s island, which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ran has been selling cows since 1991. He bought cows from other villages to resell in his village and in nearby villages. He uses the profits to grow rice and for food. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man on the island.

Mr. Run is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $400 to buy more cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mrs. Nao R. and her husband, Vuthy Cheng, have been married since 1987. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives in the family house and the other three children are in school. The family lives along Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nao has been a silk weaver for ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man inside the village. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for fifteen years. Now he wants to create another business and begin milling rice by machine.

Mrs. Nao is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount of $550 to purchase silk material for weaving. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy a milling rice machine.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a milling rice machine

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H. and her husband, Ra Seng, have been married since 1988. They have one daughter who is weaving silk at home. The family lives along the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chea has been a silk weaver for twenty eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for two years. It’s a skill he learned from Chea. They sell their finished products to the middle man inside the village.

Mrs. Chea is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sreyloeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyloeng S. and her husband, Tiv Bi, married in 2002. They have one daughter who is in primary school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreyloeng has been a garment factory worker for eight years. She works in garment factory near her village. Her husband is fully employed. He works in a mill in the village.

Mrs. Sreyloeng is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1,000 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An C., 63, is a widow who lives with her adopted daughter. She and her daughter sell fish at Prek Pnao market. They buy them from the fishing lot to resell. Mrs. An has been doing this business for twenty eight years. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. An and her daughter are in the process of rebuilding their house; it is not yet complete.

Mrs. An is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to complete her house.

loans.use: To complete her house

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov L. and his wife have been married for twenty four years. They have four daughters, two of whom work in a garment factory. The other two are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Pov has been a construction worker for twenty fours years. He does construction work in Phnom Penh, in nearby villages and sometimes in other provinces. His wife stays home and takes care of their children.

Mr. Pov is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to repair his house and buy one motorbike to use for work.

loans.use: To repair his house and buy one motorbike to use for his work

loans.name: Chanphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanphun Y. and her husband have been married for six years. They have no children. Chanphun and her husband live with her father, who is a motor taxi driver. The family lives in an old house, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanphun is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Sary Yin, has been a carpenter for thirteen years.

Mrs. Chanphun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike. She would like to replace her father's old bike. He runs a motor taxi business. They would like to use the extra income to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. Her father runs a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanty M. was married to her first husband in 1990 and has four children. In 2006 she married her second husband, Minea Kong, and had one child. Four of her children are in school. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanty has been growing vegetables for five years. She grows many kinds of vegetables in the farm near her house. Her husband is a security guard.

Mrs. Chanty is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $600 to purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai U. and her husband have been married since 1973. They have eight children; four sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other five live under their roof, one of whom helps in selling the Khmer noodles. Two of the other children sell flowers and the youngest two are in school.

Mrs. Sokhai farms and sells Khmer noodles and rice soup in front of her house. Her husband does construction work and works on the farm with his wife. They are in their late 50s, but still strong enough to work. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokhai is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $400 to expand her business of selling Khmer noodles and rice soup.

loans.use: Expanding her business of selling Khmer noodles and rice soup

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., 53, and her husband, Vuthy Chok, married in 1975. They have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live in the family house. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started her silk production business in 1979. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband is a teacher.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is thirty-two years old and the proud mother of three children, ranging from six to sixteen years old, all of whom attend school. Saturnina has been selling shoes, slippers and tennis shoes for six years in the Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. Her business allows her to support her children’s education, and she helps her husband face other house issues.

Saturnina thinks it’s time to have a premises for the business. She plans on using her loan to increase her supplies. A part of the loan will be invested in the rental of a premises. Saturnina explains that with her business’s continued growth, she hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: Purchase of an assortment of shoes and tennis shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.en:
Deyanira was born and raised in her small community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. She and her husband have three daughters, ranging from thirteen to sixteen. Two of them attend school, and the oldest studies at the university.

To supplement her family’s income, Deyanira sells men’s clothing. She explains that her husband’s income can’t bear all the expenses of the family and support the girls’ education. Deyanira mentions that she still is operating her business mainly from her house, but she hopes that her business’ growth will help her get money enough to rent a small premises.

loans.use: Purchase of men's clothing in bulk in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Gilca Ramona

texts.en:
Gilca Ramona owns and operates a small cafeteria in the Herrera community of Santo Domingo. This activity is the main source of income of Gilca. She mentions that she constantly needs money to pay school tuition of her two daughters and the university studies of her son. So, she says that it’s not very easy to support three children, but she’s proud that she could make great efforts so they can have a good education.

Gilca plans on using her loan to increase the variety of sandwiches and hamburgers she offers to her clientele. She would like to have a well-established cafeteria in the sector to better provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Trinidad Xiomara

texts.en:
Trinidad Xiomara was born and raised in the low-income neighborhoods of Herrera in Santo Domingo. Currently, she’s the owner and principal of a basic education school she started last year to contribute to the education of the children of this community. She receives about 105 children from the surroundings and the teaching staff is composed of five people.

Trinidad explains that not all the parents have the means to pay for their children’s educations, even though her school is not expensive. So she has to be supportive and help these parents, allowing that the children attend classes without paying the school fees.

With her loan, Trinidad will buy school furniture so that the children can learn in a comfortable atmosphere. She’ll also make the purchase of many goods for the school cafeteria.

loans.use: Purchase of school furniture and goods for the school cafeteria.  The entrepreneur owns an basic education school.

loans.name: Zoila Adelaida

texts.es:
Zoila is a 47-year-old woman who is accustomed to getting up before the sun so she can do housework and open her business. She lives in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood, is married, and has 4 adult children who dedicate themselves to the family business. This is a general store with a lot of activity. She is a hard-working woman whose goal is to open other branches in other neighborhoods so each one of her children can be independent and attend to their own business. This is a dream that she is sure she will realize. She is requesting a loan to supply her store with beef, chicken, dairy products, and basic grains to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Una mujer de 47 años de edad, acostumbrada a levantarse antes que el sol sale para hacer los quehaceres del hogar y abrir su negocio. Habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, casada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad que se dedican al negocio Familiar que es una Miscelanea de mucho movimiento, esta mujer trabajadora tiene el propósito de abrir otras Sucursales en otros barrios y que cada uno de sus hijos se independicen atendiendo cada quien su propio negocio, sueño que esta segura logrará alcanzar. Solicita un préstamo para abastecer su distribuidora de carne de Res, Pollo, productos lácteos y granos básicos y tener mejor surtido su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, dairy products, and basic grains

loans.name: Abdona

texts.es:
For 20 years, in the municipality of Condega in the city of Estelí, Señora Abdona G. has made a living by farming, since she has her own land in her sector of the city. Since she started her business, she has received the support of her husband in the activities that they carry out. It is for this motive that she has been able to make improvements to her business and support the studies of her five children, including one girl who is still a minor.

In spite of the difficult farming work (agriculture and raising livestock), she strives greatly to continue improving her business. We can't overlook that Ceprodel has played a fundamental role since it has offered her credits that have been used to purchase and raise livestock as well as to invest in the agricultural harvest. Currently, Abdona has had 5 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, la señora Abdona G. se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propio terreno en su sector de localidad. Desde que inició el negocio ha recibido el apoyo de su esposo en las actividades que se realizan y es por este motivo que ha venido logrando obtener mejoras que le han permitido obtener mejoras en el negocio y en el apoyo al estudio de sus cinco hijos entre ellos una niña que es la menor de edad.

A pesar del difícil trabajo agropecuario (Agricultura y ganadería), ella se esfuerza grandemente para continuar mejorando su negocio. No podemos pasar por alto que Ceprodel ha jugado un papel fundamental debido a que le ha proporcionado créditos que han sido utilizados en la compra y crianza del ganado y además en la inversión para la cosecha de agricultura. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Keeping up the farm and investing in the harvest

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es:
José Alcides Salinas is a very responsible man. Since his youth, he has raised livestock, specifically pigs on his farm. He is portrayed as a family man who is very attentive to his children. Since he has been through difficult financial situations, he has fought to provide the education his two young children (one son and one daughter) deserve.

Currently, he lacks the resources to buy more pigs. For this reason, he has sought the support of Ceprodel - to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase pigs to raise and sell pork in the region where he lives. It is imperative to note that he has paid off three loans with Ceprodel in due time and according to stipulated conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

José Alcides Salinas es un caballero muy responsable que desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la crianza de Ganado específicamente en la crianza de credos en su casa de habitación. Se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy esforzado y atento con sus hijos ya que a pesar de la difícil situación económica que han atravesado ha logrado brindarle a sus dos pequeños hijos (un niño y una niña) los estudios que ellos se merecen.

Una gran necesidad que actualmente el señor Alcides atraviesa es la escasez de recursos económicos para adquirir el ganado es por eso que ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir los cerdos para alimentarlos y vender su carne en su localidad de habitación. Es necesario destacar que actualmente posee tres créditos con ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
Since his youth, José V. has been devoted to the agricultural and livestock business in the municipality of Congeda in the city of Estelí. He is a very responsible in his job, in his family life, and has managed to provide for his wife and three children who are all very dependent on his support.

Currently, he lacks the resources to buy livestock and harvest in staple grains. For this reason, he seeks a loan from CEPRODEL to reach his goal to buy cattle and bring in the highest profit that will improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

José V. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio de la agricultura y ganadería en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es un caballero muy responsable en su labor y en su familia ya que ha logrado mantener a su esposa y a sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

Actualmente, la necesidad que atraviesa el señor V. es la urgencia de adquirir recursos económicos para la compra de ganado e inversión en la cosecha de granos básicos. Por esta razón solicita apoyo en CEPRODEL por medio de los créditos para lograr alcanzar su meta que es obtener el ganado (vaquillas) y sacarle el máximo provecho para la mejora de su situación y la de su familia.

loans.use: to invest in his agricultural business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa is a 39 year old woman with a great talent for her work. She lives in the Laurels North area together with her husband and her 3 minor children. The spouses work together in her business; they sell food and beverages through the streets. This ingenious couple invented a bicycle food cart from which to sell their products. In the lower part of the cart they installed two cooking pots full of fired charcoal. They place the hot food above these portable heat sources, to keep it warm. They have two of these bicycles. Both Rosa and her husband go out on the bicycles to sell food and beverages in the streets and at construction worksites, where they have developed a good clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad con un gran ingenio en el trabajo, habita en los Laureles Norte junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ambos esposos trabajan juntos en el negocio de venta de comida y refrescos ambulante. Esta ingeniosa pareja en una bicicleta elaboro un anexo en la parte de enfrente en donde en la parte de abajo le adaptaron dos ollas con carbón encendido a fin de mantener caliente la comida y sobre ellos están las porras de comida caliente, tienen dos bicicletas y cada uno de ellos sale a las calles para vender comida y refrescos en las calles y puestos de trabajo de construcción donde consiguen buenos clientes.

loans.use: Invest in the raw materials she uses to prepare her food products

loans.name: Maria Estebana

texts.es:
Señora María is 53-years-old. She lives in the neighborhood called 31 de diciembre. She is single and has an adult daughter who lives with her. Her daughter has children from two different fathers since she hasn't had luck with love. This young woman doesn't work, so her mother has to support her. She works as a caretaker at a small, private freight company. Doña María has made divisions in her house with sheets, and she wants a credit to make an independent and private room so she can leave the rest of her house for her grandchildren, whom she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria de 53 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Llamado 31 de Diciembre, es soltera y tiene una hija mayor de edad que vive con ella, tiene 2 hijos de diferentes padres ya que no ha tenido suerte en el amor, esta joven no trabaja y su madre tiene que apoyarla. Trabaja como conserje de una pequeña empresa privada de carga. Doña Maria tiene en su casa divisiones con sabanas y quiere un crédito para hacer un cuarto independiente y privado y dejar el resto de la casa para sus nietos que tanto ama.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to begin constructing a room

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es:
Guillermo is a 64 year old man who lives in Laurels North. He is married; his wife is a housewife. They have 2 children. The eldest, 28 years old and married, lives with Guillermo and his wife. They are a very close family that likes having the children close by. The 28 year old son helps Guillermo with his work. Father and son work selling vegetables along a set route from the back of their small truck. Guillermo drives the truck and his son takes care of the sales from the truck bed. They work this way every day of the week, passing through all the surrounding neighborhoods block by block. Currently Guillermo is living a difficult situation. The motor of his truck has been damaged and he is requesting a loan with which to repair it, since the vehicle is his only means of earning an income.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don Guillermo es un hombre de 64 años de edad que Habita en los Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 28 años casado y vive con él ya que son una familia muy unida que les gusta tener a los hijos cerca, este joven le ayuda en el trabajo. Don Guillermo junto a su hijo trabajan vendiendo verduras ruteado en una camionetita don Guillermo maneja el vehiculo y su hijo en la tina se en carga de las ventas, esto todos los días por todos los barrios aledaños de cuadra en cuadra. Actualmente están pasando una situación difícil en vista que el motor del vehiculo se daño y solicita un préstamo para repararlo ya que ese vehiculo es su único medio de trabajo.

loans.use: Buy a motor for the small truck from which he sells fruit.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto is a master builder of good taste and quality. He is 32 years old and lives in the Laurels North neighborhood of Managua. He is married; his wife is a housewife and cares for their 3 young children, all of whom are in primary school. Roberto works in a construction firm. With his limited resources he has improved his humble house, without luxury but in good taste. He is applying for a loan with which to buy bricks to add to the family home that he works on and invests in with work and love, so that he can see his wife and children happy.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto es un Maestro Obra de buen gusto y calidad, tiene 32 años habita en Laureles Norte, Barrio de Managua , casado, la esposa es ama de casa y cuida a los 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la primaria. Don Roberto trabaja en una constructora y con sus recursos ha mejorado su casita humilde pero con buen gusto. Solicita un crédito para comprar ladrillos y enladrillar su casita, la que con trabajo y amor siempre trabaja e invierte en ella para ver feliz a su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Buy bricks to use in the construction of his home.

loans.name: Maria Argentina

texts.es:
At 27 years old, Maria C. is a young rural woman accustomed to the hard work of agriculture. She lives in La Concepción, San Caralampio, an agricultural area known for fruit production. She has 3 children aged 13, 11 and 8. Together with their father the children grow pineapple, papaya and coffee. They get up very early every morning to work the land. With the sweat of their brows, Maria and her husband have moved their family ahead. They are a very industrious and hardworking young couple. They are requesting a loan with which to buy agricultural supplies for the maintenance of their pineapple harvest. The products will guarantee the quality of this important and commercially valuable fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La joven Maria C. a sus 27 años de edad es toda una mujer de campo acostumbrada al trabajo duro de la agricultura, vive en La concepción, San Caralampio una zona que se caracteriza por ser agrícola cultivando mayormente frutas. Tiene 3 hijos de 13,11 y 8 años de edad, junto al padre de sus hijos cultivan piña, papaya y café. Se levanta a primera hora de la mañana a trabajar en sus tierras, con el sudor de su frente han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, son una pareja joven muy esforzada y trabajadora. Solicitan un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas de mantenimiento para su cosecha de piña y poder garantizar la calidad de esa fruta tan importante en el comercio de esa zona.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Roland is 47 years old and married. His wife works as a fruit merchant, buying and selling fruit to help with the family's expenses. He has 5 children; the eldest 3 are working and independent.
