For 30 years, Roland has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his plantation and the "Good Morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day: He rises before sunrise, and with love and hope he works the 3 fields of pineapple that generate his family's income. He is applying for a loan with which to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including the vitamins to improve his production. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated may hours of work during many months.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rolando de 47 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, compra y vende frutas para apoyar en los gastos familiares de ellos y sus 5 hijos, de los cuales los 3 mayores trabajan y son independientes. El señor Rolando desde hace 30 años vive muy feliz en su casita rodeado de su plantación y los buenos días de un lindo amanecer todos los días que se levanta antes que salga el sol, con amor e ilusión trabaja sus 3 manzanas de piña las que genera el sustento de su hogar. Solicita un crédito para comprar todo el insumo necesario para el mantenimiento de la cosecha que es como la vitamina necesaria para que su producción sea de lo mejor, con estos insumos garantizara el éxito de la calidad de su producción la cual durante meses ha dedicado horas de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural fertilizers for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Derlin Antonio

texts.es:
This young man, 27 years old, lives in Ticuantepe with his wife and 6 year old son. His wife sells agricultural products and together they work the land. With a lot of effort and work they have successfully increased their pineapple production. They work a standard plot and a half of pineapple. They are applying for a loan with which to buy the agricultural products for the maintenance of their crop. While they grow the crops they will later harvest, they will need to pay the household expenses and their loan payments and without the loan , what they need is outside of their reach. They have always worried about meeting their obligations and guaranteeing the quality of their product.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Este joven de 27 años de edad, vive en Ticuantepe acompañada de su pareja y un hijo de 6 años , su esposo es comerciante de productos agrícolas y a la vez junto a ella trabajan la tierra, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado sacar adelante su producción de piña, trabajan un manzana y media de piña y solicitan el crédito para comprar los productos agrícolas para su mantenimiento en vista que con lo que trabajan mientras se da la cosecha pagan los gastos del hogar y las obligaciones de su crédito y la cantidad necesaria para comprar todo lo que necesitan está fuera de su alcance, siempre se han preocupado por cumplir con sus obligaciones y por garantizar la calidad de su producto.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đới, who is 51 years old, resides with her husband and her three children in Quảng Xương which is in the Thanh Hóa province. Mrs. Đới has borrowed money in the past and she started a bamboo weaving business. This business was successful, but her profit margins were low. Recently, Mrs. Đới started a concrete cutting business and her family's income has substantially increased to approximately $250 USD a month. At this point, Mrs. Đới's sons work for others as laborers, but she would like to have them work for her company because of the construction boom in her province. Mrs. Đới is requesting a Kiva loan in the amount of $525 USD to purchase additional concrete cutting equipment.

Chị Đới Thị L., 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Các vòng vốn trước đây chị thường vay vốn mua tre nứa về đan thúng. Nghề này tuy mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng lợi nhuận thấp. Khi các con đã trưởng thành, chị L. vay vốn Quỹ đầu tư cho con mua máy khoan cắt bê tông. Nhờ có máy nên các con chị chủ động hơn trong công vệc không phải làm thuê cho các chủ máy khác như trước đây, đời sống gia đình cũng đã sung túc hơn nhiều. Thời gian gần đây trong vùng có nhiều công trình xây dựng nên lúc nào công việc khoan cắt bê tông của gia đình lúc nào cũng đông khách. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 250USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 525USD để mua thêm một máy nữa.

loans.use: Purchase concrete cutting equipment

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hà is 39 years old and she resides in Quảng Xương, which is in the province of Thanh Hóa. She has five minor children that she looks after, in addition to her farm, while her husband works away from the home as a truck driver. Although Mrs. Hà's husband takes home a decent wage, their family income could increase substantially if they had the capital to start a business. She wants to buy commercial goods and transport them back to her hometown where she can resell the merchandise for a profit. Mrs. Hà would like to obtain a Kiva loan in the amount of $575 USD to start this venture with the support of her husband's trucking business.

Chị Lê Thị Hà, 39 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Anh chị có 5 cháu đều dưới 18 tuổi. Chị ở nhà chăn nuôi còn anh lái xe tải chở hàng cho các công ty đồ cho các công trình. Nếu không có vốn thì chỉ thu được tiền công chuyên chở. Nếu có vốn đặt trước cho các công ty thì khi giá cả hàng hóa tăng sẽ thu được lợi nhuận. Là một tay lái có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm, lại chịu khó nên xe của anh Dũng, chồng chị, luôn có khách đặt hàng. Kinh tế gia đình khá giả, tuy đông con nhưng chị Hà đều nuôi con học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Chị rất vui được tham gia Quỹ, việc vay vốn thuận lợi, có vốn quay vòng và đem lại lợi nhuận cao cho gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị Hà xin vay 575USD để đầu tư cho chồng chở hàng.

loans.use: Resale of commercial goods

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Nỵ is a mature and experienced woman that has always been the primary breadwinner of her family. She was one of the first recipients of a microloan in her hometown. Initially, Mrs. Lê used the loan for farming, but as the living standards increased in her province, she started a new venture. MaN. residents of her area now own motorbikes and bicycles, so she started a repair shop where she is able to employ her son as a technician. Mrs. Lê's instinct for business has been proven successful and it has increased her family income to over $200 USD a month. She would like to expand the repair business by borrowing $400 USD to buy more parts and supplies.

Tuổi đã cao nhưng chị Lê Thị Nỵ còn khoẻ mạnh và là lao động chính trong gia đình. Chị tham gia khi Quỹ mới bắt đầu triển khai trên địa bàn huyện Quảng Xương. Lúc đầu vốn vay chủ yếu đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Hiện nay đời sống của người dân cũng đã có nhiều thay đổi, chị Nỵ bàn với chồng vay vốn cho con mở cửa hàng để sửa chữa xe máy xe đạp. Sau khi có vốn công việc của con trai chị Nỵ ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vốn vay quay vòng có hiệu quả hơn, kinh tế được cải thiện rõ rệt. Nghề sửa xe của con chị cũng vững nên khách sửa cũng đông hơn các quán khác. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 200-220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị N. dự định vay 400USD để cho con trai mua thêm phụ tùng để thay thế khi khách có nhu cầu.

loans.use: Expansion of repair business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê, who is 55 years old, resides with her husband and her youngest son in the province of Thanh Hóa. Her family's income has always been derived from fishing. In the past, Mrs. Lê's livelihood in fishing has suffered from a lack of capital to purchase the basic equipment that she needed. Now, her fishing business has been profitable after she was able to upgrade her boat. Since Mrs. Lê's monthly income has increased to $200 USD a month, she has used some of her profits to improve the quality of her family's life by purchasing a gas stove and television. Mrs. Lê would like to borrow $400 USD to equip her fishing vessel with more equipment.

Chị Lê Thị Tưởng, 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Quảng Xương. Chị sống cùng chồng và người con út. Kinh tế gia đình chị trước đây gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, nghề đánh cá mang lại thu nhập cao nhưng việc đầu tư cho nghề cũng rất lớn. Chị Tưởng bàn với chồng con và vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương mua công cụ đánh bắt. Có lưới và đồ nghề mới việc đánh bắt đem lại hiệu quả cao hơn rất nhiều, đời sống của gia đình cũng được cải thiện hơn. Chị Tưởng đã sắm được tivi, bếp ga và các vật dụng có giá trị khác trong gia đình. Với thu nhập hàng tháng là 200USD, vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD sắm thêm đồ nghề.

loans.use: Fishing equipment

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
PeopL. live around seashore depend on their sea fishing trips for living. They need good weather and good gears. Mrs. Lưu Thị Lệ, 60 years old, a 4th year member of the TYM Fund, invested all the funds from the last rounds of loans to new net and gears. She has a decent monthly income of 200USD and the family’s economy is quite stabL.. This time she is applying a loan of 400USD to buy 12 hanging nets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Người dân vùng biển thu nhập chủ yếu phụ thuộc vào những chuyến ra khơi. Ngoài yếu tố thời tiết, để việc đánh bắt có hiệu quả một yêu cầu tất yếu là phải có lưới và máy móc tốt. Vòng vốn trước chị Lưu Thị Lệ, 60 tuổi, thành viên năm thứ 4, đã vay và đầu tư cho việc mua máy. Nhờ có lưới mới, máy mới nên việc đánh bắt mang lại hiệu quả cao, kinh tế gia đình đã được cải thiện rõ rêt. Việc vay vốn trả tuần hoàn toàn phù hợp với chị Lệ. Vòng này chị Lệ xin vay 400USD để mua 12 treo lưới phục vụ việc đánh bắt. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình chị là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy nets and gears for sea fishing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 years old, had the hardest of time when it was almost impossible for them to find a group with the TYM Fund. When joined, she was allowed a loan of lowest limit amount. She invests the funds from those small loans wisely in livestock. Her husband and her children chip in from their wages. The family’s economy improves. She is in the process of building their new house. With it they won’t be worry much when weather turns bad. She is grateful for the goodness of the Fund. Next round she is applying for a loan of 575USD to buy more piglets. She also would buy bamboo to weave baskets to sell. The profit from selling baskets is used to make weekly payments. The family’s monthly income now is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 tuổi, trước đây gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Rất vất vả trong việc tìm nhóm cụm, khi tham gia chị Hương chỉ dám vay mức vốn tối thiểu. Các vòng vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả, cộng thêm sự hỗ trợ của chồng và con đi làm cửa vạn, chị mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao. Do sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên đời sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện. Chị Hương đang tiến hành làm một căn nhà mới khang trang. Với căn nhà này chị không còn phải lo lắng mỗi khi có mưa bão. Chị rất vui mừng vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ đời sống gia đình chị đã thoát khỏi cảnh túng thiếu. Vòng vốn tới chị Hương xin vay 575USD mua lợn chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng dành ra một phần tiền mua tre đan thúng. Đây cũng là một nguồn thu cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình hiện nay là 200USD.

loans.use: Buy piglets and bamboo

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in early 2007. She lives with her husband and two school age children. The family weave straw mattresses for living. Their oldest son who labors over sea also sends money home to help his parents. At first, she was afraid to borrow thinking unable to repay, but finally she took out a 200USD loan to buy straw, raw material of straw mattress. Their mattresses are always popular and oversold. The average monthly income is 130-150USD. This second loan she is applying is 325USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đầu năm 2007. Chị sống với chồng và hai con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là dệt chiếu. Người con lớn đi lao động ở nước ngoài cũng thường gửi tiền về phụ giúp bố mẹ. Thời gian Quỹ mới về hoạt động chị Nồng không dám tham gia vì sợ không trả được. Thấy chị em trong thôn vay trả thuận lợi, chị bàn với chồng vay 200USD về mua thêm cói dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập đồng thời tạo việc lúc rãnh rỗi. Kinh nghiệm dệt chiếu của gia đình chị có thâm niên nên chỉ sau vài tháng sử dụng vốn vay chị cảm thấy yên tâm với việc trả tuần. Chiếu dệt ra của chị được rất nhiều người ưa thích, thu nhập bình quân đạt 130-150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn thứ hai này chị tiếp tục xin vay 325USD về mua cói.

loans.use: Buy straw, raw material to make straw mattresses

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Tân, 55 years old, farms a rice paddy and raises livestock. Her husband and children are government cadres. Work occupies her time when no one home. At the time she first joined the TYM Fund, she took out a loan to invest in her livestock. After four years and many more loans, she accumulates a nice sum of money from livestock selling. She used the funds to open a grocery store. Her store is popular and the business is prospered. The average monthly income is 200-22-USD. She is applying for a loan of 450USD for investing more to her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chồng con đều là cán bộ làm tại cơ quan nhà nước, chị Phạm Thị Tân, 55 tuổi, ở nhà làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Có công việc giúp chị cảm thấy vui hơn những lúc nhà vắng người. Khi bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ chị vay vốn chỉ để hỗ trợ thêm cho chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập. Sau 4 năm những đồng tiền lãi thu được từ tiền bán lợn cũng được kha khá. Bên cạnh vốn tự có, chị Tân bàn với gia đình vay thêm vốn đầu tư mở cửa hàng bán tạp hóa. Sang đến năm nay, thấy công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi chị Tân tiếp tục xin vay 450USD lấy thêm hàng bán. Có duyên bán hàng cộng với giá cả phải chăng nên cửa hàng của chị luôn đông khách và phát triển tốt. Thu nhập hiện tại của hai vợ chồng chị Tân là 200-220USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Tính, 28 year old, is a young, hardworking woman and a entrepreneur. Because of that, she and her husband is better off than other same age couples. They moved from rice farming to butchering pork and beef to deliver to meat stands. The family’s economy is much better and the two small children are also taken care better since the move. The monthly income is 180-200USD. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to invest in there butchering business. She is a 3rd year member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tuổi còn trẻ nhưng nhờ chịu thương chịu khó biết tính toán làm ăn nên cuộc sống gia đình chị Phạm Thị Tính, 28 tuổi, ổn định hơn so với các đôi vợ chồng trẻ khác. Nếu trước đây chỉ nhìn vào thu nhập từ nông nghiệp, mức thu thấp thì từ khi tham gia Quỹ chị Tính có thêm nguồn thu khá ổn định từ buôn bán. Nắm bắt thị trường giá cả tăng lên chị cùng chồng chuyển sang nghề buôn và giết mổ lợn, bò nhập cho các cửa hàng. Từ nguồn thu này kinh tế gia đình đã tăng lên rõ rệt, hai con chị được chăm lo đầy đủ hơn. Thu nhập hàng tháng của hai vợ chồng là 180-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị Tính tiếp tục xin vay 825USD mua bò lợn về mổ thịt bán. Chị hiện đang là thành viên năm thứ 3 Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy bulk meat for the butchering business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Khánh, 32, joined TYM fund in 2003. At first, she applied for a small loan because she was not sure if she would be able pay. But it turned out that she was successful so in later rounds, she applied for max loan. Her loans were used to raise poultry or buying bamboo to weave baskets. Now she notices that there is not much rice husking establishment in the area, she applies for a loan to start up a rice husking business. She needs the money to buy the machinery. She hopes that it would help increase her income, currently at 130 USD a month. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and their 2 young children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Khánh, 32 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Những vòng vốn đầu chị Khánh chỉ dám vay mức vốn thấp vì sợ không trả được. Sau khi sử dụng vốn vay, kinh tế gia đình phát triển tốt hơn, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ thường được chị sử dụng vào chăn nuôi hoặc mua tre đan thúng. Hiện nay, nhận thấy dịch vụ xay xát lúa gạo trên địa bàn còn chưa nhiều, chị Khánh làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua máy xay xát kinh doanh hoạt động này. Chị hy vọng sẽ nâng được mức thu nhập 130USD/tháng hiện tại lên trong năm nay. Chị Khánh đang sống với chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: Buy machine to husk rice

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trịnh Thị D. is 49, she lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and their children. 2 of their 3 children are attending university in the city, this is such a great accomplishment for her and her husband Mrs D. makes sedge mats for a living. She joined TYM to obtain capital to invest in this business. It is suitable for making the weekly payment. Whenever she needs help, her husband is there for her. With the extra revenue for selling the mats it helps her family financially, providing their children with better condition to continue their higher education. This time she requests a loan of 400 USD to buy sedge.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị D., 49 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị D. đang theo học đại học, cao đẳng trên thành phố. Với người dân làm nông nghiệp việc nuôi con cái ăn học đến nơi đến chốn không phải dễ. Tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, chị D. chọn vay mức vốn phù hợp để phát triển nghề phụ làm chiếu. Công việc này rất phù hợp với việc trả tiền tuần. Mỗi khi có khó khăn, chồng chị, một công nhân nghỉ hưu lại hỗ trợ thêm cho vợ. Có thêm thu nhập kinh tế gia đình được củng cố, các con chị D. có điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ hơn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD mua lác, đay dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Viên Thi. D. is 30 years old. She is married and has a 5 years old son. Most of the women from her village make the traditional sedge mats for a living but not her. She owns a clothing store. Since the living standard of the people has improved a lot lately, they now pay attention to the way they dress so her store is very popular. Since she joined TYM, it had given her capital to invest in her store and expand to satisfy the demand. Last year she has bought a car to transport the merchandise. This time she is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy fabrics.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Không giống những người dân trong làng chủ yếu chọn nghề truyền thống làm chiếu, chị Viên Thị D., 30 tuổi, mở cửa hàng may mặc tại trung tâm thôn. Đời sống nhân dân ngày càng cao, việc ăn mặc cũng được chú trọng nên cửa hàng nhà chị D. lúc nào cũng đông khách. Tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn đầu tư, việc vay trả thuận lợi nên quy mô cửa hàng được mở rộng đáp ứng nhu cầu người dân. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển, năm vừa qua chị đã mua được xe máy thuận tiện hơn trong việc chở hàng. Vòng vốn này chị D. xin vay 400USD lấy vải, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 5 tuổi.

loans.use: Buy fabrics

loans.name: Salam Din

texts.en: Salam Din lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 3 children. All of them are married. He lives alone with his wife, and he has a small business in agriculture. He studied agriculture at the university. He loves his business, and he has plenty of land in Kabul so he is able to continue his business. He has requested an individual loan to complete all his necessity materials and buy more seeds so that he can plant all his land and make good income to support his wife and himself. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To complete all his necessity materials

loans.name: Karim Khan

texts.en: Karim Khan lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family, and he has a small business in agriculture. He is an educated man but he has lots of experience in his work. He has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years, and he is managing to support his family. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to expand his business and make good income to help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To expand his small business

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.en:
Dulce María is thirty-three years old and sells cosmetics items to women in her Herrera community of Santo Domingo. Dulce is a very smart and experienced entrepreneur. She explains that she pays heed to customer demand and when her clientele ask for certain items, she adds the requested products to her inventory.

With her loan, the entrepreneur plans on buying a showcase to display her products. Dulce María hopes that her business can keep on growing. That will allow her better fend for her five children.

loans.use: Purchase of a showcase for a business selling cosmetics

loans.name: Noreyba Altagracia

texts.en:
Noreyba lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní where she runs a small business selling pants to men and women. Noreyba is forty years old and mother of seven children, four of whom still live with her. She explains that a large family is hard to keep up, but she says she’d move heaven and earth to provide food and good education for them.

The entrepreneur wants to enlarge her business. She plans on using her loan to buy a collection of fashionable shirts to add to her stock. Noreyba wants to work better and increase her income for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To invest a collection of shirts to add to her stock

loans.name: Mercedes Odila

texts.en:
Mercedes is an older and experienced businesswoman who lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní.  To make a living and help her husband support their children, she retails fuel to motorcycle and cars owners.  Mercedes humbly explains that “you won’t get rich by doing this business”, but she mentions that now she can face many financial issues and support her children’s education.  Actually the entrepreneur has seven children, all of whom are in their twenties.
With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more fuel so that she can keep running her business and satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fuel for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Juana Dania

texts.en: Juana is thirty-three years old and the mother of two boys, eleven and fifteen years old, both of whom attend school.  To supplement her family’s income, Juana sells women’s clothing in the Río Arriba community of San Cristobal. A good number of her customers are friends and neighbors, but  Juana also travels far away from her community to sell her goods.  The entrepreneur is enthusiastic about the opportunity to increase her stock with her loan.  She explains that her business will allow her support her children’s education and her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to add to her stock

loans.name: Crucita

texts.en:
Crucita is in her late forties and she’s the mother of a large family. Actually, Crucita has five daughters and three boys, most of whom are in their twenties. To make a living and support her family, Crucita sells fresh pork in the Río Arriba community of Baní. Each day, Crucita goes to the butcher’s shop to purchase pork wholesale. She has a well-established clientele to retail it to.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to add chicken to her stock in order to attract more people and increase her income. Crucita’s business supports her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and pork for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Santa Maritza

texts.en:
Santa Maritza is a single parent of three sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school.  She lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní, and there she operates a small business selling pants to men and women.  That activity has been the principal source of income of her family after she separated from her husband and was left alone with their four children.  Santa explains that supporting the children is hard work, but she’ll keep fighting to fend for her children.
With her loan, Santa Maritza will buy more pants in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

loans.use: Purchase of pants for re-sale

loans.name: Santa Benita

texts.en:
Santa Benita, a thirty-year-old woman and mother of five children, lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní. To supplement her family’s income, she sells a collection of shirts, pants, and underwear to women of her community. Santa Benita explains that her family is very needy, so she has to work hard to make money and help her husband support the children’s education.

With her loan, Santa Benita will buy more clothing. She says she’ll get the products from a new supplier who is offering the goods at very low prices. Santa Benita hopes that her business’ growth will help her improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire more pants, shirts, and underwear for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a living example of a hard-working woman with the desire to better herself. Actually, in spite of her blindness, Juana has been able to become a great entrepreneur and currently she has one of the most well-established mini-markets in the Río Arriba community of Baní. Each day, thousands of people visit her mini market to purchase goods such as vegetables, milk, beer, rice, and the like. A brother of hers helps her to attend to the customers.

Juana is still single and lives with Mom. She explains that the business helps her support herself and her mother. “This business is my sustenance," she says.

With her loan, Juana plans to buy another freezer to keep beverages cold. She’ll also buy other supplies for her market. The entrepreneur says that she’d like to see her business grow to the point where she can buy a new locale, and "turn the mini-market into a Big Store with millions of products".

loans.use: Purchase of products for her little grocery store

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị Cù is 60 years old. She is one of the most active members and an exemplary entrepreneur of TYM, branch Phúc Yên. In 1999 when TYM opened Phúc Yên branch, she was the first to join. She also encouraged her daughter and daughters in law to do the same. Today there are 4 members from her family who are TYM members, their loans from TYM range from 700 to 1200 USD which are well invested. Since her house is well located, Mrs Cù has opened a store selling pop soda, cookies, snacks and also grocery. Her business is stable and it provides her with cash flow. Every time the loans officers come to visit her, they are always greeted warmly. Her husband is very supportive of her and encourages his children. Their wish is to remain TYM member for a long time to come, to be qualified for bigger loan so that they can expand their business and increase their revenue. This time Mrs Cù is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Cù, 60 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tích cực, điển hình của chi nhánh Phúc Yên. Năm 1999 khi Quỹ về địa phương chị là người hăng hái tham gia đầu tiên, ngoài ra chị còn vận động con gái, con dâu cùng tham gia vào Quỹ. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 4 người là thành viên của cụm và đều vay vốn lớn từ 700 đến 1200USD, sử dụng đúng mục đích và cho thu nhập cao. Với địa thế nhà gần đường thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh buôn bán, chị Cù đầu tư vào các mặt hàng bánh kẹo, nước giải khát và các hàng hoá sinh hoạt khác. Công việc của chị cho thu nhập rất ổn định hàng ngày. Mỗi lần đến thăm chị và gia đình, chúng tôi đều được đón tiếp với một thái độ cởi mở, thân thiết. Chồng chị là người rất am hiểu về Quỹ và luôn ủng hộ tạo điều kiện cho vợ và các con cùng tham gia. Tâm sự của họ là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để tiếp tục vay vốn lớn hơn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị Cù xin vay 1200USD mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị L. is 44 years old and her husband 51. They have 2 children: the older one works for Honda factory and the younger one still goes to school. Mrs L. participates actively in cultural events, promoting culture and arts in her village. In 2002 to celebrate TYM 10th year anniversary, her husband (Mr Trung) has produced a play in which she was the main character. She had won the first place prize with her role. Beside these activities, Mrs L. raises pigs to make a living. This time she will expand her pig raising business. She just sold a batch of 26 pigs worth more than 3000 USD, after all the expenses she made a profit of 1000 USD. Right now she has 17 pigs in her stable which are ready for sale. Her business grows steadily and it secures her family income. This time she requests a L. of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị L. là một trong những gia đình văn hóa điển hình của chi nhánh Phúc Yên. Chị L. năm nay 44 còn anh 51 tuổi. Anh chị có 2 con, cháu đầu làm công nhân công ty Honda, cháu út còn đi học. Ngoài việc tham gia vay vốn, chị L. còn tham gia đóng góp nhiều cho phong trào văn hoá văn nghệ của cụm và xã. Điển hình năm 2002 nhân dịp kỷ niệm 10 năm thành lập Quỹ, anh Trung, chồng chị, là người sáng tác vở kịch ca ngợi Quỹ và chị là nhân vật chính đạt giải nhất. Dự án lần này chị L. đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn thịt. Vừa qua chị cho xuất chuồng 26 con với số tiền hơn 3000USD sau khi đã trừ tất cả chi phí còn lãi 1000USD. Hiện tại trong chuồng còn 17 con cũng sắp cho xuất chuồng. Dự án chăn nuôi của chị L. đang rất phát triển và hứa hẹn cho thu nhập ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 55 years old, joined TYM since 1999.  Her first two childrens are both grown up and have their own family, she lived with her husband and the youngest child at Phuc Yen of Vinh Phuc Province.  As the head of the women union in the village, she was the pioneer when it come to TYM and micro-credit.  Due to the suitable repayment period, everyone has been able to make use of their loans and increased their family's incomes.  A very active member of the community and a very trustworthy person, she has been voted in as the head of the women union for many years.  She has been using her loan to buy and resell medicines.  During this cycle, she would like to ask for another 1200 USD to buy additional medicines.  Her family monthly income has been around 200-220 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. 2 người con lớn đã trưởng thành, chị sống cùng chồng và người con út tại Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc. Là chi hội trưởng hội phụ nữ, sớm nhận thấy lợi ích khi tham gia vào Quỹ nên ngay từ những ngày đầu chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia và vận động nhiều chị em khác. Cơ chế hoàn trả tuần phù hợp với chị em khiến kinh tế của những thành viên tham gia được nâng lên trông thấy. Chị được mọi người tin tưởng và nhiều năm liền được bầu làm cụm trưởng. Ngoài ra chị Hạnh cũng là một trong những thành viên mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn đầu tư có hiệu quả nên việc hoàn trả rất đảm bảo. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ được chị Hạnh đầu tư cho việc buôn bán thuốc tân dược. Công việc bên Hội phụ nữ bận rộn, lại thêm phục vụ sức khoẻ cho bà con trong thôn nhưng chị vẫn luôn tham gia tích cực vào các hoạt động của cụm và chi nhánh. Vòng vốn này chị Hạnh tiếp tục vay 1200USD để mua thêm thuốc bán. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 200-220USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy medicines

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.vi:
Like a lot of other families, Phùng Thị K. family living condition was difficult before joining TYM. Mrs K. is 56 years old. Beside working on the family rice field, she did not have have any side job . Their house is very small so it is cramped. She also has a lot of children so things are really difficult. Her first loan from TYM was 200 USD which was used to raise pigs. She had barely enough money to feed her children. After years of hard work and determination, her children had grown up. They have a job so they could contribute financially. With her savings, she had built a house worth 6000-7000 USD. Her dream has come true. When the loan officers came to visit her in her new house, she was very emotional when she talked about how TYM had helped her turn her life around. Her wish is to remain a TYM member forever, continuing her business. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a new batch of breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cùng với một số gia đình khác trước khi tham gia Quỹ, hoàn cảnh gia đình chị Phùng Thị K., 56 tuổi, thuộc diện khó khăn. Ngoài làm mấy sào ruộng, chị cũng không có nghề phụ gì thêm, căn nhà nhỏ tạm bợ rất chật chội. Nhà lại đông con nên khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn. Ban đầu chị chỉ vay một hai trăm USD đầu tư chăn nuôi nhỏ. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ rau cỏ đủ cho nhu cầu sinh hoạt tối thiểu cho gia đình. Sau nhiều năm vất vả, chịu thương chịu khó, các con chị giờ đây đã trưởng thành. Số tiền các con đi làm tích cóp cộng với vốn vay, chị đã xây được căn nhà rất khang trang trị giá 6000-7000USD. Mơ ước của chị giờ đã thành hiện thực. Khi chúng tôi đến thăm gia đình thì căn nhà đã hoàn tất, với niềm vui mừng chị K. không giấu được vẻ xúc động khi nói về những thay đổi của gia đình từ khi tham gia Quỹ. Nguyện vọng của chị là sẽ tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và mãi mãi, tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị cho vòng này là 1200USD mua lợn giống thay cho lứa lợn mới xuất chuồng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 35 years old, was among the first participants of TYM. During her first few loan cycle, she try to sell vegetables to restaurants nearby. As new policies are put in place, she and her husband bravely ask for funds to unearth a small ponds to raise fishes, pigs and plants fruit trees. Currently, her family's income has been quite good and stable. She has more than 6 pole perches to raise fishes, 4 rods of lands to plant fruit trees (such as mango and papaya) and about 5 quintal of pigs ready to sell. At the end of 2007, Mrs. H. sell about 1 ton of porks and received around 2500 USD (which resulted in a profit of 800 USD). She also sell other things at the market for additional income. Her husband always try to help out as much as possible so she can have time to participate in events organized by the group. During this loan cycle, she would like to ask for 1200 USD to buy breed-fishes and food-stuff for her domestics animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 35 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tham Quỹ từ những ngày đầu tiên. Những vòng vốn đầu chị đầu tư vào kinh doanh rau cỏ xuất cho các quán ăn. Khi có chủ trương dồn điền đổi thửa chị H. đã bàn bạc với chồng và mạnh dạn đổi một mẫu ruộng quy hoạch để đào ao thả cá, trồng cây ăn quả, chăn nuôi lợn tập chung. Cho đến nay dự án của gia đình đang cho thu nhập tương đối cao và ổn định. Hiện tại chị có hơn 6 sào ao thả cá, gần 4 sào vườn trồng cây ăn quả như soài, đu đủ ... và khoảng 5 tạ lợn sắp cho xuất chuồng. Cuối năm 2007 chị H. bán gần 1 tấn lợn thịt thu 2500USD sau khi trừ chi phí còn lãi hơn 800USD. Ngoài ra chị vẫn chạy chợ hàng ngày để tăng thêm thu nhập. Chồng chị luôn tạo điều kiện và giúp đỡ công việc gia đình để chị có thời gian tham gia vào các hoạt động chung của cụm. Vòng vốn này chị H. đề nghị xin vay 1200USD mua cá giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for her domestic animals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Joined TYM since 1999, Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 38 years old, was among the first to take out a large loan in the time when many others were still caution. With the advantage of a large garden and pond, she started with raising ducks, pigs and fishes while planting fruits With over 200 ducks in her coop, the income from their eggs has been quite stable and has enable her to always repay the loan on time. Apart from these ducks, she also has many sows, 3 pole perch to raise fishes and 2 rods planting shaddock. She always like to borrow a large loan to expand business so she would also like to take out a loan of 1200 USD this time. Her family income is from 200-230 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải, 38 tuổi, là một thành viên năng động, dám nghĩ dám làm. Tham gia Quỹ năm 1999, trong lúc nhiều thành viên khác còn ngại trong việc vay những mức vốn lớn thì chị là người đầu tiên trong cụm vay vốn đầu tư làm trang trại. Tận dụng vườn ao thuận lợi cho việc chăn nuôi, chị Hải đầu tư nuôi vịt đẻ, lợn sinh sản, ao cá và vườn cây ăn quả. Hơn 200 vịt đẻ hàng ngày cho thu nhập từ trứng rất đều dặn và ổn định là một nguồn bảo đảm chắc chắn cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Ngoài số vịt đẻ hiện tại chị Hải có H. đàn lợn nái, hơn 3 sào ao thả cá và 2 sào vườn trồng bưởi diễn. Dự án của chị hứa hẹn cho một mùa thu hoạch bội thu. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay các mức vốn lớn mở rộng qui mô dự án. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Hải lần này là 1200USD. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình là 200-230USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs, ducks and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Minh T., 46 years old, has been in TYM since the very first days of operation. Her main activity is retail so she has a very quick turnover and is able to repay her loan on time. Dynamic and very sharp, in 9 year with the organization, she has taken out many loans to trade woods, selling honey... meeting both successes and failures. With all of these experiences, she now turn to selling poultry. She buy chickens and ducks from nearby villages in the morning and resell them at retail stores and restaurants. Her monthly income has been quite stable and is around 250 to 300 USD. She would like to borrow another 1200 USD this cycle to expand her business and buy more ducks and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Tham gia Quỹ từ những ngày đầu tiên, chị Nguyễn Thị Minh Tuyết, 46 tuổi, là một trong số thành viên mạnh dạn vay vốn tối đa. Hoạt động của chị Tuyết là buôn bán nên khả năng xoay vòng vốn và cho thu nhập rất tốt. Là một người năng động, dám nghĩ dám làm, lại nhạy bén với thị trường, trong 9 năm tham gia chị Tuyết đã thực hiện nhiều dự án đầu tư như: Buôn bán gỗ, buôn bán mật ong ... Thành công cũng nhiều mà thất bại cũng không ít. Với những kinh nghiệm tích lũy được, vài năm trở lại đây chị Tuyết chuyển sang buôn gà vịt. Hàng ngày chị đi lấy gà, vịt ở các xã, huyện lân cận bán buôn cho các đại lý và các quán ăn. Thu nhập rất tốt, bình quân một tháng chị thu từ 250-300USD. Vốn đầu tư cho dự án cần nhiều nên mong muốn của chị Tuyết là sẽ tiếp tục vay vốn nhiều hơn trong các năm tới. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy ducks, chickens

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 49 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 1998. Her family includes Mrs. D., her husband, and their two grown-up children. Her main job is farming and breeding animals. Besides, she also collect recyclables and sell to earn extra money for the weekly repayments. Most of her loan is used towards buying piglets, and what left is used for recyclables collecting. Each day she earns about 3-4USD from collecting and selling recyclables. Each year she sold about 3 litters of pigs, which is about 1000USD. Her job is going smoothly and the loan is used efficiently. Mrs. D. wants to borrow 575USD to continue her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Độ, 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành. Công việc của chị Độ là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Sau khi vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương, chị buôn bán phế liệu để có tiền trả tuần. Vốn vay được dùng chủ yếu cho việc mua lợn giống và một phần nhỏ dành cho thu mua phế liệu. Thu nhập hàng ngày từ thu mua phế liệu khoảng 3-4USD. Hàng năm chị cho xuất chuồng 3 lứa lợn thu nhập trên dưới 1000USD. Công việc thuận lợi và mang lại hiệu quả, vòng vốn này chị Độ xin vay 575USD để tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi D., 58 years old, has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2004. She uses most of her loans for her chicken breeding. Her loans increase each year, together with the profit from her job. In 2007, Mrs. D. earned a profit of 800USD (after deducting all the cost of buying chickens and chicken food). In 2008, according to TYM Fund policy, she is now qualified for the loan of 575USD to expand her business. Right now she is living with her husband and their only child in Y Yen, Nam Dinh province.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Đào, 58 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2004. Các vòng trước chị Đào sử dụng vốn chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi gà. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ lớn dần theo các năm tham gia, lợi nhuận cũng tăng theo mức vốn. Năm 2007, sau khi trừ chi phí mua gà giống, thức ăn, chị Đào lãi được khoảng 800USD. Sang năm 2008, theo quy định của Quỹ, chị đã đủ điều kiện và xin vay mức vốn 575USD đầu tư mở rộng dự án của mình. Hiện chị Đào đang sống cùng chồng và người con duy nhất tại Ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi L. is 50 years old, and her husband is 52 years old. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2006. She uses her loans to buy piglets to breed. Besides that, she also makes alcohol (from rice) and sell to gain extra money for her weekL. payments. She uses the distiller's grain to feed the animals. Her first two loans (200-300USD) bring good, yet limited improvement to the quality of her life. In 2008, TYM Fund has changed some policy, so Mrs. L. wants to borrow 575USD to buy piglets and rice (to make alcohol). She hopes her famiL.'s immediate income of 150USD/month will increase this year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Lý năm nay 50 tuổi còn chồng chị 52. Anh chị có 2 con đều đã ngoài 20 tuổi. Chị Lý tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Vốn vay được chị đầu tư mua lợn giống. Kết hợp với nuôi lợn chị cũng nấu rượu để có tiền hoàn trả tuần và tận dụng bã rượu làm thức ăn gia súc. 2 vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng mức vốn 200-300USD mang lại hiệu quả nhất định. Sang năm 2008, khi Quỹ có quy chế mới, chị Lý xin vay 575USD về mua lợn con và gạo để nấu rượu. Chị hi vọng mức thu nhập 150USD/tháng của gia đình sẽ được nâng lên trong năm nay.

loans.use: Buy pigs and rice

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi N., 39 years old, is now in her 9th year as a member of TYM Fund branch in Y Yen (Vietnam). She lives with her husband and three children who are still in school. Her main job now is to make plaster statues to sell. In order to have the fund to buy plaster, she borrows from TYM Fund (Kiva Partner). On average, each day she makes 30 to 50 statues, each is sold ranging from couple of dollars to some tens of dollars, depending on the size of the statue. About once every week, her husband, Mr. Sao will go to Hue city to sell those statues. Her statues is sold out quickly. After deducting all costs and expenses, each month her family earns about 170-200USD. Now she would like to borrow 575USD to buy plaster to make statue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị N., 39 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Ý Yến. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chủ yếu của chị hiện nay là làm tượng bán. Để có vốn mua thạch cao làm tượng, chị vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương. Trung bình mỗi ngày chị làm 30-50 bức tượng, giá mỗi bức từ vài USD đến vài chục USD tùy theo kích cỡ. Khoảng 1 tuần, anh Sao, chồng chị lại mang tượng vào Huế bán. Hàng bán rất chạy, thu nhập sau khi trừ chi phí hàng tháng gia đình chị N. đạt từ 170-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị N. tiếp tục xin vay 575USD mua nguyên liệu làm tượng.

loans.use: Buy plaster

loans.name: Ninh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ninh Thi M., 47 years old, joined TYM Fund since 1999. She lives with her husband and two grown-up children in Yen Dong, Y Yen (Vietnam). Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. M.'s life is very difficult because she only has a small farmland and her income is very low. Mrs. M. used her loans to breed pigs. Each year she earned a profit of some hundred dollars. In 2003, Mrs. M. started to carve wood for manufacturers who produce chairs and tables. She often get the orders and then buy wood to carve the specific design that the manufacturers wanted. The job is not easy, yet it brings pretty high income to her family. On average, each month she earns about 170-200USD. This time she wants to borrow 400USD to buy wood to carve.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ninh Thị Mỹ, 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành tại Yên Đồng, Ý Yên. Trước khi vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn nhiều khó khăn do ruộng ít, thu nhập thấp. Chị Mỹ vay vốn về đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn. Sau mỗi năm chị thu được một khoản lợi nhuận vài trăm USD. Đến năm 2003, chị chuyển sang nghề trạm trổ đồ gỗ cho các cơ sở làm bàn ghế. Chị Mỹ thường nhận đơn đặt hàng sau đó mua gỗ về chế tác theo yêu cầu của khách. Công việc đục đẽo cũng vất vả nhưng mang lại thu nhập tương đối cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Mỹ thu từ 170-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 400USD về mua gỗ làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Soer

texts.en: Mrs. Soer S., a 31-year-old fish seller in Chrang Chamres II Commune near Phnom Penh City, earns about $15 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ung Kosal, 29 years old, has been a motorcycle taxi driver since 1990, earning about $5 per day. They have four children, all of whom are students. With the goal of expanding their business, they request a loan of $1,000. They would like to increase their income so they can continue to send their children to school and eventually to university. They thank Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To increase capital to expand their business

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong C., 37 years old, is a dried fish seller earning $10 per day in Chrang Chamres II Commune, Phnom Penh City. Her husband, 40-year-od Mr. Men Sophorn, drives a motorcycle taxi, earning about $5 per day. They have five children living with them, and due to growing family expenses, they need to expand their business to increase income.

They request a loan of $800 to buy fish stock and renovate their home to make it easier to dry the fish. With their expansion, they promise prompt loan repayment. They thank Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To buy fish stock and renovate their home to make it easier to dry fish.

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum Toy and Mr. Chap Y. (he is pictured alone because his wife wasn't available at the time) live in the Chrok Poun Village, Kompong Cham Province, where they grow vegetables to sell in the market, earning about $4 per day. They have five children, one of whom contributes about $1.50 per day to the family by working in the garment factory; the rest are students.

They work very hard everyday to sustain the family and now ask for a loan of $300 to increase their working capital in vegetable growing and to buy jackfruit trees to sell fruit to customers in the market. They thank Kiva and promise to be prompt in their loan payment.

loans.use: To increase their working capital in vegetable growing and to buy jackfruit trees to sell fruit to customers in the market.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 31, is a garment worker and raises pigs from her house in Chomkar Khpob Village in Kompong Cham Province. She earns up to $4 per day and has two children, both of whom are students. Her husband, Mr. Long Nhor, is a 37-year-old bricklayer who earns about $2.50 per day. In order to upgrade her pig-raising business, she now requests a $300 loan to buy three more pigs and to grow vegetable crops.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs and to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Gidin

texts.id:
Giding is a used goods collector who collects used goods to be resold to recycle depot. He usually walks up to 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum, iron and glass such as bottles. He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand (around USD 100) per month from this work, which he uses to pay for his rent, daily necessities and even to be saved for some.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Gidin adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Gidin harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Gidin mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Gidin

texts.en: Gidin adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Gidin harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa  barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Gidin mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Modal untuk membeli barang bekas

loans.name: Rawandi

texts.id:
Rawandi is a used goods collector. He collects used goods and then resells them to recycle depot. He has a 2 years old son. He usually walks up to 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum and glass such as bottles. He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand (around USD 100) per month from this work which he uses to pay for his rent, his daily necessities and also to be saved for some amount.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Rawandi adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Rawandi mempunyai seorang anak laki-laki yang masih kecil dengan usia 2 tahun. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Rawandi harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Rawandi mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: to purchase more used goods (Untuk menambah modal membeli barang-barang bekas)

loans.name: Mohamad Dahlan

texts.id:
Mohamad Dahlan is a gasoline reseller. Assisted by his wife, he opens a small stall (warung) for the place to sell gasoline. He can sell up to 250 liter of gasoline per day.

He gets the gasoline from the distributor by paying IDR 2,700 per liter (around USD 0.3). He then sells it for IDR 3,000 per liter (around USD 0.33) where he can earn IDR 300/ liter profit from it.

As it is difficult to get gasoline recently (because of the scarcity), he wants to add up the stock level so he can at least have some continuity in selling the gasoline. However this of course requires a lot of money. Therefore he hopes that he can get the loan money to funding this plan.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mohamad Dahlan memiliki usaha sebagai penjual minyak tanah untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, dengan di bantu istrinya mereka melakukan aktifitas tersebut di sebuah warung yang mereka miliki. Setiap hari Dahlan mampu menjual minyak tanah sekitar 250 liter, minyak yang dijualnya didapatkan dari agen minyak tanah dengan harga 2.700 rupiah/liter dan dijual dengan harga 3.000 rupiah/liter, jadi Dahlan mengambil keuntungan 300 rupiah/liternya. Karena minyak tanah sekarang susah di dapat Dahlan berencana untuk menambah stock minyak tanah yang tentunya membutuhkan modal yang tidak sedikit, dan dengan modal tersebut harapan Dahlan untuk mendapatkan keuntungan lebih banyak dapat tercapai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: To add up his gasoline stock level (Modal untuk menambah stock Minyak Tanah)

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem Y., 58, of the Chum Teav Village in Banteay Meanchey Province, earns about $3 per day as a grocer selling products from her house. Her husband, Mr. Keo Ton, is 72 years old and has been a farmer and bicycle repairman since 1997. He earns around $2 per day. Mrs. Y. has eight children, seven of whom are married. Another lives with her and earns about $1.50 per day raising pigs.

Mrs. Y. is requesting a loan of $700 to increase her grocery stock and buy small pigs to raise. With her sustainable business and desire to expand for the future, she works hard everyday. She thanks Kiva for support and promises prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock and buy small pigs to raise.

loans.name: Warno

texts.id:
Warno is a used goods collector who look for used goods, collects them to be resold to used goods depot (mainly for recycle purpose). He has a 1.5 year old daughter. He usually walks for 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum, iron and glasses such as bottles.

He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand per month (around USD 100/ month) from this work which he uses to pay his rent, to pay for his daily needs and even to be saved for some amount for future necessities.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Warno adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Warno mempunyai seorang anak perempuan yang masih kecil dengan usia 1,5 tahun. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Warno harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Warno mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Menambah modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Mistawi Budi

texts.id:
Mistawi Budi is a used goods collector. He looks for used goods, collects them to be resold. He lives in a rented room at Bedahulu street in Badung, Indonesia. He pays IDR 150,000 per month for this room (around USD 20/ month).

He drives his motorcycle everyday to residential areas, market places and office buildings to look for used goods. He hopes that with the loan money from Dinari, he can have more working capital to enable him to acquire more used goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mistawi Budi adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Mistawi menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Mistawi membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Menambah modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Hariyono

texts.id:
Hariyono is a bread vendor who has to travel 3 km from his home to sell bread. He does all this for his family. He lives with his wife and 2 year old child. He rents a 100 sq feet room for $11 per month. The rising costs of ingredients have affected his profit somehow. In the past he can sell 100 packs, now he can only make 80 packs to avoid big loss. He makes about $4.4 to $5.5 per day. It is barely enough to pay rent and daily needs. He hopes loan from DINARI may increase his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Hariyono adalah seorang penjual Roti yang setiapharinya harus menempuh perjalanan sekitar 3 kilometer dari tempat tinggalnya. Usaha ini dia lakukan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tinggal bersama istri dan anak yang berumur dua tahun ini mengontrak sebuah kamar yang berukuran 3x3 meter dengan membayar uang sewa sebesar 100.000/bulannya. Menurutnya naiknya harga bahan pokok makanan mempengaruhi usahanya berjualan roti, kalau dulu dia bisa menjual sampai 100 bungkus sekarang harus dibatasi 80 bungkus untuk menghindari kerugian yang besar. Keuntungan yang didapat Hariyono berkisar antara 40.000 – 50.000/harinya. Cukup untuk ditabung membayar uang sewa kamar dan kebutuhan setiaphari. “Sekarang kan saya mendapatkan bantuan modal dari DINARI kiranya ini dapat meningkatkan usaha saya dalam berjualan roti”. ungkapnya.

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients

loans.name: Wayan Sudiasih

texts.id:
Wayan Sudiasih sells fried banana fritters. She is never bored with her business that she started to help her husband in improving their family's financial situation. She purchases ingredients from local market every day. Lately the mother of two is complaining about the rising price of cooking oil, currently at $1.7 per kg, which has caused her earnings to decrease. Wayan Sudiasih sells her fritters in the market for 6 cents each. She hopes the funding assistance from DINARI can help her improve her business and help her family's financial situation in this difficult time.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Kesehariannya sebagai penjual pisang goreng tidak membuat Wayan Sudiasih bosan atau mengeluh dengan aktifitas yang dia tekuni selama ini. Untuk membantu suaminya dalam mengusahakan peningkatan perekonomian dalam keluarganya, Wayan Sudiasih harus pergi ke pasar setiap paginya untuk membeli bahan-bahan yang nantinya akan di buat pisang goreng. Ibu dari seorang anak yang berusia 7 tahun ini mengeluhkan harga minyak goreng yang sekarang mencapai 15.0000 rupiah/kg sehingga membuat penghasilan dari usahanya sedikit berkurang, Wayan Sudiasih menjual pisang gorengnya di pasar dengan harga 500 rupiah/buah disebabkan harga bahan baku yang naik. Bantuan permodalan yang diberikan DINARI diharapkan mampu membantu modal usahanya dalam meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga dimasa-masa sulit seperti ini.

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Sali

texts.id:
Sali is a used junk collector. He rents a room in Bedahulu road for $17 per month. He browsed through alleys in housing neighborhood and local market to collect junks that can be resold to recyclers. Sonetimes Sali purchased unused household junk from local housewives. The junks are valued by weight and quality. The loan for DINARI will be used to purchase more junks from junkyard workers. He hopes to improve his family's financial condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sali adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobak Sali menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sali membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Purchase more household junk to be recycled/resold

loans.name: Khursand

texts.en:
Z. Khursand is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Khursand is a market vendor. She is selling the foodstuff like butte, oil, coffee, and confectioneries like pastries, cookies, sweets, and candies. All the goods are purchased by Khursand in the central market of Dushanbe city and then are sold in the local market of the home city.

Khrsand has been in this business for 10 years. She has managed to make her business successful and generates a stable income for her family. Now she is planning to increase the range of goods to sell.

Khursand requests $600.00 for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Khursand, and she promises to repay it promptly and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to increase her range of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget S., 43, a garment worker in the Canadia garment factory, lives with her family in the Kork Chombak Village in Phnom Penh City. She earns about $2.50 per day and has three children, one of whom is a bicycle and motorcycle repairman who provides his family with about $2 per day; the remaining two are students. Her husband, Mr. Leang Ngim, is a 46-year-old motorcycle taxi driver who earns up to $2 per day.

Mrs. S. now requests a loan of $700 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband’s transportation business and to build a two-roomed house to rent out. Her husband is shown in the photo because S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband’s transportation business and to build a two-roomed house to rent out.

loans.name: Abdul Qaoum

texts.en: Abdul Qaoum lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two young kids. He has a bakery; they work together. He has good experience in his work and  he has also a good number of customers. He needs a loan to expand his small business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his inventory and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his small bakery

loans.name: Noto

texts.id:
Noto is a junk collector. He rents a roomin Bedahulu road for $ 17 per month. Noto traverses alleys in housing neighborhood, local market and business districts to obtain used junks. Noto mostly obtains junks from local housewives with no-longer usable household items. He purchases the junks by weight. The loan from DINARI will be used to purchase more junks from junkyard worker to be resold. He hopes that his economic situation will improve.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi Kiva Volunteer

Noto adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobaknya Noto menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Noto membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Increase fund to purchase used goods

loans.name: Sukarti

texts.id:
Sukarti is a trash collector that collects usable junks. She rents a room in Bedahulu road for $17 per month. With her cart Sukarti traverses housing and market alleys to collect used goods. She also purchases unusable junks from local housewives. Those junks are purchased by weight. Loan from DINARI will be used to purchase more junks from junkyard workers. She hopes to improve her family's financial situation in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sukarti adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobaknya Sukarti menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sukarti membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Purchase Used Items to be Resold/Recycled

loans.name: Sukarti

texts.en: Sukarti adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobaknya Sukarti menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sukarti membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Zas

texts.en: Mrs. Zas M., from the Mean Chey District, located about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City, buys fresh fish to dry and sell to customers from her home. She earns $3 per day and has six children, one of whom is married. Her husband, 53-year-old Mr. El Him, helps dry fish with his wife and is a part-time fisherman. With their increasing customer base, Mrs M. needs capital to expand the business.  She therefore requests a loan of $600 to buy more fresh fish to dry and sell.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S. and Mr. Tom Sothi live together with their two children in the Kork Chombak Village, Phnom Penh City. They are garment workers in the Hope Well garment factory, earning an average of $5 per day. Their children are students. Because of her business, S. can further her children’s studies and pay for her family’s living expenses. She is now asking for a $1200 loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and to convert her old house into a grocery-selling business location.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and to convert her old house into a grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep S., age 61, is a widow with three children who live at home. She rents rooms to garment workers for her income, earning approximately three dollars a day.

To increase the family’s income, she is requesting a loan to purchase food that she can in turn sell in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mr. Long N., 44, is a widower with no children and works as a construction laborer, making on average around five dollars a day. He lives with his elderly mother.

He wants to reduce his transportation expenses by using a loan, along with his savings, to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai N., 46, is a widow with five children and sells porridge and biscuits for income. She earns approximately three dollars a day. However, two of her children are employed as garment workers with salaries of $50 each per month. Another child works in China and two others are married and live away from home.

To increase the family’s income, Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to purchase two buffaloes. She will rent the buffalos to residents in her village to gain additional income.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes.

loans.name: Eoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eoeng R., age 33, lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a garment worker, earning approximately $1.80 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kean Sothea, 34, owns a plot of farmland and grows rice, making $1.70 a day. The children are students.

To generate more income to support the family, they are requesting a loan to purchase a new generator. The generator will be use to recharge the batteries in the village. Most of the villagers depend on batteries to power lights and TV's, etc. This will allow the family to save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new generator.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou S., age 44, is a mother of seven children and works for a tobacco company. She also owns a plot of farmland growing a variety of vegetables. On average, she earns approximately $1.50 a day. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses and also helps his wife grow vegetables. He also makes $1.50 a day.

One of their children is married and lives away from home, two daughters are employed by a garment factory with a salary $100 each a month and the other children are students and assist their parents.

This couple will use the loan to purchase a cow to help with the farm fields and to purchase pigs to raise for their use.

loans.use: To purchase  a cow and pigs.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba A. runs a small shop in a metro station entrance. She rents it from the metro department as a venue for selling souvenirs. She was a part-time teacher of literature in high school and her salary was low. So she decided to make a first step closer to becoming a business woman.

Now she runs this shop that mostly Muslim women visit. At the moment there’s a big demand for perfume that does not contain alcohol because Islam prohibits alcohol. Mahbuba needs this loan to purchase non-alcohol perfume and resell it. She is also planning to employ her friend who does handicrafts and will be making small souvenirs right in the shop, so clients can see how the product is made.

loans.use: Purchase of alcohol-free perfume for re-sale

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven S., 22, is married with two school-aged children and sells coffee, rice, noodles and other foods from her house. She earns approximately six dollars a day. Her husband supplements the household as a farmer. He grows sugar cane and rice. Normally he makes four dollars a day.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more product and equipment. She sees that the demand for her products has grown and she wants to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee and shop equipment, including chairs and tables to expand the business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old. He has three children. Two of them are studying in school. His elderly mother lives with him. He has a small carpentry shop and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood, a machine for cutting the wood, and some tools to help him in his work. He also wants to renovate the shop to improve his project and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and a machine for cutting the wood

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla A. started making carpets when she was 15 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam, Nagorno Karabakh. She has been making carpets for more than 40 years. At the moment she earns her living by taking carpet orders. Most of her clients order portrait-carpets. The small room that you see in the photo is a workshop and a classroom at the same time. Leyla has 9 desks at which she teaches her neighbors, IDP girls, how to weave carpets. She does not charge them for the classes, because she thinks that it’s her responsibility to pass on the skills that she has.

Leyla needs this loan to purchase new yarn, natural dyes, and other materials necessary for her projects. She will make carpet logos for big companies and sell them to these companies. She also has a fund that her clients support (2$ from each client, optional). She uses this fund to buy equipment for the kids for their classes.

loans.use: Purchase of material for making carpets

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak V., 48, is a mother of five children and owns a plot of farmland growing rice. On average, she earns about two dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Song Heak, 29, is a garment worker. He earns approximately three dollars a day. Two of her children are married and live away from home and one other works in a garment factory with a salary $60 per month. The other two children help her grow rice.

Mrs. V. is requesting a loan to make a stable for her buffalos and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: To make a stable for buffalos and repair the the family home

loans.name: Haqiqat

texts.en:
Haqiqat M. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam. She has a small shop in front of her house where she sells mostly fruits and vegetables. Her shop is also famous in the neighborhood for its tasty popcorn and sunflower seeds that all the kids buy on their way to school.

Haqiqat's son has an old car that their family calls a branch of the shop. Her son fills it with fresh produce and visits other neighborhoods to sell the goods there. Haqiqat just got a license for selling meat. She needs this loan to purchase meat from wholesalers.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her little shop

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang K., 25, is married with two school age children and grows rice. She makes approximately one dollar a day. Her husband is a farmer who owns a plot of farmland and plants yams. Normally he earns four dollars a day.

The couple is requesting a loan to rent another plot of farmland so they can grow more yams and also purchase a good yam seed to grow for next year. This will allow the family to save money for the future.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland for growing more yams and to purchase yam seed.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman G. started her business in Aghdam but later had to leave and became an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She used to buy leather and order various size jackets in tailors' shops for re-sale. She lost her business after she became an IDP.

Now, some years later, she has found the strength and desire to start again. So the circle started rolling again and even better than it was years ago. Now there are big markets and it’s easy to sell.

Khuraman buys leather at the lowest price and the leather jackets that she orders in tailors' shops are very easy to sell. She needs this loan to purchase more leather that she will use over the course of one year. This will reduce her price for the leather and be a reason for greater profit.

loans.use: Purchase of leather to use in making jackets for re-sale

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen H., 52, is a widow with nine children. She owns a plot of farmland growing rice, making on average, one dollar a day. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. Three other children are employed by a garment factory earning a salary $50 each a month and one other child is a wedding chef in the village. The other children help her with the rice fields.

To generate more income for the family, Mrs. H. is requesting a loan to rent a plot of land to grow sugar cane and to purchase fertilizers to put on her fields.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland for growing sugar cane and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mrs. Song S., 38, lives with her husband and five children. She raises pigs at her house and also owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice, making around $1.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chai Thu, 38, works as a palm juice collector. Everyday he climbs the palm tree to tap the palm juice, refines it to sugar cane and sells it in the market, earning about five dollars a day of income.

Two children work in a factory earning $60 each per month. The others are students and help the parents work at home when they are not attending school.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to plow her field. This will help to reduce the family’s expense as she has been hiring a tractor to do this work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow fields

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun V. is 40 years old and raises pigs. Living in Beng Village in the Siem Reap Province, she earns $0.83 per day. Her husband, Mr. Khan Chan (he is pictured), is a 42-year-old fisherman with an income of about $1.50 per day. They have three children, two of whom work part-time to support their family by selling fish and harvesting rice. Because of increasing family expenses, they need more money and hope to generate additional income.  To this end, they request a loan of $250 to purchase cows to raise and sell their offspring.

loans.use: To purchase cows and raise and sell their offspring

loans.name: Mehraj

texts.en:
Mehraj A. , 26 years old, is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam who lives in Baku. He rents a 2.5 meter-wide sales table in one of the biggest bazaars in Baku. He sells electrical wares, tools, spare parts for them, and other various things.
