Mehraj knows Azerbaijan literature well and the owner of the bazaar invites him to his office sometimes for tea and to listen to poetry. They have become friends and the owner, as support, awarded him 3 more meters of rent-free sales counter space for 2 years. Mehraj will spend this loan to purchase inventory for the new sales space.

Mehraj would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva and everybody who is a member of this website. In his opinion, this is the best way to create supportive linkage between communities.

loans.use: Purchase of new inventory for his bigger sales area

loans.name: Bean

texts.en:
Mrs. Bean C., 43, is a widow with two children and grows a variety of vegetables which she sells for a profit of three dollars a day. One of her children is a garment worker at a factory and has a salary of $70 a month and the other is a student.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for a garden and to make house repairs

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is a 47-year-old widow living in Dam Dek Commune of Siem Reap Province. She resides with her four children, one of whom is married. Her family responsibilities require her to work hard everyday making food for and raising pigs,  which earns her $4 per day. However, this income is not enough to support her children’s education, so she seeks a $300 loan to purchase more pigs, as well as wood to renovate her home so she can raise pigs more efficiently. Through this loan, S. hopes to generate additional business income and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and wood.

loans.name: Mariam's Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 43 year old married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 7 and 5 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 12, 7 and 5 years old. Mariam owns a small store of charcoal, which she started in 1998. She works at her store everyday from 8am to 8pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Grace and Zaituni, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and a small food market.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea L., 37 years old from Dam Dek Commune, Siem Reap Province, earns $5 per day making rice wine and raising pigs from her home. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sima, is 35 years old and earns $4 per day selling rice from home. They have three children, all of whom are students. In order to sustain their business and earn more, they need to expand, so they are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more pigs and more raw rice to refine and sell. They hope this loan will help them achieve their goal.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and more raw rice to refine and sell

loans.name: Rose's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 4 year old child. Rose started her business in 2006. She works everyday from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Rose has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Deodata and Mariam.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey O. is 48 years old and lives in Preah Trapeang Village in Siem Reap Province. She earns $2.83 a day selling rice soup and raising pigs from home. Her husband, Mr. Lous Veasna, is 49 years old and earns $5.60 per day repairing and washing motorcycles. They have four children, all of whom are students. They seek a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport products to and from the market, thus making it easier to increase their income and continue their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport products to and from the market

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok S., 27, is a mother of two children. She raises pigs, chickens and ducks and then sells them to the market upon maturity. On average, she earns around three dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sophal, 31, is a blacksmith and also a construction chief  building houses. He makes about seven dollars per day. Both children are too young to attend the school.

The couple is requesting a loan to purchase construction tools and to buy a plot of farmland to plant a variety of vegetables to increase the family's income. (Mr. Touch Sophal is pictured because Mrs. Mok S. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and a plot of farmland to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Hidaya's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 27 years old and is married with a 6 year old child. Hidayais began selling soft drinks in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Hidaya has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sada, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Suraia

texts.en:
Suraia is 31 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 14,9,8 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other 16 year old. Suraia started selling clothes in 2006. Everyday, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Suraia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey M., 41 years old and living in Dam Dek Commune, Siem Reap Province, earns $0.50 per day as a farmer, growing crops to sell at the market. Her husband, Mr. Dep Vann, 44 years old, earns about $3 per day making palm sugar to sell from home and at the market. They have four children, all of whom are students. They request a $200 loan to buy a motorcycle to help them transport their inventory of palm sugar to the market as well as offer taxi services, thereby enabling them to increase family profits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to help transport palm sugar to the market, as well as offer taxi services

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S., 38, is married with four children and works as a rice dealer and a teacher in her village. On average, she makes around $12 per day. Her husband supports the family’s income working as a blacksmith, making approximately three dollars a day. All four children attend school.

She would like to borrow $700 to increase her rice inventory.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Femia's W/taifa Group

texts.en:
Femia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Femia is a clothing and handbags seller that started her business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Femia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Aziza and Fatuma, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more more items for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 40 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20,16 and 12 years old. Khadija began selling clothes in 2005. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Khadija has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 3 years old. Mwahija has been selling clothing since 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Mwahija has taken out onesuccessful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Pilly

texts.en:
Pilly is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 5 years old. Pilly owns a small food shop, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

In the past, Pilly has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mr. Kim H., a 57-year-old widowed farmer from Thnal Trang, Siem Reap Province, earns about $1.20 per day. He has five children, two of whom are married. His daughter, Ms. Kim Theavy, sells vegetables and chickens at the market, where she earns up to $4.80 per day. In order to increase the family’s profits, Mr. H. requests a loan of $200 to purchase fertilizer for his crops.  He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla is 38 years old and is married with 1 18 years old child. Ramla has owned a small food vendor store since 1999. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Ramla has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sauda's Uzomboko Group

texts.en:
Sauda is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 21 and 15 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 7 and 2 years old. Sauda started her food and fruits selling business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwema and Mwajabu, who have businesses dealing in food sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru:
Murod K., 33, is a father of three. His wife is a homemaker. Murod's main source of income is from fattening and selling livestock. His wife also sells the yarn she spins from goat fleece. Their children are in secondary school in Utkonsoye. At the moment, Murod has three cows, ten sheep and four goats. He is applying for a loan to purchase additional livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Кушбоев Мурод возрост 33 года отец троих детей, жена домохозяйка.Основной доход у Мурода это откорм и продажа скота.Жена занимается продажей козьей шерсти из которой она прядет пряжу.Дети учатся в средней школе в Утконсое.На данный момент он имеет 3 коровы , 10 баранов и 4 козы.Взяв зай он хочет купить еще скот.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41398

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean D., 35, is a mother of four children and works as a construction worker with a daily revenue of two dollars per day. Her husband, Mr. Kret Sean, 34, works as a chief of construction workers building houses. He earns around five dollars a day. Two of their children are students and the others are too young to attend school.

This couple is requesting a loan (to combine with their savings) to purchase lumber so they may repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for house repairs

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 56-year-old mother of 8 children. She has operated this general store for 2 1/2 years. Previously, she was selling yams; however, her age made it difficult to do the extensive traveling required to find and purchase the yams. This is her second loan with Sinapi.

In addition to purchasing general provisions with this loan, she hopes to add a refrigerator to her store so that she can carry and sell cold products.

Abena is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Abena is on the left with her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To purchase general provisions, including eggs and peppers, and to begin saving for a refrigerator

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yen, age 48, lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her entire family members. Her husband Mr. Nou Seoun, 60, works as a motor-taxi driver, earning around four dollars a day. One of the children works at a hotel with a salary $60 a month and the other helps at home. Three other children are married and live outside the family home.

Mr. Seoun would like to request a loan to combine with his savings, and purchase a new motor-taxi for his son to begin a business to sustain the family. He is grateful for the help with this purchase. (Mrs. P. Yen and her husband Mr. Nou Seoun are pictured together)

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros P., 21, is a mother of one small child and sells fish in a busy market, making about five dollars a day. Her husband, Pean Sophat, 27, is a technician at a hotel with a salary $150 a month.

As her business continues to grow, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell and to purchase dirt to fill around her house to reduce flooding around her home during the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Y. is a 53-year-old widow who earns $1.67 per day renting music and movie CDs in Sre Village of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Y. has seven children, four of whom are married and two of whom are students. Her son, Mr. Oeun Sokthy, is a 20 year-old construction worker earning $3 per day.  Mrs. Y. works hard everyday In order to support her large family, and now requests a loan of $500 to buy a plowing machine. With this machine, she can earn money by plowing for her neighbors

loans.use: To purchase  a plowing machine

loans.name: Beon

texts.en:
Mrs. Beoun S., 22, is widow with one small child and sells porridge, soups and noodles, earning around $18 per day. She and her child live with her brothers and sisters.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to sell in order to gain more profits.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram K. is a 39 year old shop owner who has been in business since 2002. He lives with his wife, two sons, and daughter in the southern Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. They are Internally Displaced Persons living in a settlement. Bayram is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to be repaid over 18 months to increase the inventory in his shop.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his shop

loans.name: Leoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Leoun P., age 28, lives with her husband and one small child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells rice, food and orange juice in front of the Takeo Bayon Temple. Normally she earns around $10 a day. Her husband supplements the household as a construction chief building houses. He makes about $7 a day.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to purchase additional ingredients for the foods she sells and to purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make foods for sale and to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Eno

texts.en:
Eno operates a very successful red-red stand outside of Kumasi. Red-red is a popular Ghanaian dish that consists of Ghanaian cowpeas (black-eyed peas), palm oil, and red chilies. Eno operates near several schools, and her young customers often line up to try her delicious food. In an average day, she estimates she sells 500 servings from her small stand.

She believes that her shop's success is due to the care she takes to purchase and use quality products. She told us that she cooks the food as if she's cooking for her own family.

Eno is married and has 2 children. She hopes to begin buying larger quantities of her products to begin stockpiling and guard against price increases. In addition, by not buying products on credit, she can buy the products at a lower price.

Eno is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Eno is pictured in the brown dress. Next to her is her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and palm oil for her red-red stand

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar Q. is 42 years old. He opened his shop in 2004 to support his wife and two children. They live as Internally Displaced Persons in Bilasuvar, a region in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Bayram is requesting $1200 USD to be repaid over 18 months to increase the inventory of his shop.

loans.use: To increase the inventory ofhis shop

loans.name: Abdullaeva

texts.ru:
T. Abdullaeva is a mother of 3 who sells traditional pastries and sweets. Her husband works as a tractor driver at a farm, but instead of getting a salary he is paid in food items. Besides these activities, she and her husband raise livestock to sell. Right now they have 1 cow and 3 rams. T. would like to have more animals and this is what her loan from MicroInvest would be used for.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллаева Тохира мать 3 детей ,занимается бизнесом национальных сладостей .Муж работает в колхозе трактористом, хотя ему вместо зарплаты дают продукты питания.Но помимо своей работы он со своей женой занимаются откормом скота.На данный момент они имеют одну корову си 3 барана.Тохира хочет увеличить колличество скота , для чего за кредитом обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Buy more livestock

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41409

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is 29years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Benin-City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mary sells general provisions and drinks in her community. She learnt this business from her mother and has been in business since 1999.  Mary now needs a loan of US $875 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Drinks and Provision for sale

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh Y. is 48 yeas old. He has been raising livestock for the past 8 years to support his four children. Saleh is seeking a loan of $1000 USD to be repaid over 18 months. He will buy two cows at an estimated price of $500 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase two cows

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Mrs. Toun R., 59, is a widow with two children and works as farmer growing rice. She earns approximately one dollar a day. Both children are married but one lives with her to support the family’s income. The daughter who lives with her works as a garment worker with a salary of $80 a month.

Mrs. Toun R. would like to request a loan to purchase pigs to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to generate more income

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en: Rizvan Y. is an ambitious 20-year old. He lives in Saatli in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Rizvan grew up around farming and now wants to purchase 4 baby calves of his own. The expected cost of each calf is $250 USD. The remainder of his $1100 loan will be used to purchase fodder.

loans.use: To buy four baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Fatish

texts.en:
Fatish V. has been selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam. Fatish owns a shop in front of his house. His friend who is an IDP from Aghdam offered to start a small business together with him. They will buy leather, order jackets in tailor shops, and sell them out of Fatish’s shop.

Fatish’s daughter will be helping them to sell jackets among women in the Qarachukhur district where they live. Women's jackets are being sold faster. Most of the people that live in their neighborhood are IDPs from Aghdam and there are good connections between them, so it won’t be a problem to sell their new jackets that will be 40-50% cheaper than in shops.

Fatish needs this loan as his share to put into this business venture with his friend.

loans.use: Purchase of leather to have jackets made to sell

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun S., 53, grows corn on a plot of her farmland. She earns approximately two dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Veong Vong, 59, supplements the household as a government officer in the village, making less than one dollar a day. The couple has six children, four who are married and live outside the family home.

Mrs. S. would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and to renovate the family home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to renovate the the family home

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin M. is 61 years old. He has been raising livestock in Saatli since 1995. Yasin is married and has 4 sons. He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase 2 cows at an estimated cost of $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun P., 54, is a mother of seven children and works growing a variety of vegetables, earning about two dollars a day. Her husband is a government officer in the commune with a salary of $150 a month. Five of the children are married and live away from home.

Mrs. P. wants to use this loan to purchase fertilizers to put on her farmland and to buy land to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to buy land for a new house

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is the mother of 4 children. She operates a neighborhood general store that not only sells various products but also distributes water to the local community. There are no water pipes in this part of Kumasi, and Constance has a borehole on her property, where she collects water and distributes it to the community.

Constance will use this loan to increase the provisions of her general store and to purchase 2 additional water tanks. She is also hoping to increase her savings so that she can help with her children's educational expenses.

Constance is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Constance is pictured on the right wearing an orange shirt. Annastasia, her loan officer, is on the left.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of products and to buy 2 water tanks

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam H. has been teaching physics in high school for many years. He is 52 and plans to retire and continue his small business. He has many university friends in Russia who are in the electrical spare parts business. They sell him cheap spare parts for lifts that were made in the 80’s in Russia. Those lifts are still being used in Baku but it’s hard to find spare parts for them.

Islam buys used spare parts from Russia and brings them to Baku, repairs them, and sells them at a profit. Most lift mechanics know Islam and they know that he is the one that can find any spare part that they would need.

Islam needs this loan to bring in more products that are needed in the spare parts market nowadays.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for refurbishing and re-sale

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila M. is 51 years old and married. She has been raising livestock since 2001 in Saatli, a region in southern Azerbaijan. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase three calves for $400 USD each. This loan will be repaid monthly over the next 18 months.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Nan, 37, lives with her husband and three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She runs a business selling a variety of biscuits at school, making on average $2.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kak Kea, 37, is a cow broker in the village. He purchasing cows and resells them for a profit. Normally he earns about two dollars a day.

He would like to request a loan to purchase cows for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase cows

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Nan Chun and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Sayaad Habib

texts.en: Sayaad Habib lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a single young man who lives with his own family. He is a butcher and he has the responsibility for his family. His father fell ill and died, so he is the one to support his family. He needs to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and increase his business. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 28years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells general provisions and she expects an increase in demand.  Therefore, Gloria needs a loan of $900 to buy more provisions in bulk, which  she says will enable her to better satisfy her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik A. is a 38 year old livestock trader in Azerbaijan. He lives with his wife and two children in Saatli. He began this business in 2002 and after over 5 years of operation, it is now time to expand. He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more products for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., 35, is a mother of six children and works growing rice and beans on plots of land. On average she earns approximately three dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Yem Sophal, 44, supports the family’s income working as motor-taxi driver, making one dollar a day. Two of their children are goldsmiths; one earns $100 a month and the other, $200 a month.

To improve her crops, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers. Any excess money will be used to purchase lumber to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and lumber for house repairs

loans.name: Sahila

texts.en: Sahila K. has been raising livestock on her own since 2003. She is 28 years old and married with two children. They live in Imishli, a region in southern Azerbaijan. She is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to be repaid over 18 months. She will use the loan to purchase two more cows at an estimated cost of $500 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina Q. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam, Nagorno Karabakh. Her nephew lives on the border with Turkey, where there’s a big market where prices are lower than in Baku. Amina’s business is simple. She places orders for goods that are fast to sell, her nephew sends them to her, and she does door-to-door sales.

Women who need to purchase a dowry for their daughters know how to find Amina khala (khala is translated as aunt). She always has doilies, towels, blankets, etc. that are not too expensive and it’s possible to buy on a couple of month's credit from her. Amina needs this loan to purchase more inventory because the season has started.

loans.use: Increasing her inventory for door-to-door sales

loans.name: Kushboev

texts.ru:
A. Kushboev is a young man of 22 years, single and is involved in livestock trade. He has been raising and looking after animals since his childhood, together with his father. After his father left to work in Russia he has run the business on his own and has managed to make a profit. This has encouraged him further, and he would like to get a loan to buy more cattle. He hopes to make more profit and to save money for his wedding.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кушбоев Абдурауф молодой человек в возросте 22 года не женат занимается куплей и продажей скота.С детства занимался уходом за скотом со своим отцом,но после того как отец стал уезжать на заработки в Россию он стал самостоятельным.И почувствовав что с этого бизнеса он начал иметь доход ,его интерес увеличился , поэтому он решил взяв кредит купить еще пару коров.Он хочет заработать деньгис этого бизнеса накопив их на свою женитьбу.

loans.use: To buy more livestock - cattle

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41428

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en: Arifa K. is 52 years old and has ten children! To help support her large family, she has been raising livestock in Imishli since 1995. Her farm needs improvements to maintain its productivity. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase one cow, improve the farm, and purchase fodder.

loans.use: To buy one cow, improve conditions of the cows on her farm, and to buy fodder

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim T., 37, is married with nine children and stays at home with them and cooks food for her entire family. Her husband has a business recharging batteries by using a generator. In rural areas, people depend on these batteries to power their lights, televisions, etc. He earns around three dollars a day. One son and one daughter are souvenir vendors at Siem Reap province, earning around $50 each per month. The other children attend school and also help their parents.

To raise the family’s income, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to purchase a grinding mill. The machine will be for her personal use but she will also rent it to other villagers who want to take husks off rice. This will give the family more income and allow them to save money. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Sim T. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang S., 56, owns a plot of land growing rice. She earns about five dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Sor Chon, 72, works as a security guard at a petrol company and earns $90.00 a month. The couple has seven children, four of whom are married and live outside the family home.

This couple is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to assist them with farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en: Zokhra A. is a 62-year-old woman who sells milk in the southern village of Imishli region. She is married and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. She sells milk to the local people and has been doing this since 1995. Zokhra needs $1200 USD to purchase another milk cow and fodder. It could help her to increase her milk product sales and bring her good income. The estimated cost for cow is $800 USD, and she is going to spend the rest on fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 26-year-old owner of a beauty salon. She has operated this salon for over 4 years. This is her second loan with Sinapi. With the first loan she was able to rebuild her shop into a more permanent concrete structure. Previously, her shop was a wooden structure.

With this loan, Abena wants to purchase 4 additional dryers. She now only owns 1. Abena has 11 apprentices working for her.

While we visited Abena for a photo, she was away to the central market buying supplies. Pictured washing a client's hair is Beatrice, an assistant who has been working with Abena for 3 months.

Abena is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional dryers for her beauty salon

loans.name: Asadallah

texts.en: Asadallah lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 3 children. He had a retail shop when he was in Pakistan, and when he came back to Afghanistan, he opened a retail shop to continue his business in Kabul. This is only the second year that he has been involved in this business in Kabul, but he has attracted good numbers of customers. He needs to complete his stock so he has requested an individual loan to buy more goods and make a good income to help his family in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his little shop

loans.name: Nakhida

texts.en: Nakhida Q. is a 30-year-old woman who runs her small farm in the small village of Imishli. She is married and has five children. Because she and her husband are unemployed, it is very hard to cover basic family needs. Poultry and one cow are the only financial source in their family. As a solution, Nakhida has applied for $1100 USD to purchase 3 calves for $300 USD each, and with the remaining $200 USD, she is going to buy fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Kushbaeva

texts.ru:
N. Kushbaeva is 42 years old and has 4 children. Her husband works at a state farm. N. and her son Ergashem raise livestock. She likes animals and looks after them as if they were her own children. Right now she has 1 cow and 5 goats, whose yarn she sells. She would like to use her loan to buy more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кушбаева Насибали женщина в возросте 42 года имеет 4 детей , муж работает в колхозе.Сама Насибали вместе с сыном Эргашем занимается уходом и откормом скота.Он очень любит скот и ухаживает за ними как за своим ребенком .На данный момент она имеет 1 корову и 5 козочек.Взяв займ она хочет увеличить численность своего скота.Также она продает пряжу из козьей шерсти.

loans.use: Buy more livestock

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41436

loans.name: Amirov

texts.en: Amirov A. is a 44-year-old man who has bred calves for seven years. He lives and works with his family in a small village of Imishli region. His business needs to be developed, such as purchasing 2 cows for $600 USD each. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200 USD. He believes this loan can improve his family and his life in general. He is going to start selling dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence I. is 38 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells general provisions
 and drinks in her community and has been in business since year 2000. Florence learned the business from her father. She now needs a loan of US $875 to buy more inventory and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru:
Suhrobjon G. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 35 years old, married with 5 children. At the moment the only source of income for his family is his food sales business. He has a trading stall in the central district market. He brings his inventory over from Dushanbe and sells it for a small profit. Unfortunately he does not make enough to feed his family. Suhrobjon has thus decided to increase his sales by asking for a loan that will help him attract new clients, buy and sell more popular items, at more affordable prices as he will not have to travel to Dushanbe to buy them. He will be able to repay the loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Гурезов Сухробджон Ортикович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 35 лет , женат и имеет 5 детей. На данный момент единственным источником дохода его семьи является торговля продуктами питания. Имеет торговую точку на центральном районном рынке. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Зарабатывает не очень много. Ему не хватает денег прокормить семью , поэтому он решил увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту привлечь новых клиентов , а так же обеспечить рынок товаром пользующимся большим спросом , по доступным ценам. Так как им не придется выезжать за покупками в Душанбе.Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To Increase Sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad A. is a 36-year-old farmer who keeps milk cows and sells milk to the local people. He started his business in 2005 and, since that time, many things have changed, and keeping just one cow is not enough to cover even the basic needs of his family. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase one cow for $700 USD and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 49-year-old mother of 6 children. Her husband is a school teacher. She has operated her bakery for nearly 30 years. She has 1 assistant, who helps her prepare her bread. The proceeds of the loan will go toward buying additional supplies and toward a new electric oven. Her traditional oven, pictured here, is made of clay and is deteriorating.

One of Mary's children has just finished secondary school with top marks and is planning on attending medical school. To achieve this dream, Mary hopes to be able to set aside more savings from her business to help with the significant expenses.

Mary is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Mary is pictured on the right placing some loaves into her oven. On the left is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and to begin saving for an electric oven

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 22 years old and is married with one 3 years child. Asha began selling food iin 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en: Mohammad Sadiq lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a tailor shop. He has good experience in his work. He has a big shop with lots of workers, so he needs to complete his stock. For that purpose, he wants to take an individual loan to buy more new machines and expand his business. He is very happy that he can further his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more new machines for his tailor shop

loans.name: Khaliq

texts.en: Khaliq K. is a 58-year-old farmer who has bred sheep and calves in the small village of Imishli region since 1998. He is married and has 4 sons and 2 daughters. He is going to develop his business and, for this purpose, he has applied for $1200 USD. With this loan, he is going to purchase 3 calves for $400 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Karamatullo

texts.ru:
Karamatullo A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 44 years old, married, with 5 children. He has no formal education. He is involved in raising and selling of cattle. He buys young bulls, feeds them for about 40-45 days to fatten them up and then sells them at a higher price to make a profit. This business is the sole income earner for his family. He has been doing this for 21 years. This is a common business in his area and it is profitable.

Right now he has less capital on hand due to a cold winter. He was forced to sell a few of his bulls to stock up on feed for the rest of the animals. He now needs to replenish his inventory and hopes to do this by getting a loan. The loan will help boost his business and profits, income which his family rely on. He hopes to repay his loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Абдумуминов Караматулло живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 год , женат и имеет 5 детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Занимается этим 21 года. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности, поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с холодной зимой . Ему пришлось продать несколько голов бычков , чтобы запастись кормом для остальных, и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy new livestock - cattle

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 38 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 9 months to 20 years old. Tabu began her food and alcohol business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A. is the leader of this group, and she is from Depalpur, a small metropolis in Pakistan. She is married and a mother of nine, two of whom are married. Her husband trades livestock and also sells milk. Now, they would like to purchase more sheep, for which they need a loan. A few other women who have joined her in this group are: Rukkiah B., whose husband operates a food stall and a juice counter; Razia B., who wants to improve her family's farming practises; and Balqees N., who wants to buy electric goods for her husband’s electrical goods store.  All of these women practice values such as punctuality and cooperation, as well as exhibit an attitude of responsibility.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $825.00.

loans.use: To buy a few more sheep.

loans.name: Khaqani

texts.en: K. Khaqani is a 30-year-old farmer who breeds calves and keeps one milk cow in small village of Imishli. He started his business in 2003. He is married and has three children. He breeds calves for sale and keeps a cow to have milk and dairy for his family, but now he would like to expand his dairy business, and start selling milk to the local people. He has applied for $1000 USD to purchase two cows and to develop his dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Holmumin

texts.ru:
Holmumin Boinazarov lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has no formal education. He is involved in livestock trade. He buys young bulls, feeds them for about 40-45 days to fatten them up and then sells them at a higher price to make a profit. This business is the sole income earner for his family. He has been doing this for 2 years. This is a common business in his rural area and it is profitable.

Right now he has less capital on hand due to a cold winter. He was forced to sell a few of his bulls to stock up on feed for the rest of the animals. He now needs to replenish his inventory and hopes to do this by getting a loan. The loan will help to revive his business and income, which his family urgently needs. In addition, his business will help the overall development of the livestock area. He hopes to repay his loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Бойназаров Холмумин живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Занимается этим 2 года. Этот бизнес является самым распространенным бизнесом в их местностии дает неплохой доход. На данный момент клиенту нужны средства , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредити он обратился к нам. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Кроме того, его деятельность поможет развитию животноводческого сектора. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying new livestock-cattle

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 39 years old and is married with 5 children ranging in age from 5-20 years old. Halima began her fish selling business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en: Farah Y. was married ten years ago and has one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is five years old and attends kindergarten, whereas her sons are three years old and three months old, respectively. Farah has lived in the small city Depalpur, Pakistan, since birth. Her husband trades livestock to earn a living, and to help improve his business, she would like to borrow funds from Kiva.  The other women in her group are: Rani L., who wants to expand her family's grocery store; Farzana T., who needs a loan to improve her family's agricultural productivity; Ramzana N., who is borrowing for her family’s tea stall; and Talat B., who is borrowing for her son, who runs a shoe-selling business. As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,325.00.

loans.use: To expand livestock trading.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 17, 13 and 8 years old. Mwajuma started selling drinks and food in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid R. is a 33-year-old farmer who has sold milk and yoghurt to the local people since 2006. He lives with his family in the small village of Imishli. He would like to develop his business and to purchase two additional cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Muyasara

texts.ru:
Muyasara Holmuradova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children. She has high school education and, currently, is not employed. The income earned by her husband is not sufficient to cover all of the family expenses. For this reason, she wants to purchase a cow, which will provide milk for the family. In case there is extra milk, she plans to sell it to her neighbors at low prices. This will help both her family and her neighbors. That is why she is asking for this loan. She plans to pay off the given loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Холмуродова Муяссара проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст46 лет , замужем и имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее . Нигде не работает. Того что зарабатывает ее муж ее семье не хватает , поэтому клиентка хочет купить корову , которая будет давать молоко для ее семьи , а если будет лишнее сможет продавать соседям , таким же как она у которых нет коровы по доступной цене , ниже рыночной. Это будет помощью как для ее семьи , так и для ее соседей. Но для этого она должна получить кредит , который поможет выполнить ее планы. А погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Hurshed G. lives in the village of Yavan. He is 25 years old and is not married. However, he is the sole provider for his large family headed by his parents. He doesn't have higher education, but he works as a cattle breeder. He purchases livestock, feeds it for 40 to 45 days, a later sells it at a higher price. As he sells the cattle, he immediately purchases new ones and continues the cycle. This type of business is widespread in villages like his. He makes good profit with this business, especially in Spring and Summer. He has been in this business for the last 8 years. Recently, Hurshed saw a decrease in the amount of money that is cycled in his business because of the winter weather. He is asking for a loan so he could increase his turnover and purchase addition livestock. This will help him restore his business and the usual income that is so needed for his family. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Гафуров Хуршед живет в городе Яван . Возраст 25 лет , неженат , но является единственным кормильцем большой родительской семьи. Образования не имеет. Клиент нигде не работает , но занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. После того как он продаст одно или двух бычков на их место он покупает новых , начинает их откармливать , а оставшихся бычков выводит на рынок для продажи , пока те еще не подросли до нужного уровня. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности , поэтому дает доход, тем более весной и летом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 8 лет. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с погодными условиями зимой и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Он хочет купить еще одного бычка. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Qojali

texts.en: Qojali A. is a 56-year-old farmer who breeds calves for meat production and sells them to the local bazaar traders. He is married and has five children. He started his business in 1997. Now he would like to improve the conditions of his family by developing his business and purchasing more calves. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase three calves for about $400 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is a gregarious 31-year-old mother of 2 children. She has been operating a small food stand at the Atasemanso market for 3 years. With her first loan, she was able to increase her inventory and increase her sales. With this second loan, she hopes to begin selling more rice, a staple in many Ghanaian dishes.

In addition to increasing her sales, Augustina hopes to begin saving more for her children's education. She also expressed a dream of building her own house in the future.

Augustina is a member of the trust group God's Mercy. The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Augustina is pictured in the black shirt. Next to her is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for her small food stand

loans.name: Amrullo

texts.ru:
Amrullo I. lives in the region Varzob. He is 27 years old, is married, and has 2 children. He has a Bachelor's Degree. Although, he is currently unemployed. He provides for the family through agriculture. He owns a piece of land, where he plants wheat. Amrullo needs additional financing, and for this reason, he is asking for a loan.

He uses crops for his own family and for sales. Moreover, byproducts are used as food for cattle. Amrullo also profits from sales of the byproducts. This helps him to cover all of the expenses of his family. In addition, agriculture is not very well developed in the region, and this loan will help further its development. Amrullo is planning to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Исматуллоев Амрулло проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 27 лет, женат имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее . По профессии командир взвода. Но на данный момент он безработный. Обеспечивает семью, занимаясь земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей. Клиент нуждается в дополнительном финансировании , поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Получаемый урожай использует для своей семьи и на продажу. Кроме того отходы получаемые после сбора урожая используется как корм для крупно рогатого скота. Собрав, его клиент так же продает на рынке, тем самым, получая доход для его семьи. Это поможет клиенту получить доходы, в которых так нуждается его семья. Кроме того сельскохозяйственный сектор не достаточно развит в сельской местности, поэтому необходимо способствовать его развитию. Погасит кредит клиент в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en: Ghulam S., the leader of this group, is married with six children.  She has been married for 23 years and for that time has lived in the small city of Depalpur, Pakistan, where her husband runs a pharmacy.  They have already successfully borrowed two loans from a microfinance institution called Asasah in Pakistan, which were both used to improve their pharmacy. These loans helped to increase their income substantially. In this group are several other women who are also in need of loans: Anwer B., whose husband farms a rented piece of agricultural land; Zahida B., who wants a loan for her husband who is a builder; and Khursheed B., whose husband runs a grocery store.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,000.00 which will be divided between them.

loans.use: To expand a pharmacy.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 39 years old and is married with 2 children ages 17 and 10 years old. Hadija started her busniess selling food in 2008. Everyday, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Jeyran

texts.en:
Jeyran A. is a 25-year-old woman who sells milk to the local people. She has had experience in this business since 2006. She lives with her family in the small village of Imishli.

Because she and her husband are unemployed, they decided to purchase one foal and fodder for it. Her husband is going to work as ploughman in summer to earn some money for the other seasons. To enable her husband to start working as ploughman, Jeyran needs to raise a foal into a good and healthy horse. For this purpose, she applied for $1100 USD to purchase a foal for $600 USD and, with the remainer, enough fodder to raise it by summer season.

loans.use: To purchase a foal and fodder

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 23 year old married woman with a 2 year old child. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages18,14 and 12 years old. Rahma is started her charcoal and cloth selling business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Murodalli

texts.ru:
Murodalli S. lives in the region Rudaki in the village Teppai Samarkandi. He is 42 years old, he is married, and has 4 children. He has a Bachelor's Degree in Education. He works as a teacher in middle school № 45 in Rudaki. Apart from working as a teacher, Murodalli earns additional income through food sales. He imports inventory from Dushanbe and resells it in his own store. This business helps him to provide his family with the needed money. Moreover, his business helps local residents who can purchase the needed goods at his store without leaving the village and spending addition time.

Murodalli is asking for loan so he could purchase a fridge to store perishable foods. The new fridge will help him store his inventory, increase the assortment of his goods, and the local residents to purchase fresh products. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоев Муродалли проживает в районе Рудаки в поселке Теппаи Самарканди. Ему 42 года , женат и имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее. По профессии учитель средней школы. Работает в школе № 45 района Рудаки. Кроме работы в школе , Муродалли зарабатывает на жизнь путем торговли продуктами питания . Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов и продает у себя в магазине. Этот бизнес помогает обеспечить семью необходимым доходом. Кроме того товар продаваемый им в его магазине, товары первой необходимости помогают населению покупают продукты, не выезжая из района, не тратя на дорогу денег и не тратя время.Но клиент хочет купить холодильную камеру для хранения продуктов , которые быстро портятся . Для этого Муродалли хочет получить кредит , что поможет ему выполнить запланированное. Это поможет хранить продукты питания , увеличить ассортимент товаров , а так же поможет населению покупать свежие продукты. Погасит кредит клиент в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Koser's Group

texts.en: Koser F. S., the leader of this group, is married and a mother of six. She resides with her family in the small town of Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. To make a living, her husband goes door-to-door selling cloth. For this purpose he uses his cycle. Last year, her family invested a small loan in this business and it increased their income. Currently, they need another loan to make their business even better, so that her children may finish their schooling and find decent employment for themselves. The other members of this group are: Kalsoom L., who runs a beauty saloon; Halima B., whose husband runs a tea stall and a sweets counter; Ghulam S., who will use the loan to improve her fruits business; and Imam H., who is borrowing for her family's livestock business.  Altogether, they are requesting $1,250.00.

loans.use: To expand a cloth selling business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is a busy 37-year-old mother of 4 children. She wakes at 4:00 every morning to make rice for her rice porridge. She "hawks" (sells by walking around) the porridge in her community of Atasemanso. Rice porridge is a popular breakfast food in Ghana. In the afternoon, she sells soap.

She will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase rice and soap in bulk quantities. This allows her to avoid buying her products on credit.

Akua is a member of the trust group God's Mercy. The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of rice and soap

loans.name: Sarwer's Group

texts.en: S. P., this group's leader, is married and a mother of four.  Her family resides in the small town of Depalpur, Pakistan. Her husband sells rugs and blankets by going door-to-door. He started this business a few years ago after completing grade 12 of his education. He buys rugs and blankets from Kasur, Pakistan, which is famous for its production of woolen items. To contribute to her household income, she sells milk taken from her family's two dairy cows. The four other group members are:  Irshad B., who raises crops; Shahnaz B., whose husband runs a barber shop; Rani B., who is divorced and is borrowing for her brother who runs a bike rental; and Maqsood S., who wants to rent farming land.  Altogether, they are requesting from Kiva a loan of $1,725.00.

loans.use: To buy rugs and blankets in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with 3 children, ages10, 5 and 2 years old. Tatu started selling food in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Lucy's Mchunjugulu Group

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman. Lucy started selling clothes in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Farida, who has a business selling food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar Sulaymonov lives in the region Rudaki in the village Teppa. He is 38 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He has a Bachelor's Degree and works as a teacher in the middle school in Rudaki. Apart from working in school, he owns a business where he sells food products. He has his own store near his home. He imports the inventory from Dushanbe and resells it in his store. This business helps Zafar to maintain his family. Moreover, this business helps local residents who can purchase the needed goods without going to the city and spending additional time. Zafar is asking for a loan to increase his inventory. After purchasing additional goods, he will be able to attract more customers and provide local residents with needed products. He is planning to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонов Зафар проживает в районе Рудаки в поселке Теппа . Ему 38 лет , он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее. По профессии учитель средней школы. Работает в школе _ учителем, района Рудаки. Кроме работы в школе , Зафар зарабатывает на жизнь путем торговли продуктами питания . Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов и продает у себя в магазине. Этот бизнес помогает обеспечить семью необходимым доходом. Кроме того товар продаваемый им в его магазине, товары первой необходимости помогают населению покупают продукты, не выезжая из района, не тратя на дорогу денег и не тратя время. Но клиент не хватает денег , для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Увеличив ассортимент товара клиент сможет привлечь новых клиентов, а так же обеспечить население продуктами первой необходимости. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en: Group leader Basheeran Z. is married with two sons and one daughter.  Her children are aged eight, four and two years, respectively. Her husband operates a small grocery store where he sells many staple items. Her family's income is just enough to make ends meet.  The other members of this group who are also requesting loans are: Parwez F., who requires loan to expand her family’s fruits business; Safia G., who wants to purchase a rickshaw; Kaleem M., who also wants to expand her general store; and Khalida P., who wants to invest in her own business.  As a group, they are requesting from Kiva a loan of $1,150.00.

loans.use: To buy a stock of items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Osaze

texts.en: Osaze A. is 24 years old; he lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells fairly used clothes and has been in business for 3years. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy more inventory for sale. He says thank you, KIVA.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for sale

loans.name: Husna's Kizuiani Group

texts.en:
Husna is a married woman with a 3 year old child. Husna is a food and fish seller that started her business in 2000. She works selling from 7am to 5pm everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in local alcohol sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18, 12 and 7 years old. Fatuma owns a small food and charcoal store which she started in 2005. Everyday she works at her business from 6am to 10pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen T. is from the small town of Chichawatni in Pakistan.  She lives there in a one room brick and mud house with her family, being her five sons and two daughters.  Her husband has married another woman and therefore does not live with Nasreen anymore.  However, one of her brothers lives with her and supports her household expenses. He sells cloth by going door-to-door.  Nasreen is applying for a loan to help him increase the volume of his sales by buying cloth in bulk.  The other members of this group are: Abida P.; Razia B.; Gulzar B.; and Tahira B..  Together, they are applying for a loan of $1,075.00 which Nasreen believes will help lift them out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to increase sales.

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en:
Punkhan M. is a 42-year-old farmer who breeds sheep for meat sales. He has ten years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in the small village of Saatli region.

Punkhan needs $1200 USD to purchase 20 additional sheep for an estimated cost of 60 USD each. He is going to purchase them now, because it is very good time to feed them, when all fields are full of fresh grass, and Punkhan does not need to purchase additional fodder. The sheep can grow until the autumn, which is wedding season, and good time for sheep sales.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Pathani's Group

texts.en: Pathani A., the leader of this group, is married and a mother of three sons and four daughters. Her husband drives a tractor for another farmer, and one of her sons is a tailor.  He now plans to start his own business of stitching clothes. Therefore, her family needs a loan to set up their tailoring business.  The other women wishing to borrow in this group are: Salay B., who wants to expand her fruits business; Shahnaz B., who sells cloth; Razia S., will use her share of loan to expand her family's shop; and Supahi B., who is borrowing for her family's livestock trading business.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,150.00.

loans.use: To set up our own tailoring business.

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en: Farkhanda Q. has lived her entire life in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She is a mother of six, with three daughters and three sons. To earn living, her husband works at a factory, whereas one of her sons is a rickshaw driver.  Currently, her family wants to buy an additional rickshaw, which her son plans to rent to another driver to supplement her household's present income. There are several other women in this group applying for a loan: Rasheeda B., who wants to expand her family's shop; Ghafooran B., who wants to buy a rickshaw; and Zareena B., who will invest her share of the loan to expand her family's restaurant.  Altogether, they are applying for a $1,000.00 loan.

loans.use: To buy an additional rickshaw.

loans.name: Ughur

texts.en:
I. Ughur has sold fruits and vegetables for 9 years since he moved to Baku. Ughur is from Lerik, a town in south Azerbaijan that is famous for its citrus plants. Ughur purchases fruit from wholesale shops in Lerik where his brother works.

He needs this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for the Novruz holiday season, which starts in the end of March. He says that sales volume is double during Novruz. This holiday is related to the beginning of the summer. It’s celebrated like New Year's Eve in Azerbaijani tradition. Ughur’s name means “luck." He believes that this season will bring him lots of luck in his business.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en: Zainab P. is married with one son and four daughters. All of her children study at a local school.  Zainab's husband sells vegetables in a nearby food market. With the loan, they plan to expand their business so that their income may increase. She plans to save the extra profits for the education and future of her children. She is requesting this loan with another friend, Sajida M., who also requires funds to improve her family's cotton trade business.  Together, they are hoping to borrow $500.00.

loans.use: Expand vegetables and cotton trading businesses.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a thirty-three year old owner of a small food stand near the Ahodwo Roundabout.   She has operated the stand for about one year.   This is her second loan with Sinapi.  With her first loan, she saw an increase in sales.  She hopes that by increasing her inventory further, she can see an even larger increase in sales.  

She also plans to use her loan to register with the Ghanaian National Health Insurance Scheme. 

She is a member of the trust group Emmanuel.  The trust group works on the principal that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral where each member ensures that the other member repays their share of the loan.  

Doris is wearing a striped shirt.  On her left is her Sinapi loan officer Annastasia.

loans.use: To increase her supply of eggs, milk, tomatoes and soaps.

loans.name: Mwema's Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Mwema is 25 years old, divorced, and has two children, 10 and 4 years old. She also takes care of another person who is 70 years old. Mwema is a fish seller, who started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 9 am to 9 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for sale. She will share this loan with another businesswoman, Amina, who has a food sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is single woman with two children, 6 months and 5 years old. Zabibu sells alcohol; she started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6p m at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$200.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en: Namiq J. is a 51-year-old farmer who raises milk cows for dairy sales and breeds calves for meat sales. He has run this business since 2001. Originally, he is from a small village in Imishli, and he continues living there with his wife and four children. It is hard to sustain a six-member family, so Namiq has decided to develop the one financial source in his family, and purchase more calves for breeding. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200 USD to purchase 3 calves for $400 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 9. Amina owns a small grocery store and also sells cloth; she started her business in 1990. Every day, she works from 6 am to 9 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$300 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has two children, ages16 and 7. She is a cloth and timber seller. Lilian started her sales business in 1998. Every day, she works from 6 am to 8 pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about US$350.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 30 years old, married, and has three children, 10 months, and 10 and 5 years old. Scola owns a small food store which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6:30 am until 10 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$120.

Scola would like to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Ifeanyi A. is 28years old, married and has one child. He lives in Benin City and sells yams in the market. He has been in business since 2004. He needs a loan of $700 to buy more yams for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 30 years old and single. She owns a small stationery which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am until 6 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items for the business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a secretarial services business

loans.name: Agaselim

texts.en: Agaselim A. is a 63-year-old farmer who has run his dairy and poultry businesses in the small village of Imishli region since 1995. He is married and has two children. He would like to expand his business by purchasing 2 additional milk cows to expand the sale of his dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Koku

texts.en:
Koku is 35 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12 years old. Koku owns a small cafe, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $850 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more comodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more comodities for her business.

loans.name: Koku

texts.en:
Koku is 35 years old, married, and has two children, 15 and 12 years old. Koku owns a small cafe which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7 am until 9 pm at her cafe and can earn a monthly profit of about US$850.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items to improve the cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a cafe

loans.name: Osasehi

texts.en: M. is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. She plaits and styles hair for her customers and also sells relaxers and beads that are worn on the neck and hands. She learnt this business for 3 years and then started her own salon in 2000.  She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more relaxer and beads for sale.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for sale

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga A. is a 59-year-old woman who raises milk cows and sells milk and yoghurt to the local people. She is married and has six children. Selling dairy products is the only financial source for her family, and it is not enough to cover the family's basic needs. To improve the situation, she need to improve and develop her business. For this purpose, she has applied for $1200 USD to purchase four calves for $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is forty-one years old and the proud mother of five sons, the youngest of whom is seventeen. They all attend school. To supplement her family’s income, Jose sells an assortment of perfumes, pants, shoes, slippers, silver jewelry, beauty products, and the like. She started her business a few years ago with a loan she took from FSMA.

Currently, Josefina has a lot of customers that visit her each day to purchase her goods. She’s requesting a loan to buy more products in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. Josefina’s business supports her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, perfumes, and beauty products for her small business

loans.name: Rowland

texts.en:
Rowland I. is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin City, Edo State, with his entire family. Roland owns a chemist's shop, where he sells medications. He learnt this business from his uncle and established his own shop in 1994.

Roland needs a loan of $875 to purchase more medications for sale. He says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more medications for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 48 years old, married and has 7 children. She sells oranges, a business that she learnt from her mother.  She has been in her own business since 1995. She now needs a loan of $525 to buy more oranges for sale. Elizabeth says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more oranges for sale.

loans.name: Asha's Amani Group

texts.en:
Asha N. is 55 years old, divorced, and has two children, 22 and 24 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children who are 2 and 4 years old. Asha N. is a charcoal seller; she started her business in 1995. Every day, she works from 7:30 am until 6:30 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190.

In the past, Asha N. has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to receive a new loan to buy more items for her business. Asha will share this loan with her sub-group members who have cloth and fish sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a charcoal sales business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a forty-year old mother of six children.  Three of them are still in school and three have finished their schooling. 

Comfort wakes at every morning at 5:15 am to prepare her assorted pastries.  She sells the pastries at the nearby Ahodwo roundabout.  In addition to increasing her inventory with this loan, Comfort hopes to begin to save more money to help her children with schooling.

Comfort is part of the trust group Emmanuel.    The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to ensure that each member of the group pays their fair share.  

Comfort is pictured in the orange blouse.   Next to her is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, and sugar for her pastries

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is an enterprising fifty-five year old mother of seven and is married. Four of her children are still in school.
She sells rice, sugar, gari, tomatoes and other home products. It is her cherished dream to rent a shop one day.

Akua has added to her business by selling charcoal which is one of the main source generating fire for cooking in most Ghanaian homes. She wants to use her second loan from Sinapi Aba Trust to stock bags of charcoal in bulk to avoid high prices from the suppliers and buy more bags of rice.

Akua is standing in front of her table store on the left side of  her loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal, bags of rice, and crates of eggs

loans.name: Fatuma's Amani Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 23, 21, 17 and 14. Fatuma owns a small cafe which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6:30 am until 7:30 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$220.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a new loan which will be used to buy more items for the cafe. Fatuma will share the loan with another businesswoman, Aneth, who owns a hotel and a charcoal sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a business

loans.name: Grace
