texts.en: Grace E. is 50 years old, married and has 6 children. She resides in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  Grace has been rearing and selling chickens since 1990. She learnt this business from her mother.  She needs a loan of $875 to buy more chickens to rear and sell.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for rearing sale.

loans.name: Mayasa's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Mayasa is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children, 6 to 18 years old. Mayasa and her husband also take care of one other child who is 14 years old. Mayasa owns a small stationery which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8:30 am until 9:30 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

In the past, Mayasa has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Now, she hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her business. Mayasa will share this loan with another businesswoman, Asha , who also has a sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 52 years old, married and has 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Victoria sells oranges and has been in business since 1995. She asks for a loan of $450 to purchase more oranges for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oranges for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a thirty-five year old mother of four children.  She operates a small undergarments shop in an alley in central Kumasi.  She has been operating this business for two years.  With this loan, she hopes to expand her inventory to include different varieties of clothing.  By increasing her varieties of products, she hopes to increase sales and help her children with educational expenses.  

Veronica is a member of the trust group In Him is Life.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member of the group repays their fair share.  

Veronica is wearing a blue shirt.  Her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia, is standing next to her.

loans.use: To purchase different varieties of undergarments

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 57 years old and a mother of two children who are currently in senior high and junior high school. She is married and has been preparing fufu, a local and very popular Ghanaian dish eaten by most people. She sells her fufu close to Kumasi Stadium and has regular clients who patronize her.  She used part of her first loan  to rent a place that she could cook in large quantities for cherished customers.

Yaa has now secured a place suitable for her operation but the new facility does not have electricity. She wants to use her second loan to secure electricity to store more of her perishable products in fridges and freezers.

Yaa in a photo standing in front of her new facility and on the right side of  her loan officer, Annastasia

loans.use: To extend electricity and expand the dining space

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a forty-three year old father of two children.  He informed us that his third child recently passed away.  

Yaa has been operating his small clock store for four years.  The store is located in a crowded alley in central Kumasi.  This is his second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust.   He hopes this loan helps him to further expand his business by increasing his variety of clocks.   By increasing his income, he hopes to provide more savings for his family's needs.  

Yaa is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.   The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral to ensure that each member pays its share of the group loan.  

Yaa's loan officer, Annastasia is pictured next to him.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of clocks

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells oranges and has been in business since 1990. Esther needs a loan of $525 to purchase more oranges for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oranges for sale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly G. lives with her two children in their own home in the Rio Seco zone of El Alto. Nelly is a retired health and medical worker from La Paz.

With prior loans Nelly completed the rough construction of a stairway and floor in her home. The currently requested loan will be used to construct a floor on the second level of her home. This floor will serve as the roof for the previously constructed first floor.

This is the fourth loan that Nelly has requested and the socioeconomic analysis continues to give her a favorable rating. Nelly has been a client since 2006 and is approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly G. vive en casa propia en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto sus dos hijos; la señora Nelly es jubilada del servicio de salud de La Paz. Con los créditos anteriores la señora Nelly realizo la construcción de una loza y gradas en obra gruesa que forman parte de la construcción total de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una losa en el segundo nivel de su domicilio y que será la cubierta para las habitaciones a ser construidas posteriormente Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Construction of a floor for the second level of her home.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth L. and her daughter live in their own home in the Alto Sopocachi zone of La Paz. Ruth is employed and works as a secretary for a public transit company in the city. Her home has one bedroom in her home that is roughly constructed (simply brick walls with a metal roof). Ruth would like to complete this room so that it can become her daughter’s room. Her daughter is getting older and up till now still sleeps in the same room as her mother, Ruth.

The loan will be used to do the finish work on the room. This is the first time that Ruth has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis shows her to be a good candidate. She is approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth L. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hija. La señora Ruth es empleada, trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de transporte publico de esta ciudad. Su vivienda tiene una habitación que se encuentra en obra gruesa (construcción de muros de ladrillo y techo de calamina), la misma que la señora Ruth quiere concluir para que sea el dormitorio de su hija que ya esta alcanzando a la mayoría de edad y que aun se encuentra ocupando la misma habitación con su madre. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de una habitación. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Complete the construction of a room so that her daughter can have a room to herself.

loans.name: Samuel F.

texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and married with 5 children. He has worked as a teacher for many years, but his salary of less than $150 a month means it would take a long time to save enough to build a family house.

SMT has now introduced housing loans, and Samuel is requesting this loan so that he can purchase the necessary supplies to make more concrete bricks and begin constructing the foundation of his house. He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for laying the foundation of a family home

loans.name: Ready

texts.es:
Ready Z. lives alone in his own home in the Tembladerani zone on the western edge of La Paz. Ready is employed and works a chauffer for the mayor’s office.

The requested loan will be used to repair the metal rough of his home, which is getting old and weathered. The drips and humidity that are getting through the roof are destroying his rafters, walls, and furniture. This will be the first time that Ready has received a loan. The socioeconomic analysis appears to be favorable and approves him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Ready Z. vive solo en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Ready es empleado, trabajando como chofer en la Alcaldía Municipal de esta ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de los techos de calamina de su vivienda, ya que por la antigüedad de la construcción, presenta goteras y la humedad esta deteriorando los tumbados y paredes e inclusive sus muebles. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Repair of the roof of his home.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 39 years old and married with 6 children. He has been running his business for more than 10 years, but on a very small scale. Now there is high demand for steel doors and other welding activities, but Ibrahim is struggling to keep up with his customers’ needs.

He has requested this loan so that he can purchase tools and other welding materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and other welding materials

loans.name: Aghaku

texts.en: Aghaku O.is 25 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fowl (native chickens) and has been in this business since 2004. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more fowl  for sale.

loans.use: To buy more native fowl for sale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonia Q. owns his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Marcelina Quiroga.

Antonio Q. is a retired public administer, and his wife is a home-maker. With previous loans these two were able to complete a wall around their home.

The currently requested loan will be used to construct a retaining wall to support their property given that it is near a very steep road with a pronounced drop off. This will be the fourth time that Antonio and his wife have requested a loan. A socioeconomic analysis approves this loan. Antonio has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio Q. vive en vivienda propia con su esposa, la señora Marcelina Quiroga en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Antonio es jubilado de la administración publica, en tanto que su esposa realiza labores de casa. Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción el muro perimetral de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención estructural que le dará estabilidad a su propiedad que se encuentra una calle que tiene mucha inclinación, o sea que tiene una pendiente muy pronunciada. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y pueden acceder a un nuevo crédito. Antonio es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall due to the fact that they live on a very steep street.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 33 year-old-man. Raed lives in Northern Lebanon, in Tripoli. Raed is a barber and this is the eighth time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. The association's loans have helped him until now to buy a house for his future family. This time he needs $1200 to redecorate his business.

loans.use: to redecorate his business

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo owns amplifying and stereo equipment which he provides to parties, birthdays, and other social events. Hugo lives in Bajo Pampahasi on the eastern side of La Paz. This is the third time that Hugo has requested a loan from IMPRO.

Hugo’s loan history earns him a “1” rating, which signifies that he has completely repaid his prior loans in good order.

This loan will be used to purchase a complete set of equipment for integrating music (power supply, mixer, deck, CD player, and a set of lights). Hugo wishes to offer a better service to his clients. Hugo’s work and experience in the industry leads to the approval of this loan. He received his first loan from us in 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Hugo tiene un equipo de amplificación para la animación de fiestas, cumpleaños y todo acontecimiento social. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bajo Pampahasi ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz, Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación; el crédito será destinado la compra de equipo completo de música integrado (Poder, mezcladora, deck, compactera y juego de luces), pues es su deseo poder ofrecer una mejor calidad a sus clientes. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro. Su primer crédito con nosotros data del año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase of a full set of equipment for his DJ business.

loans.name: Juliet Nakamatte’S Group

texts.en:
Juliet, age 30, is the leader of this five-person group. This is the group’s first loan with MCDT. Juliet is married with four children. All of her children are in school, except for her youngest. Her husband sells used refrigerators.

Juliet has a business selling poultry and pigs. She plans to use the loan to buy more chickens and increase her feed stock. If things go well, she would like to expand her living space and increase the size of her business. She also hopes that the profits from her business will be enough to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 27-year-old man. He lives in Northern Lebanon, in Tripoli. Ali is an upholsterer and this is the first time he applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. Ali needs to buy materiA. for his business. Even though his workshop is far from the residentiA. area, Ali is striving to develop his client database through word of mouth.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is the mother of three young boys.    She has been operating a small stand in a crowded alley of central Kumasi for five years.  Someday, she hopes to have a permanent shop.  This is her second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust.  With the first loan, she has seen an improvement in her standard of living.  

With this second loan, Gertrude wants to increase the variety of products she sells.  By increasing her inventory, she hopes to increase her sales and begin setting aside more money to help with her children's educational expenses.   She also has yet to register with Ghana's National Health Insurance Scheme and plans to use some of her increase income to register.  

Gertrude is the member of the trust group Pillar of God.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to ensure each member repays.  

Gertrude is pictured on the right.  On the left is her loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of women's undergarments

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 49-year-old man. He lives in Northern Lebanon, in Tripoli with his family. Adnan has 9 children. He distributes gaz bottles and also owns a coffee shop he wants to re-open. This is the first time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to reinvest in this last mentioned business.

loans.use: to reinvest in a coffee shop

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu B. is 30 years and married with 2 children.  She sells onions and tomato paste wholesale.  Isatu has been in the SMT program for 2 years, and used previous loans to increase her stock.  Isatu has a good repayment record and has graduated to an individual loan. She is requesting this loan so that she can further expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts of onions and tomato paste wholesale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 37-year-old man. He lives in Tripoli, in Northern Lebanon, with his family. Mohamad has 4 children. He is a blacksmith. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy a large number of materials in order to get it for a reduced price.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha K. owns a grocery shop in Makeni town, Sierra Leone. She has been running the business since 2002 when the civil war ended. Isha used to get most of her stock on credit, which is very expensive, but now she is trying to build her own capital. She is therefore requesting for a loan so that she can purchase her goods with cash. This way, she can begin to save her earnings instead of using them to pay off her suppliers.

Isha is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She said that she would like to earn more income and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie E. is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells oranges in both retail and wholesale quantities; she has been in business since 2002. Julie needs a loan of $525 to buy more oranges for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oranges for sale

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Mr. M. is 43 years old and married with 6 children. He sells building materials and tools in the Makeni town market. Mr. M. started his business more than 10 years ago, but progress has been slow due to lack of capital.

Mr. M. is requesting this loan so that he can expand his stock. He believes that additional inventory will generate more income, which will help him pay for family expenses – especially school fees for his children.

loans.use: To increase inventory; this will enable him to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old man. He lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon. Mohamad sells CDs and computers. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to use the credit for the maintenance of computers. Even though there's intense competition in this business sector, Mohamad has very loyal clients.

loans.use: for the maintenance of computers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a young woman of twenty-nine and a mother of one child. She is married and has been selling lingeries for the past four years on a table top at a very popular shopping place. She has been able to use her first loan from Sinapi to expand her operation. She was able to save some money for the registration of Government's National Health Insurance Scheme.

Patricia now wants to use her second loan to increase inventory and  also to buy more babies dresses, sanitary pads, night gowns, etc as according to her the products are in high demand.

Patricia is a member of the group called " In Him is Life." The group members guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

Patricia in a photo with some of her clients. she is the first from the right.

loans.use: To buy more lingeries like bras, panties, boxer shorts, etc

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en: Rachid is a 54-year-old man. He lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon, with his family. Rachid has 3 children. He is a blacksmith. This is the first time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a large number of materials in order to get it for a reduced price.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the mother of two children and four grandchildren.  She has been operating a small undergarments stand in a crowded alley of central Kumasi for nearly sixteen years.  She is requesting a loan to help increase her inventory of products and to buy more packaged products.  It is her hope that she can increase her sales with better quality inventory and allow her to save more for family expenses.    

Mary is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to help ensure that each member repays their share.

Mary is pictured holding some of her products.  Standing to her right is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of women's lingerie

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives with her husband and children in “anticretico" on Jose Saravia St. in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. [Translator's Note: An "anticretico" is a special rental arrangement offered in Bolivia. See: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html]

Maria earns a living selling fireworks, “cuetillos,” candles, ballons, etc, depending on the season, the holidays, and the customs of the country.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise. She has obtained a substantial clientele and her sales have increased dramatically. This is the second time that Maria has requested a loan through Kiva. The previous loan is completely repaid. Due to this prior history and the loan that she paid off she has been qualified for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en anticretico en la calle Jose Saravia de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; ella genera sus ingresos vendiendo juegos artificiales, cuetillos, velas, globos, etc., de acuerdo a la temporada y las fiestas y costumbres del país. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería ya que tiene mucha clientela y sus ventas han crecido mucho. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva. El anterior crédito está pagado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, ya que pago muy bien.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, including fireworks and ballons, to increase he supply of the holidays.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 58-year-old man who lives in in Tripoli, in Northern Lebanon, with his family. Mohamad has 3 children. He owns a grocery store. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy provisions for his business especially now that he has added vegetables as a new item in his store.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Mr. Abdulai T. sells second hand clothing in Makeni town. With previous loans from SMT, he diversified the business - he now sells both adult and children’s clothes.

Abdulai’s business is the main source of income for his family, including eight children and other extended family members in his care. He has requested this loan so that he can increase his inventory and involve his wife in the management of the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 28-year-old man who lives  in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon, with his family. Abed has 1 child. He sells and repairs car air conditioners. This is the first time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to move his business to a bigger location.

loans.use: to move his business to a bigger location

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty lives with her in-laws at Buenos Aires avenue in the Obispo Bosque district in the city of La Paz. The garage in her in-laws' house was reconfigured so that she could sell spare parts, grease, and oil etc.. and all that deals with car repairs. The business is going very well because near-by there is a bus stop which makes her sales very steady.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase more products and thus offer a better selection of her merchandise.

This is the second time that Betty requests a loan through Kiva. The previous loan has been repaid in full

Given her past history she qualifies to apply for a new loan, as she has been a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Betty vive en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz; en la misma casa sus suegros habilitaron el garaje para que ella pueda vender repuestos, grasa, aceite etc. y todo lo que se necesita para los autos. El negocio va muy bien porque cerca hay una parada de minibases y este factor influye para que sus ventas sean muy estables. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más productos y ofrecer una mejor variedad en su mercadería. Esta es la segunda vez que Betty solicita un crédito a través de Kiva. El crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es muy buena cliente.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and motor oil for her business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old man living  in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon,  with his family. Mohamad has 1 child. He owns a bakery store. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a juice and an ice cream refrigerator for the summer season.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 24-year-old man living in Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. He owns a used clothing store. This is the third time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise for the coming season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima lives in her own home with her husband and children in Luis Pacheco Street in the Pasankeri district in the city of La Paz. The business that is run by this woman is the sale of prepared food in a rented store in Buenos Aires avenue in the Tembladerani district.

The loan that she requests is to purchase tables, chairs, and materials to renovate and improve her business to attract more clients, and offer them greater comfort.

Given her past history as a good client she qualifies for a new loan. She and her husband are IMPRO clients since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Máxima vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Luís Pacheco de la zona de Pasankeri, en la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene la señora es la venta de comida en una tienda alquilada en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Tembladerani. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mesas, sillas, e insumos y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y atraer más clientes y ofrecerles más comodidad. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.Ella y su esposo son clientes de IMPRO desde al año 2002.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs and materials to improve her small restaurant.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 28 years old and married with one child. She is dropped out of school, but has business skills and a vision for both her business and her child’s future.

She would like to buy an additional refrigerator and increase her inventory so that she can offer a larger selection of drinks. This will allow her to meet customer demand during the long, hot, dry season.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and a larger selection of drinks

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David lives in Anticretico in Buenos Aires avenue in the Las Lomas district of the city of La Paz and he assembles and sells computers to fill orders. His business is runnign well but his income is not enough which is why he started a second business selling slacks. The loan that he requests is to purchase parts to assemble a computer for a client.

He does not have a past history with the financial institution but he qualifies for a loan given his will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

David vive en anticretico en la Av Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la Ciudad de La Paz y se dedica al ensamblado de computadoras las mismas que las vende a pedido; en este negocio le va bien pero sus ingresos son mínimos por lo cual inicio un negocio adicional que consiste en la venta de pantalones. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para ensamblar una computadora para un cliente. No tiene antecedente con la Institución, pero califica para acceder a un crédito por su empeño en salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase parts to assemble a computer for his client.

loans.name: Sorie Bunting

texts.en: Sorie K. is 47 years old and married with 5 children.  Working as a teacher, his salary is not enough to enable him to complete the construction of his house. It took him a long time to save the money required to put up the structure while also renting a house for the family.  Sorie is therefore requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheets and timber for the completion of the family house.  He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a family home

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abass dropped out of school at the age of 18. He learned how to drive and gained employment as the driver of a passenger taxi. After 10 years, he had saved enough money to buy his own minibus for hire.

Abass has been working tirelessly to save enough money to purchase a second vehicle for his minibus taxi business. With a loan from Kiva to match his savings, he will be able to purchase his second minibus and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a second minibus and expand a taxi business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac S. is 43 years old and is married with 5 children. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been processing and milling palm kernels since 1998. Isaac needs a loan of $1,200 to put up a building to house  his new processing plant machinery.

loans.use: To erect a building for processing machinery

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa lives in her own home with her son in the Orion building of the Sopocachi district in the city of La Paz. She went to a Hospitality School where she received recognition for her hard work, which is why she runs a business catering to events such as weddings, sweet sixteen parties, birthdays etc. The loan that she requests is to purchase raw materials and a potato peeling machine to give a hand to her kitchen help, now that her business is booming.

Her past history indicates that she has been a good client and she has qualified for a new loan. She has been a client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa vive en casa propia con su hijo en el Edificio Orión de la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella estudio en la escuela Hotelera lugar donde por su esmero en la cocina consiguió prestigio por lo cual se dedica a la atención de eventos como ser matrimonios, 15 años, Cumpleaños, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos y una maquina para pelar papas ya que su ayudante de cocina no tiene suficiente tiempo, debido a que el negocio está funcionando muy bien. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a potato peeling maching for her catering business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is the enthusiastic mother of a nineteen-year-old daughter.  She has been selling undergarments at a small stand in a crowded alley of central Kumasi for fifteen years.  This is her second loan through Sinapi Aba Trust.  With her first loan, she saw a marked increase in sales.  She plans on using this loan to further increase her inventory of lingerie and to buy better quality products.   With her increased sales, she hopes to save more and support her daughter.  

Felicia is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to help ensure that each member of the group repays their share.  

Felicia is pictured on the right.  To the left is Annastasia, her loan officer.

loans.use: To add more lingerie and different types of undergarments to her inventory

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo lives at home with his parents on Inca Roca Street in the Alto Tacagua district in the city of La Paz with his wife and son. Pablo has a car with which he offers taxi services and with this income he supports his family.

The loan he is requesting is for maintenace repairs for his car so that he may continue working every day, important because it is his only source of income.

His past history indicates that he is a good client and is eligible for a new loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pablo vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y su hijo. Pablo tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como trufi y con estos ingresos mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad para poder seguir trabajando con normalidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance repairs of his taxi cab.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu initially opened her business in her house. With her previous loans from SMT, she diversified the business and purchased rice, peanuts and beans from the village. Kadiatu reinvested some of the profit in her business and used the rest to open a savings account, which she will be able to use for future investments. She is requesting this loan to further expand her business.

Kadiatu is a very savvy business woman. With a little help from Kiva, her business will be well on its way to becoming a sustainable enterprise.

loans.use: To expand an existing, successful business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca lives in Anticretico with her children on Poopo Street in the Alto San Pedro district in the city of La Paz. She sells fruit juices in the Sopocachi district, but her income is supported by a grocery store she set up in her own home run by her eldest daughter.

The loan that she requests is to purchase more items to stock her store, seeing as she is missing many items that her clients have requested.

Her past history indicates that she is a good cleint and is eligible for a new loan. She has been a client since 2007

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca vive en anticretico con sus hijos en la calle Poopo de la zona de Alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; su actividad es la venta de jugos de fruta en la zona de sopocachi, pero sus ingresos son reducidos por lo cual puso una tienda de abarrotes la en su misma casa la cual administra su hija mayor. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería y poder surtir su tienda ya que le falta muchas cosas que le piden los clientes. Su antecedente histórico la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy lives with an employee in her own home on 3 de Mayo Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of La Paz. She sells children's shoes in a store on Graneros Street, a commercial area where many such products are sold.

The requested loan will be used to increase her capital and buy more merchandise, including new models of shoes.

Her credit record is very good, and qualifies her as a good client who can receive a new loan. She has been an IMPRO client since 2000.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz sola con su empleada; la actividad que tiene es la venta de calzados para niños en la calle Graneros, que es un lugar muy comercial donde se venden estos productos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más mercadería y seguir surtiendo sus productos con nuevos modelos.

Su antecedente histórico es muy bueno y la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.

loans.use: To purchase new models of shoes in order to have more variety in her store.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a fifty-five year old mother of three children and one grandchild.  She has operated a clothing stand in the Adehyeman market in central Kumasi for seven years.  This is her first loan through Sinapi Aba Trust.  She would like to use the proceeds of her loan to increase her inventory of clothing.  She is currently participating in Sinapi's pre-loan business training and remarked that this is the first time she has ever received any formal business training.   

She hopes that this loan will increase her standard of living by giving her more disposable income.  She has yet to register with Ghana's National Health Insurance Scheme but would like to use her planned additional income to register.

Afia is a member of the trust group Genesis.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral to ensure that each member repays his or her share of the loan.

Afia is pictured in the center.  To the left is Joshua, the Kiva Coordinator at Sinapi Aba Trust.  To the right is Annastasia, her loan officer.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes

loans.name: Michael I.

texts.en:
Michael is 53 years old and married with 4 children. He is a college lecturer in Makeni, Sierra Leone.

After saving for many years, Michael purchased a plot of land and started constructing a family house. However, he could not complete the house due to a lack of money. His salary is small and it would take him years to save up the entire amount needed. Michael is therefore requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheets and timber to finish his house. He will be able repay the loan by instalments from his monthly salary.

A little assistance from Kiva would go a long way in helping Michael achieve his dream.

loans.use: To purchase building materials necessary for the completion of a family home

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives with her husband and children in her own home on Adolfo Gonzales Street, in the Sopocachi area of La Paz. In the morning she works as a salewoman in a store in the city of El Alto, and in the afternoon she sells jerseys for men and women. The loan she has requested will be used to increase her capital and to buy more jerseys, since her business is doing quite well.

María has good credit history, and has been approved for a new loan. She has been our client since 2007.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en casa propia en la calle Adolfo Gonzáles de la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos. Ella trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de la ciudad de El Alto por las mañanas y por las tardes su actividad es la venta de chompas para damas y caballeros; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más chompas ya que en este negocio le esta yendo bien.

El antecedente es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To purchase jerseys to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata started her business at the age of 21. She is now married with 3 children. Her husband is a police officer, but his income is insufficient to meet family expenses. Fatmata’s business plays a crucial role in supplementing the family income.

With previous loans from SMT, she expanded her business and paid her children’s school fees. Her good repayment record has enabled her to request an individual loan, which she will use to complete the construction of their family home.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a successful business woman's family home

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Ms. Tamara is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 45, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Tamara and her husband owns a small herd of cattle. On Saturdays, she sells the animals she breeds, buys calves, and starts to breed them again. The business is going well, but needs some improvements. Tamara plans to increase the number of calves she purchases to increase her income. Her family expenditures are increasing as her children grow. Tamara has applied to receive a $600 loan and has been approved by the Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will let her change her family life.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is a trader who sells sugar, rice, yam, maize, and Gari. She prepares kenkey and fried fish for sale. She is married to a fisherman and has four children. She wants to expand her business and also increase sales.

She is asking for $325 as an additional capital to purchase more stock for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more stock for her food staples business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41554

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is 48 years old. He is married and has 7 children.  He owns a store selling rice in the Makeni town market and is requesting this loan so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To expand an existing business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman owns a fresh fish business in the Makeni town market.  He has freezer storage for preserving the fish, and distributes them to retailers and trading centres.  His capital is insufficient to meet public demand; therefore, he is requesting a loan to increase his stock of fresh fish.

loans.use: To increase stock to meet customer demand and earn additional income

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is a professional mechanic.  He owns a workshop in Makeni town and also provides transport services to the public.  Foday would like to diversify and expand his workshop by opening a shop selling spare parts.

loans.use: To diversify his business to include auto parts for sale in addition to offering mechanic services

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is 30 years old and is married with 4 children.  Her husband is a petty trader in the same town and both are working together to improve their economic status and financial well-being.  With her previous loan from SMT, Mariama increased her stock and, as a result, realized an increase in profit.  She would like to diversify her business and a loan from Kiva would greatly increase her chances for success. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of Le. 2,000,000.

loans.use: To further diversify her selection of food items

loans.name: Nyma

texts.en: Nyma is 32 years old and is married with 3 children.  Nyma sells food in the Kabala town market of Sierra Leone and has been running the business for three years.  With her previous loan from SMT, Nyma diversified the business; as a result, her profit increased and thereby enabled her to provide for the basic needs of her family.  She would like to increase her stock and produce tie dye materials to increase her income.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock of food products and to further diversify her business to include the creation and selling of tie dye materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a cosmetic saleswoman and also deals in used clothing sales. She is married and has three children. Her business is doing very well but her capital is insufficient to purchase goods to meet the needs of her customers.

She is asking for $525 in additional capital to enable her buy more cosmetics and second-hand clothing to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: As an additional capital to enable her buy more cosmetics and second-hand clothing to meet the demand of her customers.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41560

loans.name: Aghigat

texts.en: Ms. Aghigat owns a household items store in the small town of Saatli, which is located on the central regiion of Azerbaijan. Aghigat is a widow with one child and is looking for funding so that she can expand her inventory to cover a wider range of household goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of items for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva lives with her husband and children on Buenos Aires Avenue in the San Martin area of La Paz. Her husband drives a bus, and Eva makes homemade sweets, which are used in "sahumerios y challas." This refers to the religious practice of making offerings to Mother Earth in order to protect people's belongings (e.g. their houses or land). She has earned her living from this business for many years.

Eva will use the requested loan to purchase ingredients and materials in bulk so that she can continue to make these sweets. The prices of these goods are increasing every day, due to the inflation that currently afflicts Bolivia.

Because of her good credit record, Eva has been approved for a new loan. Eva paid back her first Kiva loan in full.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Eva vive con su esposo e hijos en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja con un micro y Eva realiza la actividad de la elaboración de dulces artesanales que se utilizan en sahumerios y challas (son nombres que se dan a la creencia religiosa de pagar a la Madre Tierra para que ayude a que no pase nada malo con las pertenencias de las personas, como sus tierras, sus casas, etc.), negocio con el cual genera sus ingresos desde hace mucho tiempo.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material e insumos en mayor cantidad para seguir elaborando estos dulces, pues los precios de dichos insumos están subiendo cada día más debido a la inflación que acosa nuestro país.

Por su antecedente histórico, Eva califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito. Eva obtuvo un anterior crédito vía Kiva, el cual está pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and ingredients to make homemade sweets, which will be sold for use in religious ceremonies.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en: Ms. Safiya is a resident of Saatli region. She lives in the village of Soltanabad. She is 41 years old. Safiya is married and has 3 children. Safiya established her business in 1989 and, since then, has been successfully running it. She breeds cows and then sells them to the local butcher. Safiya wants to buy more cows to expand her business. Therefore, Safiya has applied to theSaatli brunch of Normicro for a loan of $600 USD for a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase provisions and fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and fix his motorbikes

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia Q. is a hairdresser. She is a divorcee with one child. Her customers are increasing but she lacks enough funds to buy more creams and other items she needs to keep the business running smoothly.

She is asking for $325 as an additional capital to buy more creams, artificial hair, TCP, and other items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more creams, artificial hair, TCP, and other items for the expansion of her business

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41566

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for the school year

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Mr. Khalid is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 18 and lives with his people in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Khalid has a small shop that sells mobile phones. He cannot develop his business, because he has no collateral to get a loan from commercial banks. That is why he applied for a $500 loan (free of collateral) from the Normicro Saatli branch and now he is waiting for some investments from KIVA lenders to increase the variety of goods he sells. The higher income could help him to develop business and support his family independently.

loans.use: To increase variety of items in his store

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel M. is a trader who owns a chop bar. He is also a painter. He is married and has two children. He wishes to expand his chop bar business but lacks enough funds.

He is asking for $225 as additional capital to enable him buy more food items for his chop bar business.

loans.use: As additional capitals to enable him buy more food items for his chop bar business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41569

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en:
Ms. Ofeliya is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 45, single, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ofeliya sells inexpensive items that she buys in the wholesale market. Every day, she purchases goods from the market and distributes them to her neighbors. Ofeliya is a hard-working entrepreneur. She sells the goods quickly and efficiently, and she has the free time and determination to make it useful. But she has very little capital to run her business. This year, she has applied to the Normicro micro-credit organization for $500 USD.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. is a baker. She is married to a mason and has seven dependents. She wishes to increase production and sales, but prices of raw materials have increased, which is making her target difficult to achieve.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to enable her to purchase more flour, margarine, and other raw materials for the baking of bread.

loans.use: As an additional capital to enable her to purchase more flour, margarine, and other raw materials for the baking of bread.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41571

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans A. is an electrician by profession and sells electrical parts, phones and phone accessories. He is a divorcee with two children. Business is doing very well. He plans to increase sales but lacks funds.

He is asking for $425 as additional funds to purchase more phones and accessories.

loans.use: Additional funds to purchase more phones and accessories.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41572

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is a trader who sells rice, cassava, and plantains. She also prepares food for sale. She is married and has two children. She wants to increase her income to help support the family’s financial needs.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to purchase more stock and food items for her food production and sales.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more stock and food items for her food production and sales.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41573

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase production and fix his cart

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent of two children. She wants to increase her income to enable her to meet the needs of her children.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Janett Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs. Janet D. is 43 years of age and lives in Laureles Sur with her husband, who is a bricklayer. They have one 24-year-old son. In order to help her husband cover the household expenses, she sells snacks and drinks for a living. At first, she sold drinks and ice cream from her house. Now, however, she also sells her snacks at the nearby schools. Little by little, her business has been growing, and she aspires to eventually turn it into a cafeteria. With the support of her construction worker husband’s income and labor, she is requesting a loan in order to build a brick fence on the side of her house, thus making it more secure for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Janet de 43 años de edad vive en Laureles Sur, con su esposo de ocupación Albañil, tiene un solo hijo de 24 años de edad y ella para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa trabaja vendiendo refresco y golosinas. Inicialmente vendía en su casa refrescos y helados ahora también manda a los colegios cercanos a vender y asi lleva 4 años creciendo poco a poco en su negocio que aspira convertirlo en una cafeteria . Con el apoyo del ingreso y mano de obra de su esposo que trabaja en construcción solicita un crédito para hacer un muro lateral en su vivienda y hacerla mas segura para ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: Construction of lateral brick fence

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo Pérez is 35 years of age. His wife is a homemaker who takes care of their 7 children. He had his first child at the age of 20, but is trying not to have anymore children because of his difficult financial situation. Nevertheless, he is happy with each and every one of his children. He started his business 6 years ago, going door-to-door in his cart buying and selling scrap metal. He subsequently bought a horse to pull his cart, but he now has a small truck. He has plans to obtain a bigger truck so that he can buy scrap metal in different departments and recycle it. He is sure that he will achieve this goal because at his young age, he has been able to strengthen his business. He is requesting a loan to use half of it for the purchase of scrap metal, and the other half to replace the deteriorated roof of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Reynaldo Pérez de 35 años de edad es casado y su esposa es ama de casa y se ocupa de la numerosa familia de 7 hijos que tienen, el primero lo tuvo a los 20 años y está tratando no tener mas hijos ya que la situación esta difícil, pero no deja de estar feliz con cada uno de ellos. Su negocio de chatarra lo inicio hace 6 años con un carretón de casa en casa comprando chatarra para luego venderla, posteriormente compro un caballo que jalaba un carretón y ahora tiene una camionetita, tiene proyectos de tener un camión para comprar chatarra en los departamentos y reciclarla y está seguro de lograrlo puesto que a su corta edad ha logrado fortalecer su negocio. Solicita un crédito para ocuparlo la mitad para compra de chatarra y la otra mitad para cambiar el techo de su casa que está muy deteriorado.

loans.use: Invest in his business and repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Francisco Alonso

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco C. is 58 years of age and lives in the neighborhood called Gertrudis Áreas. He is a single father of 6 children, since his wife passed away a couple of years ago. In order to support his children, he sells merchandise in the districts and now has a moto-taxi (a taxi pulled by a motorcycle). He has been working for 38 years. While he is away, his older children take care of both the younger children and the house. Through much hard work, he takes care of his children, much like his children take care of him. Facing the loss of a mother and a wife, the family has unified in order to keep moving forward. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. Buying his merchandise in cash will be more cost-effective, and he will be able to earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco de 58 años de edad, habita en el Barrio llamado Gertrudis Áreas, es padre soltero de 6 hijos ya que su esposa murió hace un par de años. Para mantener a sus hijos vende mercadería en los departamentso y tiene una moto taxi. Trabaja desde hace 38 años, mientras él está fuera sus hijos mayores se encargan de la casa y de cuidar a los pequeños. Con mucho esfuerzo cuida de sus hijos, así como sus hijos cuidan tambien de él, ante la falta de la madre y esposa se han unido para salir adelante. Solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo y comprar mercadería para vender, comprándola de contado le sale más económico y puede sacar mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Purchase of varied merchandise

loans.name: Nubia Elvira

texts.es:
Mrs. Nubia O. is a 43-year-old woman who works in retail. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her husband, who also works in retail. They have a 25-year-old daughter. She and her husband sell clothing in the districts for a living. Her husband started this business before getting married. When they got married, they both moved the business forward. They have had this business for 30 years now, and it has become the family’s means of support. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase wholesale merchandise in the markets, then go out into the other districts to sell it. Working together, they have been able to obtain many customers, especially the stores that prefer to order clothing from them instead of coming to the capital city to make their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Nubia es una mujer dedicada al comercio, de 43 años de edad, vive en el Barrio de Laureles Sur junto a su esposo quien también se dedica al comercio, tienen 1 hija de 25 años de edad. Su actividad es de venta de ropa en los Departamentos junto a su esposo. Este negocio lo inició su esposo cuando aun no estaban casados y al casarse empiezan a sacarlo hacia delante juntos y ya tienen 30 años en el negocio y les ha brindado el sustento diario de la familia. Solicita el préstamo para capital de trabajo, comprar mercadería al por mayor en los mercados y salir a los departamentos del país a venderlos, trabajando juntos han logrado tener una gran clientela en especial de tiendas que prefieren encargarle a ellos la ropa de venta, en lugar de venir ellos a la capital hacer dichas compras.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale merchandise to sell it in the different districts of the country

loans.name: Paubla Francis

texts.es:
Paubla is 31 years of age and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married to a man who works as a security guard, and together they have 2 preschool age children. She works as a housekeeper, and with both salaries, they lead a humble life. She is requesting a loan in order to lay floor tile in their house, thus giving their children more comfort and cleanliness due to the fact that they currently have a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven Paubla de 31 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, tienen 2 hijos pequeños de edad preescolar, ella trabaja como empleada Domestica y con el salario de ambos viven de forma muy humilde. Solicita un crédito para un embaldosado en su casa y que sus hijos estén con mayor comodidad y aseo en vista que su humilde casa tiene piso de tierra.

loans.use: Lay floor tile in her home

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith Barrier D. is an associate of the "Angels" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of Picota, district of Picota. She is dedicated to the manufacture and sale of bricks on her own land located on the Fernando Belaunde Terri Highway.

A native of Jaen, she came to live in the city Picota with her husband, becoming enchanted by these lands where together they decided to start this business.

With the credit of 1,000 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a molding machine for the production of another type of brick, and the difference will be used to be able to pay the people that work with them currently, making the bricks by hand.

She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children that are still in school. She is a very persistent woman, sure of herself and with many aspirations. In the future she hopes to buy a machine to manufacture a greater quantity of bricks with a better finish.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Judith B. D. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Los Ángeles” vive en la Región San Martín provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos en su propio terreno ubicado en la Carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri.

Natural de Jaen, vino a radicar en la ciudad Picota junto a su esposo quedando encantados de estas tierras por lo que juntos deciden instalar este negocio.

Con el crédito de S/. 1 000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una maquina amoldadora para la fabricación de otro tipo de ladrillo, y la diferencia será utilizada para poder pagar a las personas que trabajan con ellos ya por el momento lo hacen manualmente.

Tiene 36 años, vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos que aun están estudiando, ella es una mujer muy perseverante, segura de si misma y con muchas ganas de superación, mas adelante piensa comprar una maquina industrial par fabricar mayor cantidad de ladrillos y con un mejor acabado.

loans.use: To buy a molding machine to make a different kind of brick  for her brick-making business

loans.name: Meg

texts.es:
Meg V. R. is an associate of the “Santa Inés” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of the Picota, district of Picota. Her food store is located in her own house at Francisco Bolognesi Nº 572, where she serves various foods.

In addition to the performance of her duties as the Teacher of primary education of an Educational Center of the locality, and given her know-how in the kitchen, she began a business preparing food for sale with a typical daily menu. Her customers are generally passers-by. She complements this activity with the sale of braised chicken that is a favorite at night.

With the loan of 800 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase non-perishable supplies for the preparation of the various dishes of food that she offers daily to her ample clientele. She will also purchase some new kitchen utensils..

Meg is a very happy and enthusiastic woman of 38 years. She only wants to do well, and, with the humility that she shows, she wants to contribute to the progress of the community that gave her the opportunity to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Meg V. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Inés”, vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia del Picota, distrito de Picota, su local de venta de comida esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr: Francisco Bolognesi Nº 572, donde atiende con variada comida.

Paralelo al desempeño de su profesión como Profesora de educación primaria de un Centro Educativo de la localidad, y dado sus conocimientos sobre cocina instalo un negocio de venta de comida diario tipo menú, cuyos comensales son generalmente transeúntes, complementando esta actividad con la venta de pollo a la braza, que es muy requerido sobre todo por las noches.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses lo invertirá en insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela ,como también renovara sus utensilios de cocina..

Meg, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre con 38 años, que sola supo salir adelante y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the preparation of food for sale and to buy new kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Dolly Valeria

texts.es:
Dolly Valeria T. Marín is an associate of the "Santa Inés" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of Picota, district of Picota, in the area Picota block 8. Her business is located in her own house, where she has installed a wine cellar where she sells general groceries and other daily consumer goods.

She is a teacher of primary education, but she also has a knack for business. Because of this she and her husband invested their savings in a grocery store that did not have the results expected, but they knew that they would overcome this adversity given their perseverance and certainty that they will achieve what they set out to do.

With the credit of 800 soles which will be repaid in a time limit of 4 months, she will buy sugar, rice in bags, preserves in boxes, milk in boxes, soap in boxes, cleaning supplies for the home such as brooms and detergent, personal hygiene supplies, carbonated beverages, water and delicacies that are in great demand among her clients.

Señora Dolly is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is their main support. She is always smiling and has a jolly spirit that has earned the appreciation and loyalty of the inhabitants of the area. In the future she wants to move her business to a place where she could possibly work as an educator.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolly Valeria T. Marín, es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Inés” vive en la Región San Martín provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota, en el Jr: Picota cuadra 8, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en la que tiene instalada una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos de consumo diario.

Es profesora de educación inicial, pero además a ella siempre le gusto el negocio, por lo que junto a su esposo invirtieron los ahorros que tenían en abarrotes que no tuvo los resultados esperados pero supo sobreponerse a la adversidad dado su perseverancia y seguridad que tiene en lograr lo que se propone.

Con el crédito recibido de S/.800.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 4 meses, comprará: azúcar, arroz en sacos, conservas en cajas, leche en cajas, jabón en cajas y artículos de limpieza para el hogar y aseo personal como escobas, detergentes, bebidas gaseosa y golosinas, que tiene mayor demanda entre sus clientes.

La señora Dolly tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quien es su principal apoyo, su espíritu jovial y siempre sonriente hace que se haya ganado el aprecio y la fidelidad de los moradores de la zona, en el futuro quiere llevar su negocio a un lugar donde posiblemente trabaje como docente.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, preserves, milk, soap, cleaning supplies, personal hygiene supplies, carbonated beverages, water and delicacies that are in great demand among her clients for sale in her grocery store.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa lives with her husband and son in the home of her in-laws. Their house is located on Buenos Aires Avenue in the hills of La Paz. Marisa sells clothes for young people, including athletic wear and t-shirts (essentially, whatever is in style). She supports her family with this job, since her husband is unemployed.

The requested loan will go towards purchasing more clothes and offering a wider variety of merchandise for sale.

Because of her good credit history, Marisa has been approved to receive a new loan. She repaid her prior loan from Kiva in full and on time.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marisa vive en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijo; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil como ser deportivos, poleras, en fin, lo que este de moda. Con esta actividad mantiene a su familia ya que el esposo es desempleado.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar más ropa y ofrecer mayor variedad en su mercadería.

Por el estudio de sus antecedentes la señora esta calificada para acceder a un nuevo crédito. El anterior fue muy bien pagado y también fue financiado por a través de Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Genecith

texts.es:
Señora Genecith L. T. is an associate of the "Picota" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Picota, district of Picota. She has a wine cellar that is located in her own house in the settlement of Nueva Unión, a settlement close to Picota, where she sells groceries in general and other edible products for daily consumption. She also sells carbonated beverages.

She started her business with the first crop of corn that she produced, using the profit to invest in buying basic necessities to sell to the general public.

With the loan of 2000 soles that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sugar in bags, sweets in packages, chicken in crates, carbonated beverages (carbonated water), rice in bags, preserved fish in boxes and other products.

She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is known to overcome any difficulty that she is presented and this helps her to go on. She is considered a fighter, persistent and setting a great example for her children by her dedication to her business and unconditional support for her family. She wants to grow her small business by adding a greater quantity and variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Genecith L. T., es socia del Banco Comunal “ Picota” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota tiene una bodega que está ubicada en su propia casa situado en el caserío de Nueva Unión, caserío cercano a la localidad de Picota, donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario, también vende bebidas gasificadas.

Inicio su negocio con la primera cosecha del maíz que hizo producto de su cosecha, con cuya ganancia invirtió en comprar productos de primera necesidad para venderlo al público en general.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará: azúcar en sacos, dulces en paquetes, pollo en jabas y bebidas gasificadas (gaseosa), arroz en sacos, conservas de pescado en cajas y otros productos.

Ella tiene 37 años de edad, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos a sabido salir adelante de cualquier dificultad que se le presenta y eso le permite continuar. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia y quiere hacer crecer su pequeño negocio implementándolo con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, sweets, chicken, carbonated beverages (carbonated water), rice, preserved fish and other products for sale in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an industrial strength sewing machine

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
Mrs. Ginelba M. has 2 children and lives with her husband in her parents’ home on Beni street, in the Challapampa zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a driver while she sells Avon beauty products for a living. She used to sell CD’s (music and movies), but because that business did not generate enough profits, she changed her line of work. She now makes a good profit selling cosmetics.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to stock up on more merchandise due to the fact that her customers demand a wider selection of products.

Because Mrs. M. has a good credit history, she can request a new loan. She has been a member of Impro since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ginelba tiene dos niños y vive con su esposo en la casa de sus padres en la calle Beni de la zona de Challapampa (ciudad de La Paz); el esposo trabaja como chofer y ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza para la mujer). Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de CDs (música y películas), ya que dicho negocio no generaba ingresos suficientes cambió de actividad. Ahora obtiene buenas ganancias por la venta de cosméticos.

El crédito solicitado le permitirá abastecerse de mayor mercadería debido a las exigencias de sus clientes que demandan mayor variedad en la oferta.

La señora tiene buenos antecedentes por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
Señora Jeny Sánchez Flowers is an associate of the “Picota” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region , Province of Picota, district of Picota. Her business is located in the settlement of Nueva Unión, 15km from Picota in the north central part of Peru, in which she sells food daily.

The idea to sell food arose because of the lack of this type of business in the community in which she lives. This service was always needed by the settlers and visitors. It started as something very small but now has grown.

With the loan of 800 soles, to be repaid in full in 6 months, she will buy daily supplies such as sugar, rice in bags, noodles in packages, and meat from chickens, hogs and other animals in order to offer a varied menu to her patrons. She will also buy carbonated beverages in different sizes that are greatly appreciated in the community.

Jeny is a woman of 38 years. She is active and hard-working but with the humility that characterizes her, she is doing well. In this manner she contributes to the progress of her community that gave her the opportunity to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Jeny Sánchez F., es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el caserío de Nueva Unión a 15km de Picota en el Jr: Perú s/n en el que diariamente vende comida.

La idea de vender comida surgió ante la falta de este tipo de negocio en la comunidad en la que vive, era un servicio siempre requerido por los propios pobladores y visitante, se inicio como algo muy pequeño pero ahora ha crecido .

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses lo empleara para comprar los insumos del diario como azúcar, arroz en sacos, fideos en paquetes, carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y así brindar un menú variado a sus pensionistas. También comprará bebidas gasificadas en tamaños diferentes que tiene gran de manda en la comunidad.

Jeny, es una mujer de 38 años, activa, trabajadora que con la humildad que la caracteriza esta saliendo adelante, y de esta manera contribuir al progreso de su comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, meat, carbonated beverages and other supplies for sale in her food store.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Señora Martha luz F. M. is an associate of the “Angels” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region , province of Picota, district of Picota. She is dedicated to the sale of articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children, shoes and medicine in her house located at Simón Bolívar Nº 228, where she attracts a great number of clients.

She started the business selling groceries in her house. But it did not go so well, so she decided to change her activity to the sale of clothes in which she is having very good results.

The loan of 2500 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of clothes for girls, dozens of jeans of different brands for ladies and gentlemen and dozens of shoes that will permit her to satisfy her clients in all their whims and to be always current with fashion.

She is 53 years of age, a native of Picota and has 2 children, both older and independent. She is known for being genteel, attentive with her clients, tranquil and fully confident in what she does. In the future she wants to transfer her business to her own house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha luz F. M., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles”vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos y medicina en su misma casa ubicada en el Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 228. hasta donde llegan gran cantidad de clientes.

Se inicio en el negocio vendiendo abarrotes en su casa, no le fue tan bien, por lo que decidió cambiar de actividad por la venta de ropas en la que si esta teniendo muy buenos resultados.

El préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá para surtir su negocio en la compra de ropas para niñas, pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros por docenas y zapatos por docenas que le permitirán satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 53 años de edad, natural de Picota y 2 hijos, ambos mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace, mas adelante piensa trasladar su negocio a su propia casa.

loans.use: To buy clothes for girls, jeans of different brands for ladies and gentlemen and shoes in large quantities for sale in her clothing store.

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir is an assitant in a small business that makes aluminum furniture, which is sold in Potosí and Sucre. Bladimir is currently studying Business Administration at the Universidad Pública de El Alto. He is living with his mother in the Villa Tunari zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase a computer, which will facilitate Bladimir’s completion of homework and university projects.

This is Bladimir’s third loan with Impro. His excellent credit history allows him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Bladimir es ayudante en una microempresa que fabrica muebles de aluminio, los cuales se comercializan en las ciudades de Potosí y Sucre. Bladimir cursa estudios en la Universidad Pública de El Alto, en la carrera de Administración de Empresas y vive con su madre en la Zona de Villa Tunari (ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito requerido es para la compra de una computadora, la cuál le facilitará hacer sus trabajos prácticos y otro tipo de tareas universitarias.

Este es el tercer crédito que Impro le otorga, su buen comportamiento de pago facilita la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase a computer for educational purposes

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
Señora Baltazara Y. A. is an associate of the “Angels” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, Picota district Picota province. She is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables in the market Nº 02 position 14 of the area. She also sells delicacies in the door of the school that is found in the plaza. The lady has been dedicated to the business since she was very small, when her parents passed away and she took charge of her brothers and studied at night. But she could not finish her studies and began to work in order to get ahead and give her best to what up to now she has continued doing.

With the loan of 1000 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fruits and foods such as bananas in bunches, yucca in bags, crackers in boxes, yogurt, pulp in packages, and sweets in boxes.

Señora Baltazara is 47 years old and has 4 children, 3 of whom are already independent. One child is still in her charge with whom she works and who she takes care of so that he will do well and in order to offer him a better future. She plans to grow a grocery business in her house. She now feels good, pleased to be achieving her goals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Baltazara Y. A., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras en el mercado Nº 02 puesto 14 de la zona, y también vende golosinas en la puerta de la escuela que se encuentra por la plaza, la señora se dedico al negocio desde muy pequeña y cuando sus padres fallecieron se encargo de sus hermanos por las noches estudiaba ella, no pudo concluir y se puso a trabajar para seguir adelante y dar lo mejor de si que hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas como: plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, galletas en cajas, yogurt, pulpin en paquetes, dulces en cajas.

La señora Baltazara tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, 3 ya son independientes y 1 esta a su cargo con quien trabaja y por quien se esmera en salir adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor, dentro de sus planes es incrementar un negocio en su casa de abarrotes, ahora se siente bien, tranquila de estar logrando sus metas.

loans.use: To buy fruits and foods such as bananas, yucca, crackers, yogurt, pulp, and sweets for sale in her food business.
