payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Like many Bolivian women, Tatiana is in the field of public safety; she works as a police officer. She is also studying accounting, which will help her get job promotions in the future. She lives with her mother and two younger brothers in the La Portada area (in the city of La Paz).

The requested loan will go towards the purchase of a computer, which will help her do her accounting assignments.

This is the third time that Tatiana has applied for credit from Impro. Her prompt repayment on previous loans helped her be approved for this loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Al igual que muchas mujeres bolivianas, Tatiana trabaja en el campo de la seguridad ciudadana (es oficial de policía). Igualmente, cursa estudios en un instituto de contabilidad, los cuales le ayudarán en el futuro para ascender a cargos mayores en la institución donde trabaja. Vive con su madre y dos hermanos menores en la zona de La Portada (ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito requerido es para la compra de una computadora, la cuál le servirá para realizar sus trabajos prácticos de contabilidad.

Esta es la tercera vez que solicita crédito con nosotros, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for educational purposes

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba is 30 years old and is married with 4 children.  They live in the village of Kormaslia in Kabala, the Northern Region of Sierra Leone.  Jeneba and her husband are subsistence farmers.  They grow vegetables, peanuts, and rice, but on a very small scale.  With her previous loan from SMT, Jeneba increased her farm field by one hector and doubled the vegetable and rice productions.  Jeneba would like to increase her farm production for family consumption and to generate additional income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire much-needed labourers and to purchase inputs (seeds and fertilizer) for her family's farm.

loans.name: Bangali

texts.en: Bangali lives in Kormasilai village in the Kabala district of Sierra Leone.  He is 40 years old and is a subsistence farmer who grows rice, vegetables, and corn. Bangali has two wives and both work hard with him on the farm.  Because he has 10 children and 2 wives, Bangali needs to work hard to feed the family.  He is very grateful for the services provided by SMT because, with the previous loan he received from SMT, he was able to increase his food production by 30%.  He is seeking another loan to enable him to increase his farming activities.

loans.use: To expand their farming operations further.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: Abdulai Mara is 36 years old and is married with 2 children.  He received a loan from SMT and used the loan proceeds to hire a labourer and to purchase vegetable seeds.  Further, he invested part of that loan to expand his rice farm.  Because of the loan, he was pleased to have harvested 5 additional 50 kilogram bags of rice, and 200 more heads of cabbage.  Not surprisingly, his income increased as a result of the considerable growth he has witnessed on his farm in terms of crop yields.  Abdulai would like to expand his rice farm and is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to do so.

loans.use: To expand his farm to capitalize on the considerable growth on his farm in terms of crop yields

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene works as a driver in the public service. His route connects La Paz and El Alto. This job is his only source of income, and with it he must support his wife and two daughers, both of whom are in school. The family lives in the Tilata (en route to Viacha, in the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase school uniforms and supplies, as well as to prepay living expenses, so that his daughters can go to school without any complications.

This is the second credit for which Impro has approved this client. His prompt repayment on his first loan helped him be approved for this second loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Rene es transportista del servicio público, su ruta esta entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto, dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso la cual cubre la manutención de su esposa y sus dos hijas que asisten a la escuela. La familia vie en la zona de Tilata (camino a Viacha en la Ciudad de El Alto).

El monto del crédito será destinado para la compra de uniforme y material escolar, a esto se suma el pago de las pensiones por adelantado. De esta manera, sus hijas podrán asistir a la escuela sin ningún contratiempo.

Este es el segundo crédito que Impro le otorga a este cliente. Su buen comportamiento de pago facilita la aprobación del préstamo a Rene.

loans.use: Investment in his daughters' education

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a 50-year-old man with 12 children, working as a farmer and as a village teacher in the community of Kormasilai.  He grows pigeon peas, rice, and other vegetables.  He received a loan from SMT and used the loan proceeds to expand his vegetable farm into a swampy area and, as a result, he was able to double his production.  In fact, he claims that his income from the vegetable farm tripled and that the family had more to harvest.  Abubakar would like to expand his rice and pigeon pea farms, so he is seeking a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to pay labourers.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for his farming operation and to hire labourers

loans.name: David A.

texts.en: David is a native of the Makeni town of Sierra Leone but married a woman from Kormasilai village. While visiting in-laws, he heard about the SMT loan program and became interested in settling in the village.  In other words, David moved to Kabala after he learned about the opportunities awaiting him there with respect to farming and the SMT program.  With the approval of the community as guarantor, he accessed a loan from SMT and started a vegetable farm.  David was very happy to have a good harvest and, as a result, he generated an income of Le. 900,000.  He then planted more vegetables near the swamp and will harvest them within a week.  David has completed his repayments and would like to expand his faming activities.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to purchase rice, peanuts and fertilizer, and to hire labourers.

loans.use: To expand his farm and care for his family by purchasing additional inputs and by hiring labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase many types of products

loans.name: Fasineh

texts.en: Fasineh is 36 years old and is married with 5 children.  With a loan he received from SMT, Fasineh purchased planted vegetables for sale.  As a result, he was able to generate Le. 400,000 of net profit.  In turn, he used that profit to purchase 10 bags of pigeon peas for export to Liberia to generate additional income.  As a farmer, he would like to expand his farming operations and activities.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1, 000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase fertilizer and rice for growing purposes.

loans.use: To further expand his farming operation by purchasing additional inputs and by hiring labourers.

loans.name: Dusu

texts.en: Dusu lives in the village of Kormasilia in Sierra Leone.  Her family's livelihood depends on farming. She received a loan from SMT and used the loan proceeds to hire labour and to purchase fertilizer, which increased the farm's output. Dusu was extremely happy to have harvested 25 bags (50Kg) of pigeon peas after she received the loan from SMT because that output was a significant increase over the roughly 10 bags of peas she harvested before the loan.  After she received the SMT loan, Dusu also harvested 1,080 heads of cabbage and earned a good profit.   She would like to expand her farm and is thus requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To continue to support her family through farming by expanding her farm

loans.name: Adelmith

texts.es:
Señora Adelmith Marín Gonzáles is a member of the communal bank called "Los Angeles". She lives in the region of San Martin in the city of Picota. She sells ice-cream such as candy bars, lollipops, melts, gelatin, snow-cones, and candy from the region. She sells her products by the river port in the city of Picota.

She started this business when she was very young. She loves to interact with people. She likes to support herself and to grow as a person/woman.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase ingredients to maker her ice-cream such as gelatin in bulk, sugar, flour, butter and eggs, seasonal fruit and other ingredients.

She is 31 years old and she has 3 children to support. With her good customer service and perseverance, she would like to be able to increase her earnings and her inventory for a better and stable financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelmith Marín Gonzáles es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de refrigerios: como gelatinas, chupetes, refrescos, kekes, humitas , juanes y dulces de la región, en el puerto fluvial de la ciudad de Picota. Se inicio en su negocio desde muy joven por que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. El crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios como: gelatina a granel, azúcar en kilos humitas, harina de trigo preparada, mantequilla, huevos, leche, frutas de la estación y otros ingredientes que empleara para que salga agradable sus preparados. Actualmente tiene 31 años, y tres hijos por quienes velar y luchar, con su amabilidad y encanto que le caracteriza y su perseverancia piensa incrementar un negocio con abarrotes que le de en el futuro una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make ice-cream

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Muhamed G.

texts.en: Muhamed G. C. is 42 years old and is married with 5 children.  He is a farmer who grows vegetables, rice, and beans.  Last season, Muhamed saw an increase in production, especially with rice.  He has already received a loan from SMT and he used the loan proceeds to produce rice and pigeon peas; as a result, his pea harvest increased by 80%, and the rice production increased by 100%.  Muhamed would like to start commercial farming and would like to develop his business slowly over time; simply put, he will need to achieve a greater lever of production, so he will need to hire labourers and purchase additional inputs.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To hire labourers and purchase inputs in order to develop a commercial farming business

loans.name: Yenku

texts.en: Yenku has overcome significant obstacles to get where he is today.  In particular, Yenku is a double-amputee who lost both his hands during the brutal civil war in Sierra Leone.  A 30-year-old father of three, he runs a small grocery stall in Kundibaya village, which is 15 miles from Kabala town.  Before he received a loan from SMT, Yenku survived by begging in the street of Kabala town and, as one might imagine, life was extremely hard for him and his family.  Through lengthy discussions with SMT staff, SMT recognized that Yenku has strong business skills.  Consequently, SMT provided him with a loan of $100 to start a business with a solidarity group comprised of four other war amputees.  Today, Yenku is off the street and is managing his business in the village.  He sells cotton clothes, cosmetics, etc.  Assisted by his wife, the family has built a small mud house and has a small farm.  Yanku’s plan is to build a bright future for his children and his wife, and he would like to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To continue to overcome obstacles by expanding his grocery stall in order to provide for his family

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Señora Albertina S. S. belongs to the communal bank called "Los Angeles". She lives in the region of San Martin is the district of Picota. She has a home business where she sells basic food supplies and snacks.

She started by having her own selling post at the local supermarket, but due to personal reasons, she had to leave it behind. She later decided to run her store out of her own home which she is now slowly repleneshing with products.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, detergents, body soaps and laundry soaps, noodles and chickens.

She is 44 years old. She's a very responsible and good nature woman. She has 2 children to take care of. She considers herself a fighter and is very proud of her accomplishments. In the future, she would like to build her own house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora, Albertina S. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Angeles” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en las Malvinas espaldas del I.S.P.P.P., donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Su negocio lo inicio vendiendo en un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado de la Banda de Shilcayo de Tarapoto y después tuvieron que salir por razones personales y ahora tienen un pequeño negocio en su casa que lo están surtiendo poco a poco. El préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual pagara en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de productos para como: arroz, azúcar en sacos, conservas de diferentes marcas en cajas, detergentes en diferentes presentaciones en paquetes, jabones de lavar ropa y jabones para el cuerpo en cajas, fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, y también comprara pollos para venderlos. Ella tiene 44 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable, alegre y con dos hijos por quienes velar, sus deseos de salir adelante la impulsan a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Se considera luchadora, satisfecha de estar logrando sus objetivos poco a poco, en el futuro quiere construir su casa y incrementar mas su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mayarie

texts.en: Mayarie is 33 years old and is married with 5 children. Mayarie already received a loan from SMT and she used the loan proceeds to hire labour and to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer.  Proudly, she claims that she harvested 15 bags of rice (i.e., 3 times as much as the 5 bags of rice she was harvesting before she received the loan from SMT).  She is very happy and, even though she generates good income and her children have more food than before, she would still like to improve her farm.  As such, Mayarie is seeking a loan of Le. 1,000,000 so that she can hire more labourers and purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.use: To expand her farming operation further by hiring labourers and purchasing additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Lizeth Karina

texts.en:
Lizeth Karina P. G. is a distributor for the cosmetic company Eskia in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. As a representative, Lizeth sells shampoos, perfumes, colognes, soaps, and deodorants. She is very sociable, loves building relationships, and sells her products to her many friends.

Lizeth is 30 years old with one child and happily married. She loves having her own income and the independence of running her own business. Lizeth will continue to look for opportunities to work hard and earn more money for her family.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Lizeth is requesting a loan of s/2000 (US$ 725) to repay over six months. She will use her loan to restock her supply of beauty products.

loans.use: restock her supply of beauty products

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41607

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is 45 years old and is married with 5 children. He grows peanuts and pigeon peas.  Because of a previous loan from SMT, he was able to harvest 8 bags of peanuts and peas, whereas he could only harvest 2 bags of peanuts and peas before he received the loan.  Abubakar would like to improve his farm to generate additional income so that he can pay for his children’s future college expenses.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To improve his farm by purchasing fertilizer for his crops and by hiring labourers to harvest such crops.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana G. V.D. Pezo runs a small business as a distributor for the Esika cosmetic company in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She sells perfumes, deodorants, soaps, shampoos, and moisturizers. Loyal clients incluD. friends, family, neighbors, and the numerous others she has met selling door-to-door.

Juana is a 53-year-old widow with 5 independent children. Now that her husband has passed on and her children are grown, Juana works to support herself and help her family. Before she decided to start her business, she was sad and had little self-confidence; now she knows she can take care of herself and wants to start other businesses as well.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Juana is requesting a loan of s/2100 (US$ 750) to repay over 6 months. Juana will use the loan to buy more beauty products to sell her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell her customers

loans.name: Muhamed T.

texts.en: Muhamed lives in the Kormasilai village of Sierra Leone.  He is 35 years old and is married with five children.  After he received a loan from SMT, he witnessed an increased harvest for the first time in his life.  With the loan, Muhamed expanded his rice farm by hiring labour and, as a result, he harvested 40 bags (50 kg each) of rice.  With the additional income from the harvest, Muhamed opened a small kiosk in the village where his family sells, among other things, items like salt, onions, matchboxes, candies, and sandals.  Accordingly, his family’s standard of living has improved.  He is seeking a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to expand his farming operations, which will enable him to meet his targets for the coming season and, in turn, to generate additional income.

loans.use: To expand his farming operations in order to meet his target for next year's production on his farm.

loans.name: Glendys Melina

texts.en:
Glendys Melina P. G. runs a family business selling spare parts for motorcycles in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She started the business 1 year ago because her husband had business experience and the streets of Pucallpa are jammed with motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.

Glendys is 22 years old with a baby and happily married. She loves being able to work from home where she can take care of her baby and earn money at the same time. Her goal is to continue to invest in her business until they own a large store and employ many people.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Glendys is requesting a loan of s/1200 (US$ 450) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy oil, tires, and more.

loans.use: to buy oil, tires, and more for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma V. D. C. is a talented seamstress and business woman in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. Vilma started her business making custom shirts, pants, pillow covers, sofa covers, bathing suits, and underwear 18 years ago, after taking a sewing class at a local technical school. Over the years she has acquired many loyal customers and created a healthy business.

Vilma is 51 years old with four children and happily married. She loves her business and what it has done for her. Before she had low self confidence and was bored. Now she has many friends and was able to help send her children to school.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Vilma is requesting a loan of s/1500 (US$ 550) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy new fabrics, threads, and elastic. Her dream is to one day have a small factory and employees.

loans.use: buy new fabrics, threads, and elastic

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a single mother of five children and she lives in the Felicita community of Yamasá. To support her children, Antonia sells vegetables, ripe fruit, and fresh chicken. Antonia explains that supporting her children and herself is sometimes challenging, but she expects her business’ achievement will help in increasing her income and allow for putting money aside for any urgent situation.

Antonia wants to keep working hard for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables and other goods for her business

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
Señora Edelmira Leonor García V. is 55 years old. She studied Business Administration. She has one daughter who is independent. She takes care of her 2 grandsons. She lives in the district of Mache de la Provincia in La Libertad, Peru.

She has a brick making business and she also serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to 11 people who at the end of the month will pay her for her services. She used to work for Empresa Ratamas where she would haul in a truck 3 tons of merchandise such as vegetables, gasoline, charcoal and Kerosene. She worked there for about 10 years. She travelled to the U.S. to find a better job, but didn't get there and instead found a job at the Venezuelan embassy as a cook. She only stayed in Venezuela for 5 years because she had to come back to her country to take care of her mother since she was very ill. Her mother died, and now she had to take care of her father.

She belongs to the group/club called ' King of Kings' where she obtained her first loan. With this loan she was able to purchase pots and pans.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, paper stuff (napkins) and cement bags. Her biggest dream is to one day have a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira Leonor García V. tiene 55 años de edad, estudio la especialidad de secretariado ejecutivo. Tiene una sola hija que ya no depende de ella, actualmente tiene 2 nietos a su cargo. Vive en el Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio consiste en la fabricación de ladrillos de cemento el cual vende por millar, además tiene 11 personas que atender con desayuno, almuerzo y cena que al cabo de un mes le remuneran por su atención. Su negocio se inicia con la venta de verduras, gas, carbón y kerosene en la Empresa Retamas, trasladaba aproximadamente 3 toneladas de mercadería en un camión, allí trabajó 10 años. Posteriormente viajo al país de EE.UU. en busca de mejoras, consiguió un trabajo como cocinera en la embajada de Venezuela en la OEA permaneció 5 años debido que tuvo que regresar a su país porque su madre se puso mal de salud y ella se sentía en la obligación de cuidarla. Paso el tiempo y su madre falleció, ahora le tocaba cuidar de su padre el cual se quedaba solo. Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey de Reyes” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compró ollas y un perol para preparar algunos potajes. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 que cancelara en cuatro meses comprara un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite, servilletas y para comprar algunas bolsas de cemento. Su mayor sueño es instalar una ferretería en la que esté bien implementada.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare home cooked meals

loans.name: Bangali T.

texts.en: Bangali is 33 years old and has three children who would also like to become commercial farmers.  He already received one loan from SMT and wisely invested 75% of the loan on labour and the remaining 25% on fertilizer.  As a result of that loan, he boasts that he harvested 45 bags of pigeon peas (rather than the 15 bags that he was harvesting before the loan), 20 bags of which he was able to sell to the neighbouring country of Guinea.  Further, his income increased on account of the first loan and he feels fortunate that he will have enough food for his family until next season.  He is seeking this loan to expand his farm.

loans.use: To expand his farm in order to continue to increase production

loans.name: Yndalesia

texts.en:
Yndalesia is forty-four years old and mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Yndalesia sells homemade sweets and cakes to teachers and students of a public high school located in the Felicita community of Yamasá.

Yndalesia says that her children would like to become professionals someday, and she adds that she’d do everything to help them achieve this goal. With her loan, she will buy more raw materials to keep preparing her delicious sweets and cakes in order to increase her revenue and better fend for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her pastry shop

loans.name: Marla Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Marla is 37 years old, married and has three children 9, 6 and 2 years old. Her husband works as a Taxi driver.

Three years ago she opened a convenience store offering a variety of groceries, deli and other products like toilet paper, tooth paste, etc. Her husband is her support and together they work hard to offer their family food and education.This business has helped them through difficult times, especially four months ago when her husband had and accident and was not working for a period of time. Due to this difficult situation they couldn’t increase their convenience store inventory and would like to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marla es una mujer joven de 37 años de edad que vive en Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un Taxi propio, junto han sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos pequeños de 9,6 y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años tiene un Pulpería en la cual vende a su comunidad alimentos como lácteos, enlatados, otros productos como papel higiénico, pasta dental etc. Su esposo es su Principal apoyo, juntos garantizan la educación y alimentación de sus hijos, gracias a la pulpería lograron superar una época difícil que tuvieron hace cuatro meses ya que su esposo se accidentó y estuvo un tiempo sin trabajar, pero los gastos evitaron ampliar su inventario por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar productos y capitalizar mejor su pulpería.

loans.use: To acquire inventory for their convenience store
